rulings: The word 'squadron' here refers only to squadron-class starship cards, not (for example) 'Red Squadron 7'.
Squadron deploy cost considers global modifiers to power like S-foils.
Squadron deploy cost may not be directly modified, such as by Haven.

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.
front.lore: 'The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet.'
front.title: •Dark Approach

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Dark Collaboration or Lone Pilot.  LOST: If two Imperials each with ability > 2 are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
front.lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.
front.title: Dark Dissension

front.gametext: During a battle at a system or sector, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the maneuver number of your starfighter in that battle.
front.lore: Biggs improvised this maneuver shortly after joining the Alliance. By spinning his starfighter while firing all four cannons, he was able to destroy multiple incoming targets.
front.title: •Darklighter Spin

front.gametext: If your [Episode I] Jedi just defeated Maul in lightsaber combat, draw destiny. Add 2 if Qui-Gon out of play. If total > 6, place Maul out of play and you may search your Lost Pile and take any one card into hand. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Despite coming face to face with the first Sith to be seen in a millennia, the young Padawan was still a force to be reckoned with.
front.title: •Darth Maul's Demise

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to increase a character's or creature vehicle's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 3 Force to move one of your characters as a 'react' (free if character is a scout).
front.lore: See Luke run. Run Luke, run!
front.title: •Dash

combo: This card gains immune to attrtion < 6 from Echo Base Garrison

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Dash, who provides ability of 3. During battle, if with another T-47 and about to draw battle destiny, may draw two and choose one. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed.
front.title: •Dash in Rogue 12

rulings: The 'draw two and choose one' text does <u>not</u> play nice with 'draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise' (e.g. Commander Luke Skywalker (V)). These texts cannot be combined. It's almost always best for Light to just draw two battle destiny with Luke, and ignore Dash's text.

When using 'draw two and choose one', any response to an individual destiny draw (such as adding 1 with Heading To The Medical Frigate, or canceling a draw with Grand Moff Tarkin) is a response to a draw immediately after it is made, not a response to a draw being chosen. For example, if Dark cancels a draw or subtracts from a draw, Light can then simply choose the other draw.

combo: Dash Rendar + Outrider + Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Outrider, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and once per battle, may reduce power of one opponent's starship in same battle by power of Outrider for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time.
front.title: •Dash Rendar

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. May move as a 'react'. When in battle with Leebo (or opponent's gangster, [Permanent Weapon] card, or [Maintenance] card), may draw one destiny; subtract that amount from opponent's total power and attrition.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time.
front.title: •Dash Rendar (V)

rulings: Dash's action can only be initiated if attrition exists (opponent successfully completed a battle destiny draw, even if it was a 0).
Dash's action is initiated in the power segment after battle destinies (and any attrition destinies) are drawn.
Dash's action subtracts from attrition against his owner (Light).

combo: Daughter Of Skywalker + Jerus Jannick
Daughter Of Skywalker + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.gametext: Deploys -3 on Tydirium, Endor or Dagobah. May be targeted instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). While at any exterior site, adds one [Light side] icon. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.
front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker

rulings: If searching Reserve Deck with Mind What You Have Learned, may be deployed instead of Luke (thus retargeting the Objective to Leia for remainder of game).
If on table and Mind What You Have Learned currently targeting Luke, may (as a top-level action) retarget the Objective to Leia for remainder of game.
Both sides of the Objective are retargeted to Leia instead of Luke.

front.gametext: While at an Endor site, adds one [Light Side] icon here. During battle, may target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > ability, target is power -2 and its game text is canceled. Your scouts here are immune to Sniper, You Are Beaten, and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.
front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker (V)

rulings: The immunity she grants to scouts applies to herself.

'Immune to Sniper' prevents the control phase sniping function and prevents the place in Lost Pile function of the combo card. It does not prevent the 3 being added to weapon destiny function of the combo card.

combo: Deactivate The Shield Generator+ Major Hewex
Deactivate The Shield Generator + Throw Me Another Charge Adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total.

front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker. Once during your control phase, if you control Bunker with a Rebel, you may attempt to 'blow away' Bunker as follows: Charges! Come On, Come On!: Draw two destiny. Add 3 to total for each Explosive Charge on Bunker. Move! Move! Move!: If total destiny > 12, your characters here may relocate to Back Door for free, Bunker and Landing Platform (if on table) are 'blown away,' opponent loses 8 Force and this card is lost.
front.title: Deactivate The Shield Generator

front.gametext: Light:  Deploy if Death Star Plans completed and and Death Star system not on table. If 'blown away,' Dark Side loses 8 Force.  Dark:  X = parsec of current position (starts at 0). Immune to Revolution. You may move Death Star (hyperspeed = 1).
front.title: •Death Star

canceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

front.gametext: Deploy on any Death Star site(except docking bay). Target one of your droids(not on Death Star). When target reaches Utinni Effect, 'steal' plans. If target then moves to any Yavin 4 site, draw 3 destiny. Retrieve that much lost Force. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: 'What's so important? What's he carrying?' 'The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found.'
front.title: •Death Star Plans

front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

front.gametext: Light:  'Trench Rules' in effect and each of your starfighters is maneuver - 2 here.  Dark:  'Trench Rules' in effect, your weapons fire free and Turbolaser Battery may deploy here.
front.title: •Death Star: Trench

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to total weapon destiny and characters he 'hits' are forfeit=0. Immune to attrition < 2 (< 5 while armed with a blaster).
front.lore: Good-natured patron of Mos Eisley cantina, until the Empire impounded his starship. Expert marksman. Seeking revenge on the Empire.
front.title: •Debnoli

front.gametext: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2. Each of it's weapon destiny draws are +2. Capital starships it hits are power -5.
front.lore: Fleet rear guard. Weapon batteries hard-wired to central targeting processor. Coordinates vicious crossfire against enemy capital starships.
front.title: •Defiance

front.gametext: Light:  'Dejarik Rules' in effect here.  Dark:  'Dejarik Rules' in effect here. Site converted by Imperial Holotable.
front.title: •Dejarik Hologameboard

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Imperial except Vader, Emperor or a stormtrooper. That Imperial is power -2 and its game text is canceled.
front.lore: Repercussions for failure are severe in the Imperial military. Many officers prefer demotion to 'alternative' punishment from Darth Vader.
front.title: Demotion

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Deneb Both + Draw Their Fire

front.gametext: When deployed, draw up to 2 cards from top of Reserve Deck. Unless Graak on table, while at a battleground and opponent is losing Force from Force drains at same or adjacent site, lost Force must come from Force Pile, if possible.
front.lore: Shy Ithorian forester. She seeks to leave Tatooine for a better life. Firm adherent to Ithorian philosophy of planting two trees for every one harvested.
front.title: •Deneb Both

combo: Depa Billaba + Are You Brain Dead?!
Depa Billaba + Encampment or Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.
Depa Billaba + Smoke Screen

front.gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and once per turn may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of any Reserve Deck and place that card on top of owner's Reserve Deck or Used Pile.
front.lore: Chalactan Jedi Master who was rescued by Mace Windu from space pirates when she was six months old. Jedi Council member who is renowned for her insights.
front.title: •Depa Billaba

front.gametext: If at least two [Light Side] icons here, once during your control phase may draw top card of Reserve Deck. If at least two [Dark Side] icons here, may forfeit in place of your hit non-Jedi character present with Depa (forfeit for 0), restoring that character to normal.
front.lore: Chalactan Jedi Master who was rescued by Mace Windu from space pirates when she was six months old. Jedi Council member who is renowned for her insights.
front.title: •Depa Billaba (V)

rulings: When using her text to forfeit in place of a hit non-Jedi character, Depa forfeits using a substituted value of 0. This cannot be circumvented by cards such as First Aid.

front.gametext: Power +2 when at same site as Biggs. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if a Star Destroyer is at same location). When piloting Rogue 4, also adds 2 to maneuver.
front.lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport Rand Ecliptic. Served in the Ecliptic Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.
front.title: •Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 4 (or any X-wing), draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is Rogue Blaster (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit and its forfeit = 0, if destiny + 1 > defense value).
front.lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport Rand Ecliptic. Served in the Ecliptic Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.
front.title: •Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian (V)

front.gametext: During your turn, if either player just placed a card in a Used Pile, deploy on table. All Used Piles are immediately re-circulated. When any player places one or more cards in a Used Pile, Immediate Effect canceled.
front.lore: Jedi training is a journey into the depths of an apprentice's subconscious, where one must learn to use the Force wisely. 'A Jedi's strength flows from the Force.'
front.title: •Descent Into The Dark

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Light:  Your Jawas may deploy here. Sandwhirl here moves only if on Tatooine. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel or Naboo.  Dark:  Each of your battle destiny draws is -1 here. Sandwhirl here moves only if on Tatooine. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel or Naboo.
front.title: <>Desert

cancels: The Shield Doors Must Be Closed

front.gametext: During your move phase, relocate one of your characters (unless Disarmed) from Weather Vane to any Cloud City site. Character may not move for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
front.lore: If only someone had given Luke a hand.
front.title: Desperate Reach

cancels: All opponent's immunity to attrition for remainder of battle

front.gametext: If your vehicle weapon was just fired during a battle, add one battle destiny. OR During a battle at a site where you have an artillery weapon or vehicle weapon, cancel all opponent's immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Members of the Rebel Alliance are willing to make a perilous frontal attack for their cause.
front.title: •Desperate Tactics

front.gametext: During a battle where your opponent has more characters participating than you, fire (for free) one blaster that cannot fire repeatedly, even if that blaster was already fired this battle. Add 1 to your total weapon destiny.
front.lore: Han's best tactic when outnumbered? Shoot first and don't worry about asking questions later.
front.title: •Desperate Times

front.gametext: Power +2 at Mos Eisley, any mobile site or any docking bay. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When playing sabacc, may use clone cards to 'clone' his own destiny number.
front.lore: Adept at sneaking through corridors and alleyways. Devaronians frequently surprise opponents. Regarded as drunkards, gamblers and fools by many species.
front.title: Devaronian

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.gametext: If present where an opponent's character just fired a weapon, may use 1 Force to utilize Dice's poison stinger (once per turn). Target that character and draw destiny. If destiny = ability, target is 'hit.'
front.lore: Female companion of Lak Sivrak. A Florn lamproid. Dangerous predator with a poison stinger. Rumored to have mysterious time-shifting attunement to the Force.
front.title: •Dice Ibegon

combo: You Do Have Your Moments (V) - Cause a redraw, triggering Dice's text again.

front.gametext: Power +2 at a Jabba's Palace or Endor site. If just lost, place Dice in Used Pile. if opponent is about to draw destiny for an Interrupt targeting your character here, opponent must first lose 1 Force then shuffle their Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Female companion of Lak Sivrak. A Florn lamproid. Dangerous predator with a poison stinger. Rumored to have mysterious time-shifting attunement to the Force.
front.title: •Dice Ibegon (V)

rulings: Last sentence triggers once per destiny draw, not once per interrupt. For example, a Maul Strikes duel triggers for each destiny draw.
If opponent's destiny is canceled and redrawn (e.g. by Sith Fury (V)), the new draw will trigger Dice Ibegon (V) again.
If opponent wishes to use a substituted destiny draw, they must first satisfy Dice Ibegon's trigger.

back.gametext: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan:Deploy Tatooine system (with Tantive IV, non-[Reflections 2] R2-D2, and Stolen Data Tapes there) and Dune Sea.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Sandwhirl or [Episode I] Jedi.{While} this side up, your Force drains at Tatooine system are -1. Once per turn, may deploy Alderaan or a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Until the start of your turn, Tantive IV may be forfeited to satisfy all battle damage against you.{Flip} this card if Stolen Data Tapes 'delivered' and Rebels control two battlegrounds (a site and a system).A Weakness Can Be Found:{While} this this side up, your total battle destiny is +X, where X = number of battlegrounds occupied by Rebels of ability < 4. Once per turn, may deploy Alderaan or a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if you just won a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy a battleground site and a battleground system (or you do not control any locations).

front.gametext: If you have a piloted starship armed with a starship weapon, select one opponent's starship present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Dark Maneuvers.
front.lore: 'I got 'im! I got 'im!'
front.title: •Direct Assault

combo: Disarmed + Rebel Barrier

front.gametext: If both players have a character with a weapon present at same site, deploy on that opponent's character during any control phase. Character loses all weapons, is power -1 and may no longer carry weapons. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: When Dr. Evazan and Ponda Baba confronted Luke in the Cantina, Obi-Wan pointed out, 'This little one isn't worth the effort.' A brawl ensued.
front.title: Disarmed

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Character loses all weapons, including permanent weapons.
If Disarmed is removed, any permanent weapon(s) are restored.
During persona replacement, for power comparison purposes, reduces the power of only the on-table character card, not the new version.
During persona replacement, transfers to the new version of the character.

front.gametext: If you have a character with a weapon at same site as any creature (except Space Slug), deploy on that creature during any deploy phase, Creature is Disarmed (each time ferocity is calculated, draw destiny, subtract that amount). (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Luke's defensive maneuver put him out of arm's way.
front.title: Disarming Creature

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on a droid with armor (free on IG-88). At end of any opponent's turn, droid is immediately lost if present with an Imperial (or with a bounty hunter if droid is IG-88).
front.lore: After losing control of several extremely powerful and deadly assassin droids, the Empire issued a decree ordering their immediate destruction.
front.title: •Dismantle On Sight

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

underlyingCardFor.title: Hunt For The Droid General / He's A Coward

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior (1 on your non-unique warrior). May target a character or creature using 2 Force (for free if on your non-unique warrior). Draw Destiny. Target lost if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Illegal weapon easily purchased by Rebel suppliers on the black market. Rechargeable energy packs make it a cost-effective weapon.
front.title: Disruptor Pistol

front.gametext: If your starfighter with a pilot character aboard is in a battle, target an opponent's starfighter present that has no characters aboard. For remainder of battle, both starfighters are power = 0, and target starfighter is forfeit = 0. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Rebel pilots understand that what they lack in numbers, they must make up for in strategy. They often use diversions to remove dangerous opponents from a conflict.
front.title: •Diversionary Tactics

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. Also, when and player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A Jedi may choose to intervene in the natural course of events, but must accept responsibility for the consequences.
front.title: •Do, Or Do Not

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

cards.counterpart: There Is No Try - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: Plays on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force.
front.lore: A Jedi may choose to intervene in the natural course of events, but must accept responsibility for the consequences.
front.title: •Do, Or Do Not

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. Your Immediate Effects may deploy for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.title: •Do, Or Do Not & •Wise Advice

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Docking And Repair Facilities + Corporal Marmor Corporal Marmor reduces X by 3 on Docking And Repair Facilities when a Star Cruiser is held there.

front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on your side of table. A starship you just lost may be placed here. Holds one starship at a time. During your deploy phase, may use X Force to bring starship to hand, where X= deploy cost of that starship.
front.lore: Most Rebel frigates are equipped with repair facilities for damaged or disabled starfighters. Capital ships are serviced at larger spaceports.
front.title: •Docking And Repair Facilities

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: A card with asterisk deploy cost is treated as X = 0.
However if any deploy cost is defined (even on another card such as More Dangerous Than You Realize), use the defined cost for X.

combo: Dodge + All My Urchins A good way to make your opponent lose 2 Force for nothing. (l000needles)

front.gametext: If one of your characters of ability > 2 was just targeted by a weapon, subtract 3 from each destiny draw. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at a site against one of your lone characters present, move that character away as a 'react' (for free).
front.lore: Normally parents try to prevent their children from falling down the stairs.
front.title: •Dodge

front.gametext: For each other musician at same site, the ability required to draw battle destiny here increases by 1 for both players.
front.lore: Male Bith musician. Plays Fizz (Dorenian Beshniquel) in Figrin D'an's band. Frustrated by sentients, especially humans, he prefers to work with droids.
front.title: •Doikk Na'ts

rulings: Increases the typical '4 ability' requirement for drawing battle destiny.
Also increases any special requirements such as on A Jedi's Strength.

front.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah: Jungle or Dagobah: Cave. Target a mentor on Dagobah and an apprentice who has completed Jedi Test #2. Attempt when apprentice is present at the end of your turn and none of your cards participated in battles, Force drains or Jedi Tests during that turn. Draw training destiny. If destiny + apprentice's ability > 14, test completed. Place on apprentice. You may subtract 1 from each of opponent's destiny draws.
front.title: Domain Of Evil

front.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended.
front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.
front.title: •Don't Do That Again

What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?
rulings: This will suspend the entire You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points combo card.

pulls: The Time For Our Attack Has Come
What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

cancels: One opponent's battle destiny just drawn by sacrificing (losing) one of your droids in that battle

front.gametext: USED: Cancel 3,720 To 1 if it was just inserted or revealed. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: Cancel one opponent's battle destiny just drawn by sacrificing (losing) one of your droids in that battle.
front.lore: 'We're on our way!'
front.title: •Don't Forget The Droids

front.gametext: If Luke and Han are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at a system or sector, choose one TIE/ln present to be lost.
front.lore: Luke and Han made an effective team when defending the Millennium Falcon with its quad laser cannons against attacking TIE fighters. 'Great kid! Don't get cocky.'
front.title: •Don't Get Cocky

rulings: Second function can only destroy a starship card with TIE/LN in the subtype box (e.g. it can destroy Black 2 or Obsidian 10 but not Saber 1).
The second function can even remove any squadron that contains a TIE/ln, such as Death Star Assault Squadron, Emperor's Shield, Emperor's Sword, or TIE Assault Squadron.

front.gametext: USED: Add 1 to your just-drawn weapon destiny.  STARTING: If you have deployed a battleground, deploy Ultimatum, Scrambled Transmission and/or Do, Or Do Not from Reserve Deck. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Han did not take kindly to Jabba's posturing.
front.title: Don't Tread On Me

rulings: May be played even if the battleground has been converted.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Steven Lewis - PC Volunteer Award 2008)

front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to deploy an Effect that deploys for free on table (or on your side of table) and is always Immune to Alter from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: When drawing your starting hand, draw up to 12 cards instead of 8. Place this Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Han did not take kindly to Jabba's posturing.
front.title: Don't Tread On Me (V)

pulls: Any [Immune to Alter] effect that deploys for free on table (or your side of table)
rulings: Must draw at least 8 cards into opening hand.
May draw additional cards one at a time and review each one before deciding to draw again or not.
Effect cannot have any deploy cost listed in its game text.

canceledBy: We'll Let Fate-a Decide, Huh? (V) - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: If an opponent has just initiated a battle, triple the resulting battle damage for the eventual loser. OR Triple the result of You Overestimate Their Chances.
front.lore: 'Stand-by alert. Death Star approaching. Estimated time to firing range, fifteen minutes.'
front.title: Don't Underestimate Our Chances

rulings: This Interrupt does not triple attrition.

front.gametext: Once per turn, if Amidala at another location, may activate 1 Force. During your move phase, may target an opponent's Undercover spy here and draw two destiny. Choose one (take the other into hand). Target 'breaks cover' if destiny +1 > target's ability.
front.lore: Spy and handmaiden.
front.title: •Dorme

combo: Double Agent + Light Side spy.

front.gametext: If both players have a spy at same site, draw destiny. Add 2 if opponent's spy is Undercover. Opponent's spy is lost if destiny > 2. OR Opponent's Tonnika Sisters present at a site cross to your side.
front.lore: Typical of impersonators, Shada double-crossed everyone. Her true affiliations still remain a mystery.
front.title: Double Agent

front.gametext: If no Dark Jedi is on table, deploy on Death Star system. If Death Star 'blown away,' relocate to opponent's side of table: each Imperial and Imperial starship is deploy +8 and loses immunity to attrition. Canceled if a Dark Jedi is deployed. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.
front.title: •Down With The Emperor!

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on table. All immunity to attrition is -3. You may not fire [Permanent Weapon] weapons. If opponent just lost a Dark Jedi or a battle, they lose 1 Force. During your draw phase, use 3 Force or place this Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.
front.title: •Down With The Emperor! (V)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Draw Their Fire + Frozen Assets
Draw Their Fire + Deneb Both

Draw Their Fire + I Did It! If your opponent wants to be able to use any Interrupt in a battle you initiate, they will have to lose 2 Force each turn (provided you meet the conditions on I Did It!). (Psychobabble)

Draw Their Fire + Treva Home If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)
Draw Their Fire + Jawa Siesta

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Whenever a battle is initiated, player initiating battle retrieves 1 Force and defender loses 1 Force. Also, during a battle you initiate, each time opponent plays an interrupt, opponent must first use 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'I'm going to cut across the axis and try and draw their fire.'
front.title: •Draw Their Fire

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Dresselian Commando + Dresselian Commando + any Jedi + Jedi Presence

front.gametext: Power +1 when at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site. When in battle at an exterior site against a non-unique alien, adds one destiny to power only, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny and is immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Dresselians combat their homeworld's subjugation with supplies provided by Bothans. The Alliance uses their talents as resistance fighters. These scouts prefer to work alone.
front.title: Dresselian Commando

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

canceledBy: Game text canceled by Empire's New Order

front.gametext: Spaceport Speeders may be played at same site. Once per game, may do one of the following: activate 1 Force when you deploy a droid OR retrieve 1 Force when you deploy an astromech to a starfighter.
front.lore: Careful manipulator of funds and Imperial taxation codes. Buys droids from Jawas and sells them to the Alliance.
front.title: •••Droid Merchant

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.gametext: Deploy on one of your R-unit droids. During any control phase, you may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. Also, if on Dagobah, droid may move for free.
front.lore: Full-spectrum transceiver for R-unit droids including electro-photo receptors, DERs and heat and motion detectors. Data is routed directly to droids Intellex IV internal computer.
front.title: Droid Sensorscope

front.gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit,' lost or captured. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn.
front.lore: If low on energy and unable to recharge, a droid can shutdown active systems to conserve power.
front.title: Droid Shutdown

rulings: If canceling an attempt to fire a weapon at a droid, play during the response step (before weapon destiny is drawn).
The phrase 'Droid is protected' means that further attempts are not allowed (they are prevented, not canceled).

combo: Droopy McCool + 3 Kitonaks at same site

front.gametext: Power +2 at any desert or Tatooine site. Immune to Gravel Storm, Sandwhirl and desert landspeed requirements. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Kitonaks are forfeit +2. Immune to attrition < number of your musicians on table.
front.lore: Kitonak musician. Lead jizz wailer. Searching for other Kitonak rumored to be living on Tatooine. Rarely uses his real name, Snit.
front.title: •Droopy McCool

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your T-47. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character or creature. Add 2 if targeting a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Sund x2-100 laser cannon. Popular among outlaw organizations because it is both cheap and powerful. Frequently mounted on T-47 airspeeders.
front.title: Dual Laser Cannon

combo: Dune Sea Sabacc + R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea
Dune Sea Sabacc + Lift Tube Escape + Lift Tube These two cards can be tracked pretty easily for perfect Sabacc. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.gametext: Requirements: A Jawa at a Tatooine site. Wild cards (0-7): Sandcrawler sites, Magnetic Suction Tube, Jawa Siesta and Jawa Pack. Clone cards: Tatooine locations, sandcrawlers, Jawa weapons, and Utinni! Stakes: One device or droid with out armor.
front.lore: R'kik D'nec remains undefeated in this version of sabacc. Or at least there are no witnesses to the contrary.
front.title: •Dune Sea Sabacc

combo: Dutch + Pops + Tiree
Dutch + Gold 1
Dutch + Tiree + Gold 2

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Gold Squadron pilot at same location.
front.lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron leader at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.
front.title: •Dutch

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if Gold 1). While piloting a Y-Wing, for each Y-wing you have in a battle, attrition against opponent is +1 and attrition against your is -1. Y-wing pilots are forfeit +1 here.
front.lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron leader at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.
front.title: •Dutch (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Rogue T-47s are immune to attrition < 4 (or < 6 if matching pilot aboard). Once during each of your turns, may take one maintenance droid, Bacta Tank, Lone Rogue, [Hoth] Luke, [Special Edition] Wedge, Zev or Hobbie into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'All troop carriers will assemble at the North Entrance. The heavy Transport ships will leave as soon as they're loaded.'
front.title: •Echo Base Garrison

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Echo Base Operations + Echo Base Command Center + any Droid + How Did We Get Into This Mess?
Echo Base Operations + Kessel + 3 Y-wings + Y-wing Assault Squadron

front.gametext: Deploy on Main Power Generators if you occupy at least three Echo sites. At every system location, you deploy is -1, your Force drains are +2 and your total power is +3 in battles. Effect canceled if opponent occupies five Hoth sites. (Immune to Alter.).
front.lore: Following the Battle of Yavin, the Alliance garnered the support of systems ready to oppose the Empire. Echo Base provides a command center for focusing that support.
front.title: •Echo Base Operations

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on North Ridge if Main Power Generators on table. When opponent deploys a character or vehicle to a marker site, activate 1 Force and that card may not move that turn. Effect lost if opponent occupies an Echo site, or your Ice Storm on table. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'The sensors are in place. You'll know if anything comes around.'
front.title: •Echo Base Sensors

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Echo Base Trooper + Hoth: Defensive Perimeter + Echo Base Trooper Officer
Echo Base Troopers + General Carlist Rieekan + any Leia + Leia Of Alderaan

front.gametext: Deploy only on Hoth, but may move elsewhere. Power -1 when at a site other than a Hoth site.
front.lore: The personnel assigned to protect Echo Base are veteran warriors. Troopers such as Jess Allashane are trained to counter Imperial tactics in cold environment.
front.title: Echo Base Trooper

front.gametext: Deploy only on Hoth but may move elsewhere. Echo Base Troopers deploy -1 to same site. Your troopers may move to same Hoth site as a 'react.'
front.lore: Like many Rebel specialists, Trey Callum defected from the Imperial officer corps. Trooper officers are masters at stretching the meager resources of the Rebellion.
front.title: •••Echo Base Trooper Officer

front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your warrior (Free on your Echo Base trooper). May target a character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force (1 if fired by an Echo Base trooper). Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: BlasTech A295 blaster rifle. Standard-issue longarm at Echo Base. Highly accurate with good range. Favored by marksmen and snipers in a hostile environment.
front.title: Echo Base Trooper Rifle

front.gametext: Deploy on your trooper. May use any number of weapons and devices. Trooper is immune to attrition < 3 when at a planet site.
front.lore: Rebels carry a variety of equipment to be fully prepared for enemies and the elements. Weather-resistant backpacks keep gear protected and operational.
front.title: Echo Trooper Backpack

rulings: Does not allow the character to use weapons/devices that they cannot use otherwise.

combo: Effective Repairs + Death Star Plans or Rycar's Run or Kessel Run or Our Most Desperate Hour
Effective Repairs + Uncontrollable Fury
Effective Repairs + Civil Disorder

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Limited Resources.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve into hand one Effect of any kind.
front.lore: When the nav computer maintenance program failed to auto-repair the hyperdrive, Han decided to take matters into his own hand.
front.title: Effective Repairs

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Broken Concentration, Lateral Damage, or Limited Resources. OR Place a card just stacked on Droid Racks or Strategic Reserves in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Sense) OR If you just drew a starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve an Effect of any kind or a non-[Maintenance] starship into hand.
front.title: Effective Repairs & Starship Levitation

combo: EG-4 (Eegee-Four) + Off The Edge + Cloud City: Incinerator

front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. * Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).
front.lore: Very popular droid on inhospitable worlds. Rugged design. Modified top-mounted power sockets. Donated to the Alliance by the Bothan underground.
front.title: EG-4 (Eegee-Four)

rulings: Doubles total power at a location, including modifiers.
Does not double any power destiny / battle destiny draws.
Does not double attrition.

combo: Egregious Pilot Error + Collision
Egregious Pilot Error + Rebel Barrier

front.gametext: During opponent's control phase, if opponent has two or more capital starships at a system or sector together, draw destiny. If destiny -1 < number of those starships, they may not move or participate in battle until end of your next turn.
front.lore: Details of the notorious 'Incident at Anoat' are required reading at the Imperial Academy of Raithal, where the pilots' names are posthumously displayed.
front.title: •Egregious Pilot Error

front.gametext: Opponent chooses: opponent may activate up to 2 Force and you may activate up to 4 Force, or opponent retrieves 1 Force and you retrieve 3 Force.
front.lore: 'Deal!'
front.title: •Either Way, You Win

rulings: To initiate this Interrupt, each player needs at least 1 card in Reserve Deck.
Empty Lost Piles do not prevent playing this Interrupt.
If the activation option is chosen, each player may still decline to activate anything.

underlyingCardFor.title: Master Qui-Gon Jinn, An Old Friend

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to target a starfighter having one or more permanent pilots. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, deploy on starfighter to remove all permanent pilots (otherwise, Effect is lost). May add 1 pilot for each permanent pilot removed. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Guiderhouser ejection seat has saved many pilots from their exploding starships. However, system malfunctions have sometimes caused spontaneous ejection.
front.title: Eject! Eject!

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: If this card removes a unique permanent pilot, that persona's uniqueness still applies (e.g. if played on Gold Leader In Gold 1, the character Dutch still cannot be deployed).

An unpiloted starship cannot use its game text (e.g. Zuckuss In Mist Hunter cannot use the total battle destiny reset text), but once the starship is piloted again, the starship's game text becomes usable again (except text that specifically says it comes from the removed permanent pilot).

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any warrior. At any time, you may peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck by using 2 Force. You may choose to move that card to the top of your Force Pile.
front.lore: Enhances distant targets using a computer-assisted zoom technology. Provides range information. Works in low-light. Rugged case protects the internal systems.
front.title: Electrobinoculars

front.gametext: Deploy on your Gungan. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, character is power -4 for remainder of turn. At the end of battle here, may place this electropole on top of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Gungan weapon that is very similar to the Force pike. Used to control crowds, wild animals, and the occasional battle droid.
front.title: Electropole

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting an X-wing alone, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and all immunity to attrition here is canceled. Once during your control phase, may take Sabotage into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Abednedo.
front.title: •Ello Asty

front.gametext: Deploy on your non-pilot character (except droids) to give that character [Pilot] skill. Adds 2 to power of anything that character pilots. OR Deploy on your pilot. Adds 1 to power of anything that character pilots. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Like many Duros, Madak has natural piloting and navigation skill. Former scout. Freelance instructor. Makes runs to important trade worlds Celanon, Byblos and Yaga Minor.
front.title: Ellorrs Madak

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: If canceled while character is piloting, character moves to a passenger slot if available, otherwise character is placed in Used Pile.

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 2 to the hyperspeed of any freighter he pilots. During your move phase, may use 1 Force to 'break cover' of opponent's Undercover spy at same site. Cancels Lateral Damage targeting your starship at same or related system.
front.lore: Duros scout and smuggler.
front.title: •Ellorrs Madak, Pilot Instructor

front.gametext: Power +3 at same site as an Imperial. For remainder of game, Plastoid Armor is an Effect, is not unique, is immune to Alter while on table, and it deploys only on a Rebel or alien at same mobile site as Elom (character is now 'disguised').
front.lore: Many Elom commit sabotage and theft against the Empire to avenge the invasion of their homeworld. Experts in adapting stolen equipment for use by the Rebellion.
front.title: Elom

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 7 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Ralltiir system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Piloted Red 7 at the Battle of Yavin. Part of the Griffon flight wing, a Rebel squadron sent to fight the Imperial subjugation of Ralltiir.
front.title: •Elyhek Rue

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any exterior planet site where you have a Rebel or alien. You may deploy characters at this site, even without presence, regardless of location deployment restrictions.
front.lore: Pirates, smugglers and Rebels operate from tiny camps which can be set up quickly and relocated at a moment's notice. A surprise visitor made Luke an unhappy camper.
front.title: <>Encampment

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: This does <u>not</u> circumvent restrictions listed on an Objective (even if the Objective references limiting deployment at certain locations).
This does <u>not</u> circumvent text on a card that says it only deploys if a certain Objective on table.
This does <u>not</u> circumvent rules or text that certain cards cannot <u>exist</u> at certain locations (e.g. no starfighters at Cantina or Endor: Dense Forest).
This does <u>not</u> circumvent deployment restriction text that is entirely unrelated to locations (e.g. Master Kenobi or The Force Is Strong In My Family).
Allows cards to deploy regardless of presence or Force icons.
Allows cards to deploy to Dagobah or Ahch-To.
Allows cards to deploy regardless of their own game text saying they can only deploy to certain locations.
Allows cards to deploy regardless of game text on other cards (except Objectives) saying certain cards may not deploy to certain locations.

cancels: Vader's game text for remainder of turn

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Overseeing It Personally. OR Use 4 Force to cancel Vader's game text for remainder of turn.  LOST: If Emperor just lost from table, draw destiny. Opponent must lose Force equal to the destiny draw.
front.lore: The turning of Vader and the loss of Palpatine was the beginning of a new era for the entire galaxy.
front.title: •End Of A Reign

combo: Endor + Strike Planning Opponent's Force generation at Endor system is canceled unless Endor Operations on table.

front.gametext: Light:  Force drain -1 here. To move your starship here from Sullust, Rendezvous Point or Haven requires -1 Force.  Dark:  If you have no Imperials on Endor, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Endor

combo: Endor (V) + Strike Planning Opponent's Force generation at Endor system is canceled unless Endor Operations on table.

front.gametext: Light:  If you have no Rebels on Endor, Force drain -1 here. If you control, each of opponent's biker scouts is forfeit -1.  Dark:  If you have no Imperials on Endor, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Endor (V)

combo: Endor Celebration + The Planet It's Farthest From  A handy way to convince your opponent to try another planet.

front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Occupation, Cloud City Occupation or Rebel Base Occupation. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your activate phase, activate 1 Force for each Endor battleground you occupy.
front.lore: The Rebel presence on Endor meant that the Ewoks would be able to live free from the Empire's tyranny.
front.title: •Endor Celebration

front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Endor. During battle, your other Rebels here may not have their forfeit reduced unless this card 'hit.' Each time this character is 'hit,' it is cumulatively power -2 until end of turn.
front.lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops. Scout trooper.
front.title: •Endor Commando Team

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.gametext: Power -1 while not on Endor. While Endor Scout Trooper is on Endor, Lieutenant Page and each of your Rebel scouts of ability < 3 at same and adjacent exterior sites are immune to attrition < 2.
front.lore: Rebel troopers receive Scout training that helps them to survive combat in harsh environments. Often protect 'specialists' while they accomplish mission tasks.
front.title: Endor Scout Trooper

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

combo: Endor: Back Door + Fallen Portal

front.gametext: Light:  During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).  Dark:  If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
front.title: •Endor: Back Door

front.gametext: Light:  Force drain +1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.  Dark:  Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Endor: Bunker

front.gametext: Light:  Unless you occupy Bunker (or Back Door), your characters may not deploy here.  Dark:  Once per game, may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Endor: Bunker (V)

combo: Endor: Chief Chirpa's Hut + Chief Chirpa

front.gametext: Light:  Your Ewoks are deploy -1 here. Chief Chirpa deploys free here.  Dark:  If you control Chief Chirpa's Hut, Ewoks at Endor sites are forfeit -1.
front.title: •Endor: Chief Chirpa's Hut

front.gametext: Light:  No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.  Dark:  No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
front.title: •Endor: Dense Forest

combo: Endor: Ewok Village + Wicket + Ewok Spear
Endor: Ewok Village + Catapult + Ewok Sentries

front.gametext: Light:  No starships or vehicles here. Ewok devices and Ewok weapons deploy -1 here.  Dark:  No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.
front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village

front.errataNotes: Original was a 1/1 site instead of 2/1. Original Text: Light: While a Skywalker here, Prophecy Of The Force may not relocate from here.  Dark: No starships or vehicles here.
front.gametext: Light:  No starships or vehicles here. While Prophecy Of The Force with Luke here, it may not relocate.  Dark:  Force drain -1 here. While opponent's [Set 8] Effect with Luke here, your Force generation is -1 here.
front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village (V)

rulings: When Prophecy Of The Force and Luke are here together, Light's text only prevents Prophecy Of The Force from relocating. It does not prevent Luke from moving or relocating.

front.gametext: Light:  Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.  Dark:  Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
front.title: •••Endor: Great Forest

front.gametext: Light:  During your move phase, your scouts may move between here and any exterior Endor site.  Dark:  If you occupy, opponent's Hidden Forest Trail game text is canceled.
front.title: •Endor: Hidden Forest Trail

front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).
front.title: •Endor: Landing Platform (Docking Bay)

front.gametext: Light:  Your starfighters land here for free. Your droids and [Endor] Rebels are deploy -1 here.  Dark:  If you occupy, opponent's Rebel Landing Site game text is canceled.
front.title: •Endor: Rebel Landing Site (Forest)

front.gametext: During your control phase, deploy on Theed Palace Generator Core. No more than one character may deploy to here each turn, and characters may not move to or from here. Immediate Effect lost at end of opponent's turn.
front.lore: Theed security protocol proved to be a deciding variable in the duel of the fates.
front.title: •Energy Walls

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship for 1 Force. Add 1 if targeting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 1. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Often modified by Rebel technicians. Heavy warhead provides increased armor penetration. Decreased maneuverability and effectiveness against starfighters.
front.title: Enhanced Proton Torpedoes

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)
rulings: These are proton torpedoes, and so may be used for Attack Run and work with other cards that target proton torpedoes such as Gold 3, Let's Go Left, and Take This!

front.gametext: During battle, if present at a site with a stormtrooper (or Rebel leader), may add one destiny to total power only. Once per turn, may subtract 1 from a destiny draw of an opponent's Interrupt or weapon targeting a non-Jedi Rebel here.
front.lore: Corellian Corvette trooper Ensign Chad Hilse, an Alderaanian, typifies the loyal Rebel volunteers dedicated to defeating the Empire. Trained in starship and ground combat.
front.title: •Ensign Chad Hilse

front.gametext: USED: Once per game may take Podracer Bay into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: During a battle at Podracer Bay, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: 'What'd he mean by that?' 'I'll tell you later.'
front.title: •Entering The Arena

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand any non-unique Rebel. Rebels may deploy from here as if from hand (if Effect canceled by opponent, any Rebels here may immediately deploy for free.)
front.lore: As the Empire advances, Rebels retreat to fortified positions to marshal their resources and redeploy the troops.
front.title: •Entrenchment

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = ¼. Moves for free. While 'ridden' by Amidala in battle, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Herd animal native to Tatooine. Adults are used as beasts of burden, while the young and elderly eopies are useful for consuming desert weeds.
front.title: Eopie

front.gametext: If your capital starship is about to be lost, relocate your characters aboard to any one planet site.
front.lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).
front.title: Escape Pod

rulings: May not relocate opponent's cards.
May not relocate weapons and devices deployed directly upon a starship or vehicle (e.g. Rectenna or Heavy Turbolaser Battery).

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take a dejarik into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR For remainder of turn, you lose no Force to Cloud City Occupation, Rebel Base Occupation, Tatooine Occupation, That Thing's Operational, You May Start Your Landing, or You'll Be Dead!
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: Escape Pod & We're Doomed

cancels: A Force drain at a holosite

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take a dejarik or holosite into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel a Force drain at a holosite. OR If opponent is about to place your character our of play, place that character in your Lost Pile instead.
front.lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).
front.title: Escape Pod (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on your war room. Once during each of your move phases, your Planet Defender Ion Cannon at same planet may fire. Also, each of your medium transports at same planet is hyperspeed +2, is immune to attrition < 3 and may move for free.
front.lore: 'Give the evacuation code signal...and get to your transports!'
front.title: Evacuation Control

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on table; shuffle your Reserve Deck, peek at top two cards, and stack them face-up here. During battle, may take a card here into hand to prevent all battle destiny draws from being modified or canceled (each player may draw no more than one battle destiny). (Immune to Alter.)
front.title: •I Don't Like Sand

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Preventing destiny draws from being modified even prevents global modifiers such as from the Silence Is Golden (V) and the Senate Objective.

Preventing destiny draws from being modified can be circumvented with a substituted destiny that has been modified <u>before</u> the substitution (e.g. Darklighter Spin on a modified maneuver value, or a senator on Sando Aqua Monster that is already receiving a global modifier from the Senate Objective).

combo: Eventually You'll Lose + Threepio With His Parts Showing

front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, place the top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck.  LOST: Use 3 Force to cause opponent to reveal hand. All cards opponent has 3 or more of in hand are lost.
front.lore: In the end, Watto finally came to understand the agony of defeat.
front.title: •Eventually You'll Lose

front.gametext: If opponent's creature vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to where your Ewok is present, draw destiny. Creature vehicle lost if destiny > defense value. AT-ST crashed if destiny +2 > armor. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, add 2 to your total power.
front.lore: Even an All Terrain Scout Transport cannot stand on all terrain.
front.title: •Ewok And Roll

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Ewok. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each other Ewok present who is armed with an Ewok Bow. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Primitive weapon. Effective in large volleys. Imperial troops are not prepared for such simple tactics.
front.title: Ewok Bow

front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior Endor site. Does not require a power source. Your Ewok present may target a vehicle with armor at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each Ewok present. Target crashes if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Crowning achievement of Chirpa's engineers. Heavy stones from these weapons distracted Imperial AT-ST walkers.
front.title: Ewok Catapult

front.gametext: Deploy on table. At Endor sites where you have an Ewok, your characters are forfeit and defense value +1 (+3 if you have two Ewoks at that site.) In battles at Endor sites where all your ability is provided by Ewoks, add one battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Na na, beecha na noooooooooooooooowa.'
front.title: •Ewok Celebration

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Ewok Glider + Wicket + Ewok Spear This combo can exclude one opponent from battle, make another opponent power 0 and make a third opponent 'hit'.

front.gametext: May add 1 driver (must be an Ewok). Once per turn, when in battle, may target a character or creature present. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value.
front.lore: Primitive flying vehicle used by Ewoks. Used to drop rocks on Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.
front.title: Ewok Glider

front.gametext: If opponent's transport vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to an Endor site, draw destiny. Add 1 for each of your Ewoks present. Vehicle lost if total destiny -1 > defense value. OR Lose 1 Force to take into hand a card you just drew for battle or weapon destiny.
front.lore: Any problem can be solved by the proper application of the principles of mass and velocity.
front.title: •Ewok Log Jam

front.gametext: If your Ewok is present with an escorted captive, draw destiny. Add 2 if Ewok is a scout. If total destiny > escort's defense value, captive is released. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, up to three of your Ewoks at one exterior site may move as a 'react' (for free).
front.lore: Ewoks used superior knowledge of Endor's forested terrain to free commandos captured by Imperial stormtroopers.
front.title: Ewok Rescue

front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. May deploy as a 'react'. May move as a 'react' (for free) to a battle where you have a unique (•) Ewok.
front.lore: Ewok sentries scout the perimeter of their domain. Their watchful eyes search for both predatory animals and invading stormtroopers.
front.title: Ewok Sentry

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

combo: Ewok Spear + Lumat

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Ewok (free on Ewok Spearman). Adds 1 to power. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target's power or ferocity for remainder of turn = 0 if your destiny + Ewok's power > opponent's destiny.
front.lore: Chosen weapon of most Ewok warriors. Pointed tip made of stone or animal horn.
front.title: Ewok Spear

front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When on Endor and present with any other Ewok, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Ewok fighters train with primitive weapons. Their bravery and careful aim helped defeat the Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.
front.title: Ewok Spearman

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

combo: Chief Chirpa + Ewok Tribesman

front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each [Light Side] icon at same Endor site. When forfeited at same site as your Ewok of ability > 1, may satisfy all remaining attrition against you.
front.lore: Members of Chief Chirpa's Ewok tribe are courageous in battle. They seek to impress older members of the tribe.
front.title: Ewok Tribesman

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
rulings: If prevented from being used to satisfy attrition (e.g. by Precision Targeting), his text will not satisfy all remaining attrition.

front.gametext: Deploy on an interior site you occupy. Immune to Overload. Place in Used Pile if opponent controls this site. If you just lost a battle opponent initiated here, may draw destiny. All cards (except Effects) here are lost if destiny > 4 (otherwise, Charge lost).
front.lore: Standard explosive charge carried by Rebel commandos. When used in multiple, these charges have the explosive capacity to level a heavily armored structure.
front.title: Explosive Charge

front.gametext: Deploy beside either player's Lost Pile. That pile is turned face down. Cards from that player's Life Force may not be viewed when they are lost.
front.lore: 'I don't like the look of this.'
front.title: •Eyes In The Dark

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Cards lost from Life Force should not be revealed to either player.
Cards lost from hand or table should be shown to both players before being placed face-down in Lost Pile.
Anything that enables searching the Lost Pile to take or retrieve a card still works normally.
Baragwin may repeatedly check the top card of Lost Pile to see if it is an eligible target for retrieval (unless his action has already retrieved that turn).

front.gametext: Power +1 for each Dark Jedi or Jedi on table. At start of opponent's turn, if at opponent's site, opponent chooses: their Force generation is -X this turn, or you may activate up to X Force, where X = number of [Dark Side Force] icons here.
front.lore: Padawan. Spy.
front.title: •Ezra Bridger

rulings: To determine power bonus, count up all cards that are either Dark Jedi or Jedi (e.g. if there are 2 Dark Jedi and 1 Jedi, then Ezra Bridger is power +3).

front.gametext: Deploy on an opponent's location. Whenever you lose a droid from hand or Life Force, it satisfies Force loss up to its forfeit value. Once per turn, you may play Scomp Link Access to cancel a Force drain where you have a droid. Effect canceled if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Unlike the Empire, the Alliance treats their droids with respect. Many droids volunteered to share the risk of battle and aid the Rebellion's assault on the Death Star.
front.title: •Faithful Service

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
underlyingCardFor: I've Got A Bad Feeling About...

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at an exterior site with more than double your total power, use 1 Force to target an adjacent site where opponent has no presence. All your characters present in battle move away (for free) to the target site. The battle is canceled.
front.lore: 'K-one zero...all troops disengage.'
front.title: Fall Back!

rulings: Close The Blast Doors! will cause Light to lose 1 Force for each character that moves away, and then also lose 1 Force for canceling the battle.
Characters inside open vehicles will automatically disembark to move away. Characters inside starships and enclosed vehicles are not present and so do not move away.

front.gametext: If your Jedi was just defeated in lightsaber combat, you may either: Reveal a Dark Jedi's combat cards and place one in opponent's Lost Pile (return others). OR Place Qui-Gon out of play and take [Episode I] Obi-Wan into hand from Lost Pile or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: The blow, when it came, was lightning swift and fatal. But Qui-Gon's death gave new life to his former Padawan.
front.title: •Fall Of A Jedi

front.gametext: At the end of a battle that you won at an interior site where you have a character of ability > 3 present, relocate one opponent's character present to an adjacent site. (If on Cloud City, character may be relocated to Weather Vane instead.)
front.lore: 'Aaaaah!'
front.title: •Fall Of The Empire

front.gametext: If you just lost a character during a battle or duel at a Cloud City site, use 2 Force to relocate that character to Weather Vane instead of your Lost Pile. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one Weather Vane into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: Luke had a falling out with his estranged father.
front.title: •Fall Of The Legend

rulings: The character needs to have been lost from the battle (or duel) on Cloud City.

canceledBy: Establish Control prevents the targeting of a character with Fallen Portal
They're Still Coming Through! may re-target Fallen Portal by choosing up to two of opponent's characters there instead of your own

front.gametext: Target one creature or up to two characters present that just initiated an attack or battle against you at Back Door, Rancor Pit, Tatooine: Jabba's Palace or any docking bay. Draw destiny. Target(s) immediately lost if destiny +2 > total defense value.
front.lore: Jabba ordered the two-meter thick door to keep the rancor in. He never thought it would be the instrument of the rancor's demise.
front.title: •Fallen Portal

combo: Gungan Energy Shield + Fambaa

front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = ½. Requires +1 Force to use landspeed. May not be attacked by creatures.
front.lore: Pack animal domesticated by Gungan warriors. Able to bear heavy loads, even during the heat of combat.
front.title: •••Fambaa

front.gametext: Light:  During your deploy phase, Hydroponics Station or Vaporator may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel.  Dark:  May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel.
front.title: <>Farm

pulledBy: I Must Be Allowed To Speak (V)
rulings: Hydroponics Station and Vaporator may deploy here even if it's not on Tatooine (only when using this site to deploy them from Reserve Deck).

front.gametext: Once each turn during your control phase, you may use 1 Force to make a 'wager.' Draw three destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. Player with highest total may randomly select one card to be retrieved from that player's Lost Pile.
front.lore: A male Bith. Musician who leads the Mos Eisley Cantina band, Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes. Expert gambler and card shark.
front.title: •Figrin D'an

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any starship or enclosed vehicle he is aboard as a passenger. May deploy as a 'react' to same location as your pilot (free if Poe or Rey). Once per game, may take Blaster Proficiency into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Gunner. Stormtrooper.
front.title: •Finn

pulledBy: I'm Getting Kind Of Good At This
pulls: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency
rulings: May even deploy as a 'react' to same location as Light's permanent pilot such as on a vehicle or starship (even a landed starship).

cancels: A battle just initiated where present when deployed on R2-D2
Result of an Ion Cannon where present

front.gametext: Deploy on your astromech droid. Cancels an 'exploding' Program Trap here. Any starship it is aboard is immune to Lateral Damage and ion cannons. If deployed on R2-D2, may lose Fire Extinguisher to cancel a battle just initiated where present at a site.
front.lore: Among the various special devices on droids like R2 units are gas-based fire extinguishers. Effective against electrical fires and can cause confusion during battle.
front.title: Fire Extinguisher

combo: Firefight + Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle

front.gametext: During a battle, if you have weapons at at least 2 sites adjacent to that battle, add 3 to your total power and add one battle destiny. OR For remainder of turn, your scout at an exterior site is power +1 and adds 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.
front.lore: Lieutenant Page effectively deployed his detachment of Rebel commandos during the attack at the control bunker.
front.title: Firefight

underlyingCardFor: Make Ten Men Feel Like A Hundred

front.gametext: Subtracts 2 from deploy cost of each of your starfighters to same docking bay. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Advanced Preparation, Rebel Planners or docking bay into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Engineer responsible for preparing Red and Gold Squadron starships for battle. Has final launch authority in the Yavin 4 docking bay.
front.title: •Firin Morett

front.gametext: If your character's forfeit was just reduced to 0, restore it to normal. OR Reduce your battle damage by 5 by losing from hand a starship, vehicle or character. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: The Alliance used stolen medical droids to help carry on the battle against the Empire.
front.title: •First Aid

front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Home One. Adds 3 to power of any capital starship she pilots. When piloting a Star Cruiser with another Mon Calamari pilot aboard, unless opponent has total ability > 6 piloting here, may reset opponent's total battle destiny here to 0.
front.lore: Mon Calamari deck officer. Brilliant tactical analyst. One of several brave leaders of Mon Calamari refugees from Imperial invasion of her planet.
front.title: •First Officer Thaneespi

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. At any time, you may use 3 Force to draw the top card of your Reserve Deck into your hand. If that card is a space creature, you may immediately deploy it for free.
front.lore: Occasionally Han was capable of such feats, even without Threepio there to tell him these things.
front.title: •Flash Of Insight

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react' to any jungle or forest site. Power and forfeit +2 while Dice Ibegon at Audience Chamber. Poison stinger cumulatively adds 1 to attrition against opponent in battles at same site.
front.lore: Aggressive, serpent-like colonizers. Found on many jungle and forest planets. Have poison stinger that they use when defending themselves.
front.title: •••Florn Lamproid

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Early Warning Network or It's An Older Code. OR During your deploy phase, deploy one starship (deploy -1) and/or one pilot to a system even without presence or Force icons.  LOST: Take one Tydirium or Tantive IV into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: As a smuggler, Han had years of experience at avoiding Imperial detection. He chose the approach to Endor's moon as the time to pass some of that knowledge on to Chewie.
front.title: •Fly Casual

front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Counter Assault is played, may use 1 Force to add one destiny to your total. If Sense or Alter just played, may use X Force to exclude X Dark Jedi from being the 'highest-ability character.'
front.lore: Before swinging across the treacherous abyss, Leia gave Luke a kiss for luck. Despite an incessant storm of laserblasts, they made it.
front.title: •For Luck

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: The player playing Sense or Alter must then immediately choose a new target character if possible. If not possible, the Sense or Alter fails.
If Alter is played in response to the attempted deployment of this Effect, this Effect's game text may not be used yet.

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your control phase, if opponent occupies a non-battleground location, may peek at top two cards of your Reserve Deck and take one into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Before swinging across the treacherous abyss, Leia gave Luke a kiss for luck. Despite an incessant storm of laserblasts, they made it.
front.title: •For Luck (V)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
pulls: One of the two top cards of Reserve Deck

front.gametext: Take a device (except Landing Claw) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Target one opponent's droid present with your Jedi in battle. For remainder of turn, target is power -1 and may not fire weapons.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Force Levitation

front.gametext: USED: If [Episode VII] Luke at a site, target all your characters at one other site. They are defense value = 5 this turn.  LOST: Once per game, if opponent just drew battle destiny and Luke is out of play, draw destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's total battle destiny.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Force Projection

rulings: It does not matter how the Luke card got out of play, even if it went out of play from a Unit Of Force state.
A Luke card on Communing counts as Luke being out of play.

front.gametext: Light:  Your characters present here are immune to attrition. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.  Dark:  May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.
front.title: <>Forest

front.gametext: If you have a character of ability > 4 on table, use 3 Force to find one of your missing characters (your choice). OR During any control phase, examine the top card of your Lost Pile. If that card is a character of ability < 3, take that character into hand.
front.lore: 'I'm looking for someone.' 'Looking? Found someone you have I would say.'
front.title: Found Someone You Have

front.gametext: Find one of your missing characters. OR Retrieve the topmost character of your Lost Pile into hand.
front.lore: 'I'm looking for someone.' 'Looking? Found someone you have I would say.'
front.title: Found Someone You Have (V)

front.gametext: If you control a location where opponent has a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal that vehicle (any characters aboard are lost). OR Peek at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand. If that card is a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal it into hand.
front.lore: To prevent biker scouts from reaching their base, Luke and Leia 'borrowed' some nearby transportation.
front.title: •Free Ride

front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Occupation, Cloud City Occupation, Rebel Base Occupation. (Immune to Sense.) OR Peak at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand. If that card is a speeder bike, AT-ST, or skiff, steal it into hand.
front.title: •Free Ride & •Endor Celebration

cancels: Game text of opponent's accountants and tax collectors

front.gametext: Cancels game text of opponent's accountants and tax collectors at same or adjacent site. While in a battle at a site, your battle destiny draws may not be canceled, and you may not draw more than two battle destiny.
front.lore: Xexto who had his business license revoked when his partner siphoned away his credits, fled the system, and left him with the tax debt.
front.title: •Freon Drevan

front.gametext: An accident occurs at the beginning of a battle at any site where opponent has at least two characters and one weapon. Draw destiny. If destiny < number of opponent's characters at that site, one is lost. (Opponent's choice.)
front.lore: Overcrowding in heavy fire zones increases chances of accidentally shooting one's own comrades. Stormtroopers never let accuracy get in the way of victory.
front.title: Friendly Fire

front.gametext: Deploy on Hoth system. At the end of each player's turn, for every character that player has present at a marker site under 'nighttime conditions,' that player must lose 1 Force (2 if character is missing).
front.lore: 'Then I'll see you in hell!'
front.title: •Frostbite

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

canceledBy: We'll Let Fate-a Decide, Huh? - Defensive Shield
We'll Let Fate-a Decide, Huh? (V) - Defensive Shield
combo: Frozen Assets + Draw Their Fire

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. At every site where there is a 'frozen' captive, your Rebels deploy -2 and are power +2 in battle. OR Deploy on top of opponent's Force Pile. Force below this card may not be drawn or used. Effect lost at end of opponent's next turn.
front.lore: Molten carbonite is released into the chamber and then flash frozen, releasing a blast of air. The subject is instantly covered in the newly solidified material.
front.title: •Frozen Assets

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: The Force Pile cards below Frozen Assets may not be drawn, peeked at, shuffled, taken into hand, stacked, moved, or reordered.
The Force Pile cards below Frozen Assets may be lost if they are the topmost Force Pile cards (ignoring Frozen Assets itself).

front.gametext: If your pilot (or permanent pilot) is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add one battle destiny. OR If Luke is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Rebel pilots use visual scanning to supplement sensors for an edge against Imperial fighter pilots. Natural instincts allow lone Rebels to overcome superior numbers.
front.title: •Full Throttle

front.gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.
front.lore: Uses standard fusion technology. Provides starships with energy for hyperspace travel. Installed at docking bays and throughout the Outer Rim Territories.
front.title: Fusion Generator Supply Tanks

combo: FX-7 (Effex-Seven) + Bacta Tank

front.gametext: Once per turn, one of your 'hit' non-droid characters at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. Cumulatively subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
front.lore: Model nicknamed 'Fixit' by Rebels at Echo Base. Though obsolete in advanced hospitals, FX-7 droids still operate at many Rebel outposts as assistant surgeons.
front.title: FX-7 (Effex-Seven)

front.gametext: Once per game, may place a non-[Immune to Alter] Effect in owner's Used Pile. If both players just drew one battle destiny here, may use 2 Force (free if with an Imperial) to switch numbers. Opponent must first lose 2 Force to fire a superlaser.
front.lore: Information broker, leader, and spy.
front.title: •Galen Erso

front.gametext: If any gambler is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny (draw two destiny, and choose one). OR if your Lando is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny (draw three and choose two).
front.lore: Works every time.
front.title: •Gambler's Luck

front.gametext: While at Audience Chamber, all your other Saurins are forfeit +2 and all your characters trained by Sai'torr Kal Fas are power and forfeit +1.
front.lore: Saurin combat expert. Hired by Jabba to train his Gamorrean guards. Regrets taking the job. Dislikes Jabba and his henchbeings. Plotting to kill Jabba.
front.title: •Garon Nas Tal
