rulings: The 'For remainder of game' section is saying that Light may not play Revolution <u>anywhere</u>.

combo: Master Luke + I Must Be Allowed To Speak (V) or non-virtual

front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Tatooine. Power -2 when present with Vader. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle, may target one opponent's alien present. Draw destiny. Target returns to opponent's hand if destiny > ability. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Until being reunited with Yoda, Luke suspected that he had completed his training. Has a strong influence on the weak minded.
front.title: •Master Luke

front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Coruscant. If opponent's Dark Jedi on table, during your move phase may use 4 Force to return Qui-Gon (and all cards on him) to owner's hand. Immune to attrition and You Are Beaten.
front.lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon

front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Coruscant. If opponent's Dark Jedi on table, during your move phase may use 4 Force to return Qui-Gon (and all cards on him) to owner's hand. Immune to attrition and You Are Beaten.
front.lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon (AI)

combo: Master Qui-Gon + matching lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience
Master Qui-Gon (V) + Credits Will Do Fine

front.gametext: Deploys -1 to [Episode I] locations. If you just lost Force from an opponent's Effect, may take an [Episode I] Interrupt (except Control) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle, or place a card from hand under Credits Will Do Fine. May not be Disarmed. Immune to You Are Beaten and attrition.
front.lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon (V)

rulings: Master Qui-Gon (V) may only respond once per action, not once per unit of Force loss.
Example: Tatooine Occupation causes 3 Force loss. Master Qui-Gon (V) may respond once, not 3 times.

front.gametext: Deploys -1 to [Episode I] locations. If you just lost Force from an opponent's Effect, may take an [Episode I] Interrupt (except Control) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle, or place a card from hand under Credits Will Do Fine. May not be Disarmed. Immune to You Are Beaten and attrition.
front.lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon (V) (AI)

rulings: Master Qui-Gon (V) may only respond once per action, not once per unit of Force loss.
Example: Tatooine Occupation causes 3 Force loss. Master Qui-Gon (V) may respond once, not 3 times.

combo: Max Rebo vs. Walker Garrison - If played correctly, Max can be the centerpiece of a deck which has to play against AT-AT's a lot. With his Power bonus, he becomes a reasonably potent character, and with his Force drain canceling game text, he can stop at least one of the massive drains pumped out by Walker Garrison.  Max Rebo + Audience Chamber in a Jess-based deck - The musician deck is ready to rock as Max's deploy bonus decreases the already low deploy cost of the musicians, and Jess's text is made more useful.

front.gametext: Power +2 on Hoth. If at same site as another of you musicians, you may play Bith Shuffle to cancel a Force drain at an adjacent site. While at Audience Chamber, all your other musicians are deploy -1 and forfeit +3.
front.lore: Ortolan musician and gambler. Head of The Max Rebo Band. Signed a lifetime contract to Jabba in exchange for unlimited food.
front.title: •Max Rebo

rulings: This card is not a leader. A common online 'misprint' incorrectly says leader in lore, but physical copies do not.

front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. Opponent's total battle destiny is -1 here. During your turn, may reveal the top three cards of your Reserve Deck, take one alien into hand (if possible), and shuffle your Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Female information broker and leader.
front.title: •Maz Kanata

rulings: If there are only 1 or 2 cards in Reserve Deck, Maz can still reveal them, but she cannot take an alien into hand.

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game, may deploy an [Episode VII] alien here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  Force drain -1 here. While you control, Dobra Doompa is suspended.
front.title: •Maz's Castle: Antechamber

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game, if you control, may retrieve a weapon or device into hand.  Dark:  Instead of Force draining here, may retrieve a weapon or device.
front.title: •Maz's Castle: Hidden Recess

front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior site. Target an opponent's combat vehicle at a related site. Target's power and forfeit = 0. When target reaches Utinni Effect, target draws one destiny. Utinni Effect canceled if destiny > 2. Otherwise, draw again next move phase, etc.
front.lore: The massive war machines of the Empire require tremendous effort to maintain combat readiness.
front.title: •Mechanical Failure

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on your character of ability > 3 (Effect lost if that character battles this turn). On a subsequent turn, if in a battle at a site, character's total weapon destiny is +3 and character adds one battle destiny. Effect lost at the end of that battle.
front.lore: To prepare for the inevitable conflict with Jabba's minions, Luke entered a calm state of mental preparation.
front.title: •Meditation

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 2 pilots, 6 passengers and 1 vehicle. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Has ship-docking capability. Quad Laser Cannon may deploy aboard.
front.lore: Modern Corellian design. Length 100 meters. Features engine system similar to that of a Corellian corvette. Dorsal hatch reveals hangar bay.
front.title: Medium Bulk Freighter

front.gametext: Deploy on a site. May be moved by two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target up to two characters or two creatures at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Target(s) hit if total destiny > total defense value.
front.lore: Merr-Sonn Mark II repeating blaster. Accepts power cells from a very wide variety of sources, a benefit for Rebels accustomed to scavenging for supplies.
front.title: Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon

rulings: Moving this cannon does not permit those carrying it to make an extra move.
Normal movement costs apply to the characters moving this cannon.
The characters moving this cannon move with it, using landspeed, simultaneously.
This weapon is a blaster.

combo: Medium Transport + Cloud Car (repeatedly)
Medium Transport + R5-M2 + BoShek Power 5, Armor 3, immune to attrition < 3, immune to Tallon Roll, and a Battle Destiny draw
Medium Transport + Evacuation Control Makes the Transport hyperspeed +2, immune to attrition < 3 and it may move for free.

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Passenger and cargo transport built by Gallofree Yards. Enormous cargo bays can be outfitted to safely accommodate large numbers of troops, munitions or supplies.
front.title: Medium Transport

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +2 under 'nighttime conditions.' Immune to attrition < X, where X = number of your aliens present (including himself).
front.lore: Sarkan smuggler. Smokes an Essoomian gruu pipe to heighten awareness. Exiled from his home planet of Sarka for displaying curiosity in other aliens. Misses his homeworld.
front.title: •Melas

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Opponent's starships here may not 'cloak.' Smoke Screen is a Used Interrupt when targeting Melas.
front.lore: Sarkan smuggler. Smokes an Essoomian gruu pipe to heighten awareness. Exiled from his home planet of Sarka for displaying curiosity in other aliens. Misses his homeworld.
front.title: •Melas (V)

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you control any three Coruscant, Death Star and/or Death Star II locations, or any battleground site and one battleground system, all opponent's Force drain bonuses everywhere are canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: As the Executor crashed into the Death Star, hope surged throughout the ranks of the outmanned Rebel fleet.
front.title: •Menace Fades

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
rulings: Only cancels Force drain bonuses that come from DS cards affecting DS Force drains.
For example, if DS Force drains at the LS system Tibrin, the +1 bonus in Tibrin's game text is not canceled because it is a LS card.
For example, if LS Force drains at the DS site Cloud City: Interrogation Room, the +1 bonus in the site's game text is not canceled because it is a LS Force drain.

front.gametext: Deploy on your non-thief to give that character thief skill. Once during each of your control phases, may target one device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, it is stolen. OR Deploy on a weapon to prevent theft. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A crafty purloiner from Tirac Munda with a heart of gold. Often hired to advise the wealthy on how to protect their own property. Well traveled and skilled in many languages.
front.title: Merc Sunlet

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Use 2 Force (free on Leia) to deploy on a Rebel without armor. Character gains {spy} skill, power +3, armor = 4, and immunity to attrition < 3. Imperial Barrier is canceled. Blasters deploy for free and fire for free on this character.
front.lore: Worn by hired guns throughout the galaxy. Often used by Rebels when infiltrating underworld organizations. Leia wore Boushh's armor when she infiltrated Black Sun.
front.title: ••Mercenary Armor

rulings: If firing a repeating blaster (e.g. BlasTech E-11B Blaster Rifle), only the first shot is free.

front.gametext: Once per game, retrieve 1 Force for each of your senators at Galactic Senate. (Immune to Sense.) OR Take one senator (or Coruscant Guard, Sei Taria or Mas Amedda) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Despite its current reputation, the Republic still has able citizens that are willing to try and fight the injustices before them.
front.title: •Might Of The Republic

combo: Millennium Falcon + Captain Han Solo + R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) (V) Millennium Falcon is power 9, Maneuver 9 and Hyperspeed 9 and immune to attrition < 5. All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin on that Falcon means a battle destiny of 9.
Millennium Falcon + Captain Han Solo + Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to attrition < 5 if Han, Chewie or Lando piloting. Has ship-docking capability. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.
front.lore: Modified YT-1300 freighter. Owned by Lando Calrissian until won by Han in a sabacc game. 26.7 meters long. 'She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts.'
front.title: •Millennium Falcon

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

back.gametext: Mind What You Have Learned:Deploy Dagobah system (may not be converted).{While} this side up, during your deploy phase, may deploy Luke, Yoda (deploy -2), Yoda's Hope, At Peace and/or Luke's Backpack to Dagobah from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Whenever you draw training destiny, draw two and choose one. Place Luke's completed Jedi Tests on table. Your cards at Dagobah may not Force drain or contribute to Force retrieval. Add 4 to each player's destiny draw for Sense and Alter.{Flip} this card when Luke completes Jedi Test #5.Save You It Can:{Immediately} retrieve 10 Force and place destiny card from Jedi Test #5 on that Jedi Test.{While} this side up, during your move phase, may use 3 Force to take Luke into hand from a location you control (cards on Luke go to owner's Used Pile). Luke's Jedi Test are suspended (not lost) whenever Luke not on table. Luke may ignore location deployment restrictions. Opponent may not play Sense or Alter.{Place} out of play if you Force drain at Dagobah or if Luke is placed out of play. Cancel Luke's Jedi Tests.
back.title: Mind What You Have Learned / Save You It Can

Add 4 to each player's destiny draw for Sense and Alter.{Flip} this card when Luke completes Jedi Test #5.Save You It Can:{Immediately} retrieve 10 Force and place destiny card from Jedi Test #5 on that Jedi Test.{While} this side up, during your move phase, may use 3 Force to take Luke into hand from a location you control (cards on Luke go to owner's Used Pile). Luke's Jedi Test are suspended (not lost) whenever Luke not on table. Luke may ignore location deployment restrictions. Opponent may not play Sense or Alter.{Place} out of play if you Force drain at Dagobah or if Luke is placed out of play. Cancel Luke's Jedi Tests.

rulings: The 'deploy -2' text only applies when using this objective to deploy Yoda from Reserve Deck.
underlyingCardFor: The Galaxy May Need A Legend / We Need Luke Skywalker

front.gametext: USED: Use 2 Force to deploy a unique (•) battleground not on table, from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: Deploy from your Reserve Deck one Effect which deploys on table (or your side of table) and has no deploy cost; reshuffle. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'But not at the expense of the moment.'
front.title: •Mindful Of The Future

pulls: A unique battleground not on table
One Effect which deploys on table and has no deploy cost
Death Star: Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor

front.gametext: USED: If Maul just swung a lightsaber during battle, that lightsaber may not target again this battle.  LOST: If [Episode I] Obi-Wan or non-[Permanent Weapon] Qui-Gon is in battle with a Dark Jedi, add one battle destiny. OR Cancel Maul Strikes or The Phantom Menace.
front.lore: 'But not at the expense of the moment.'
front.title: •Mindful Of The Future (V)

combo: Mirax Terrik + Pulsar Skate + Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When piloting Pulsar Skate, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to place a card from hand on bottom of Used Pile and draw top card of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Called 'Myra' by childhood friend Wedge Antilles. Corellian smuggler. Captain of the Pulsar Skate. Responsible for starship repairs and upgrades. Information Broker.
front.title: •Mirax Terrik

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Deploy -1 to a farm or exterior Tatooine site. Power and forfeit +1 when Ardon Crell at Audience Chamber. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Hydroponics Station or Vaporator into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Many native Tatooine citizens shun larger settlements. Form small communities in the desert. Their vaporators harvest water from the atmosphere.
front.title: Moisture Farmer

pulls: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

combo: Momaw Nadon + Double Agent

front.gametext: During your control phase, may snare (steal) one Bantha, Dewback, Wampa, Rancor, Bubo, or Dragonsnake present at same site.
front.lore: Male Ithorian, from a tree-loving race derogatorily nicknamed, 'Hammerheads.' Master of animal husbandry and horticulture. Former herd ship leader. Rebel spy.
front.title: •Momaw Nadon

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy with a Star Cruiser, opponent's Star Destroyers may not deploy here. Your Star Cruisers deploy -1 here.  Dark:  If you control without a Star Destroyer, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Mon Calamari

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of any capital starship he pilots. Your Rebel starships may move to here for free. While piloting a Rebel capital starship, opponent may not modify or cancel your battle destinies here.
front.lore: Leader.
front.title: ••Mon Calamari Admiral

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Star Cruisers (except Profundity) may deploy -2 (to a maximum of -3), ignore deployment restrictions in their game text, draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and are immune to attrition < 4. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Admiral Ackbar's hit-and-fade tactics force the Imperial Navy to spread throughout the galaxy in a futile attempt to engage the Rebels.
front.title: •Mon Calamari Dockyards

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Even with Home One: War Room text, Home One deploys for 12-3=9.

combo: Mon Calamari Star Cruiser + Staging Areas

front.gametext: Deploys only at Mon Calamari or any Rebel Base. May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
front.lore: Mon Cal MC80 cruiser. Originally a civilian ship. Converted to military use following the liberation of Mon Calamari from the Empire.
front.title: Mon Calamari Star Cruiser

combo: Mon Mothma + Chandrila Mon Mothma deploys -2 at any Chandrila location.

front.gametext: While at your war room, subtracts 1 from each opponent's battle destiny at all system locations and adds 2 to forfeit of all non-unique rebels. During your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel from Reserve Deck and reshuffle.
front.lore: Native of Chandrila. Leader of the Alliance. A former member of the Imperial Senate where she was a formidable opponent to then-Senator Palpatine. Friend of Bail Organa.
front.title: •Mon Mothma

rulings: 'Former member of the Imperial Senate' in lore makes her a senator.

combo: Mos Eisley Blaster + A Gift Use these two cards together to gain a big advantage in the attrition race. The Dark Side loses two off of its destiny draws, reducing the attrition that you take. Add in the Mos Eisley Blaster, and your opponent takes the same amount of attrition, but that attrition tends to go a little bit farther, by reducing a key character (such as Ortugg or J'Quille) to attrition fodder.

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.
front.lore: Easily obtained by the Rebellion. Many are copies of the BlasTech DL-18 design. Plentiful on Tatooine. Used for suppressive fire.
front.title: Mos Eisley Blaster

combo: Motti Seeker + Attark

front.gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Motti (or pilot) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker also lost.
front.lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
front.title: Motti Seeker

front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site where your Jedi is present, use 1 force to draw destiny; that number of opponent's characters with ability = 1 (your choice) must each move away (for free), or be lost.
front.lore: Obi-Wan used Jedi 'affect mind' power to convince stormtroopers, 'These aren't the droids you're looking for.'
front.title: Move Along...

rulings: If the destiny draw exceeds the number of opponent's characters with ability = 1, simply target as many as possible, and then they must move away as usual.

front.gametext: Target one starfighter participating in a battle at a system or sector. For remainder of turn, starfighter may not move, is immune to attrition and, if piloted by any Corellian, is power +2.
front.lore: Sometimes the best defense is an insane offense.
front.title: •Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: Your weapons and devices deploy -1 to same site. While with your unique (*) smuggler at an exterior site, opponent's total battle destiny here is -1 for each [Light Side] at same site.
front.lore: A peaceful Ithorian, Murr is a member of a Trade Guild based on an Ithorian herd ship. He treats his customers honestly, but does like to deal in 'grey' items. Smuggler.
front.title: •Murr Danod

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Deploy a handmaiden to Amidala's location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just initiated battle at same site as your handmaiden and Amidala, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Amidala's handmaidens served more functions than a casual observer would ever notice.
front.title: •My Loyal Bodyguard

front.gametext: Habitat: unlimited. Parasite: Starfighter. Host's power and hyperspeed are cumulatively -2; while both < 1, Mynocks randomly detach one at a time (cannot attach for remainder of turn). Moves like a starfighter.
front.lore: Starship parasite. Flourishes in vacuum of space. Consumes radiation and other forms of energy. Chews on power cables. Adults have one-meter wingspan. Reproduces by macromiosis.
front.title: Mynock

front.gametext: Light:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.  Dark:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.
front.title: •Naboo

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature, vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value.
front.lore: Standard issue blaster given to Naboo security volunteers. Noted for its effectiveness in battle and cheap manufacturing cost.
front.title: Naboo Blaster Rifle

front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Amidala at a Theed Palace site (or Boss Nass at an exterior Naboo site), opponent's cards with ability deploy +2 there. Once during battle at a Naboo site, if you just drew a Gungan or Royal Naboo Security for battle destiny, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: The heroic actions of Amidala's forces and Boss Nass' army saved Naboo from the Trade Federation. Definitely a cause for celebration!
front.title: •Naboo Celebration

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May add 1 pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Power +1 at Naboo system. While with another N-1 starfighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Part of the Royal Naboo Air Security Forces. Designed by Theed Palace Space Vessel Engineering Corps and used in the attack on the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship.
front.title: Naboo Defense Fighter

front.gametext: Deploys -2 at Naboo. If just deployed aboard a N-1 starfighter, you may activate 1 Force. Adds 2 to the power of any starfighter he pilots (or 3 if piloting a N-1 starfighter). Forfeit + 1 when forfeited during a battle at a system.
front.lore: One of many pilots who assisted at the Battle of Naboo. Determined to fight for the planet he's lived on all his life.
front.title: Naboo Fighter Pilot

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature, vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 if fired by a leader. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Used primarily by high-ranking Naboo security officers, and known for its precision targeting.
front.title: Naboo Security Officer Blaster

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game may take Gungan Energy Shield into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  Your AATs deploy +1 here.
front.title: •Naboo: Battle Plains

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game may take Boss Nass into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  Opponent may not Force drain here. Immune to Revolution.
front.title: •Naboo: Boss Nass' Chambers

front.gametext: Light:  Your Gungans deploy -1 here and move from here for free. You may not Force drain here.  Dark:  Cards with ability (except Gungans) deploy +4 to underwater sites. Immune to Revolution.
front.title: •Naboo: Otoh Gunga Entrance

front.gametext: Light:  Your Gungans are each power +1 and deploy -1 here.  Dark:  Unless your battle droid present, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Naboo: Swamp

front.gametext: Light:  Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.  Dark:  (none)
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Courtyard

front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Docking Bay

front.gametext: Light:  Your Jedi are power +2 here.  Dark:  Your Dark Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Generator

front.gametext: Light:  Any characters of ability < 5 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.  Dark:  Any characters of ability < 5 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Generator Core

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game may take Ascension Guns into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  If your battle droid present, Force drain +1 here.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway

front.gametext: Light:  Once per game, may take [Set 1] Ascension Guns into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. You move to here using landspeed for free.  Dark:  While We Have A Plan on table, your Force icons here are canceled.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway (V)

front.gametext: Light:  While you occupy, opponent's [Presence] droids require +1 Force to move to here.  Dark:  (none)
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Throne Room

canceledBy: Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us
Solo? captures all Rebels transported by Nabrun Leids

front.gametext: At any time (except during battle), target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to any one other site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Four-armed smuggler and pilot for hire. A Morseerian male. Breathes methane. Former fighter pilot. He can take you anywhere for the right price.
front.title: Nabrun Leids

rulings: The destiny draw and cost are paid during initiation, and then responses (e.g. Sense) may take place.
If retargeted by Surprise, it must EITHER select new characters to be transported OR select a new destination site.
If using Surprise to choose new characters, the new characters may be at the same origin site or a different origin site, but it cannot include any of the original characters.

front.gametext: After using Bith Shuffle, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May reshuffle without peeking.
front.lore: Male Bith musician. Though he enjoys playing his Bandfill in Figrin D'an's band, he misses the bubblink pink swamps of his homeworld, Clak'dor VII.
front.title: •Nalan Cheel

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jarad Konsker, New Jersey Mini Open 2011)

front.gametext: Light:  Force drain +1 here. Once per game, if your control, may take Han's Toolkit into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  Starships piloted by bounty hunters are power +1 here. All starships may move between here and Nal Hutta as a react.
front.title: •Nar Shaddaa

rulings: 'All starships' in the Dark player's text refers to starships belonging to both players.
Starships may use Dark's text to 'react' from Nar Shaddaa to Nal Hutta, or from Nal Hutta to Nar Shaddaa. Not to or from any other systems.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jarad Konsker, New Jersey Mini Open 2011)

front.gametext: Light:  Force drain +1 here. Once per game, if your control, may take Han's Toolkit into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  Starships piloted by bounty hunters are power +1 here. All starships may move between here and Nal Hutta as a react.
front.title: •Nar Shaddaa (AI)

rulings: 'All starships' in the Dark player's text refers to starships belonging to both players.

front.gametext: Once per game, target one non-unique character on table. Draw destiny. If destiny is less than X, retrieve X Force, where X equals the number of copies of that card you have on table (immune to Sense). OR search your Reserve Deck and take one non-unique alien into hand; reshuffle.
front.lore: One of the few possessions Jabba brought with him from Nar Shaddaa, the smugglers moon orbiting Nal Hutta. A symbol of renewal in Hutt Society.
front.title: •Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes

front.gametext: Once per game, target one non-unique character on table. Draw destiny. If destiny < X, retrieve X Force, where X equals the number of copies of that card you have on table (Immune to Sense). OR Take one non-unique alien into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just initiated a battle with more than double your total power, search your Reserve Deck. Any one character you find there may immediately deploy as a 'react;' reshuffle.
front.title: •Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & •Out Of Somewhere

combo: Narrow Escape + All My Urchins A good way to make your opponent lose 2 Force for nothing. (l000needles)

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle at a site where you have a Rebel of ability > 2 present, move all of your cards with ability there away (using their landspeed).
front.lore: Blast doors seal off compartments during battles, hull ruptures or as security measures. Thick doors repel blaster rifle shots.
front.title: Narrow Escape

rulings: This movement is not a 'react'.

front.gametext: Power +3 when present with your musician. When a battle was just initiated where present, may choose one opponent's character of ability < X to move away for free (or that character is lost), where X = number of your musicians present.
front.lore: Disciple of Davrilat, a complicated religion based on the sanctity of harmonics. Originally from the desert planet Tocoya. Strong protective instincts.
front.title: •Neb Dulo

front.gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, and 2 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Turbolaser batteries and laser cannons may deploy aboard for free.
front.lore: Product of Imperial Kuat Drive Yards. Several captured by Alliance. Imperial crews promptly defected. Can be outfitted for a variety of missions requiring mid-size capital starships.
front.title: Nebulon-B Frigate

rulings: These cards may deploy aboard Nebulon-B Frigate (and do so for free): Heavy Turbolaser Battery, Quad Laser Cannon.
X-wing Laser Cannon may <u>not</u> deploy on Nebulon-B Frigate.

front.gametext: If difference between opponent's and your highest race totals < 4, lose 1 Force. Opponent draws no race destiny next control phase. OR If both players have < 10 Life Force remaining, both players retrieve 4 Force.
front.lore: When Anakin had finally caught up with Sebulba, he knew he needed to make some kind of a move to break away from the Dug and win the race.
front.title: •Neck And Neck

canceledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever - Defensive Shield
You Cannot Hide Forever (V) - Defensive Shield
Your Insight Serves You Well - Defensive Shield
Your Insight Serves You Well (V) - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: Insert in opponent's Reserve Deck. When Effect reaches top it is lost and up to the three lowest destiny numbers of each player's characters on table are totaled. Player with lower total loses Force equal to the difference. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'You said you wanted to be around when I made a mistake, well, this could be it, sweetheart.'
front.title: •Never Tell Me The Odds

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: If you have a senate majority, activate 1 Force. OR If your opponent has a senate majority, place your character with politics at Galactic Senate in Used Pile to place an opponent's character present (your choice) in opponent's Used Pile. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: The political process in the Republic is one whereby even the most powerful positions are fraught with peril.
front.title: •New Leadership Is Needed

cancels: Any attempt by one character to 'hide' from battle

front.gametext: Send one of your missing characters at same site as one of your piloted or driven vehicles to your Used Pile. OR Cancel any attempt by one character to 'hide' from a battle.
front.lore: 'Echo Base, this is Rogue 2. I've found them. Repeat. I've found them.'
front.title: Nice Of You Guys To Drop By

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. During a battle, you may place out of play from hand a copy of any unique (•) card participating in that battle to reduce attrition against you by that card's forfeit value. (Immune to Alter while you occupy a battleground.)
front.lore: Luke barely escaped being crushed by the AT-AT's massive footpad during the Battle of Hoth.
front.title: •Nick Of Time

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Uses the forfeit value of the card from your hand, including global modifiers.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. When at a mobile sector, once per turn you may peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck; you may place that card on top of your Used Pile. When with General Calrissian may add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Brilliant navigator. Former SoroSuub employee. Turned to pirating when that corporation backed the Empire. Tall for a Sullustan.
front.title: •Nien Nunb

front.gametext: Deploy on any planet system to cause 'nighttime conditions' at related sites. During battles there, both sides add one destiny to power only. Spies deploy free to sites under 'nighttime conditions.'
front.lore: Tatoo I and Tatoo II, twin suns of Tatooine, create a harsh desert environment, but provide spectacular sunsets. At night, many dangers emerge from the shadows.
front.title: Nightfall

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
underlyingCardFor: The Force Is Strong In My Family

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. If a Rebel of ability > 2 is lost (not captured) during a battle involving an opponent's bounty hunter, opponent loses 3 Force. If Vader on table, one bounty hunter involved in that battle (your choice) is also lost.
front.lore: 'There will be a substantial reward for the one who finds the Millennium Falcon. You are free to use any methods necessary, but I want them alive.'
front.title: •No Disintegrations!

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: The 3 Force loss is once per battle, not once per Rebel.

front.gametext: If you just lost a Gungan from table, place him in your hand. OR If Jar Jar and Tarpals are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.
front.lore: 'Mesa think of sumting!'
front.title: •No Giben Up, General Jar Jar!

front.gametext: Force generation at sectors a player occupies is +1 for that player. Any independent starship with an alien pilot character aboard is immune to attrition < 4 (or adds 2 to immunity). During your control phase, one of your smugglers at a site related to a system occupied by your freighter or independent starship may either fire a blaster or make a regular move using personal landspeed.
front.title: •No Questions Asked

front.gametext: If opponent just deployed a character, sacrifice (out of play) from table one of your characters with the same power (even a captured character). You may retrieve Force from Lost Pile equal to your sacrificed character's forfeit value.
front.lore: 'You can't win Darth. If you strike me down I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.' Obi-Wan's sacrifice gave the Rebels time to escape.
front.title: Noble Sacrifice

rulings: Placing a character out of play is a cost paid during initiation. If Noble Sacrifice is canceled by a response (e.g. Sense) the character remains out of play.

On rare occasions, when this Interrupt attempts to place a character out of the play, another action may cause the character to instead end up at a different location, or returned to hand, or to a stack or pile. In such cases, this Interrupt simply fails and is placed in the Lost Pile.

front.gametext: USED: If you just answered 'no' to a Hypo question, opponent loses 3 Force.  LOST: Cancel Why Didn't You Tell Me? or I Am Your Father. OR If Luke is about to cross to the Dark Side, he is lost instead.
front.lore: Sometimes, the truth isn't very pretty.
front.title: •NOOOOOOOOOOOO!

rulings: If the last function is played against Epic Duel, Light will lose X Force (not triple X Force) as specified on Epic Duel.

front.gametext: *Ferocity = destiny - 4. Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth and Tatooine) and Dark Waters. Cumulatively absorbs (temporarily cancels) one [Dark Side Force] icon present. Parasite: None.
front.lore: Tree-nesting reptile. Favors moist caves and marshes. Extremely docile, despite fearsome appearance. Responsive to Force energy.
front.title: Nudj

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Obi-Wan, who provides ability of 6. Opponent's starships may not 'cloak.' Your total ability here may not be reduced.
front.lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.
front.title: •Obi-Wan In Radiant VII

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.gametext: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi (V) + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.gametext: Obi-Wan's deploy cost may not be increased. Power +1 for each Dark Jedi here. Once per game, may exchange two cards in hand with any one card in Lost Pile. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Are You Brain Dead?! Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Power +2 if Maul present. If Qui-Gon is participating in lightsaber combat and Obi-Wan is present, Qui-Gon may use Obi-Wan's combat cards. Immune to Sniper and attrition < 5.
front.lore: Padawan learner promoted to Jedi Knight after his encounter with Darth Maul. Has sworn to train Anakin Skywalker, even if the Jedi Council forbids it.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight

rulings: This card is <u>not</u> a Padawan.

'Immune to Sniper' prevents the control phase sniping function and prevents the place in Lost Pile function of the combo card. It does not prevent the 3 being added to weapon destiny function of the combo card.

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner

front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (AI)

front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine. If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)

front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine.  If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled.  Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V) (AI)

combo: Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Obi-Wan's Cape Makes Obi-Wan immune to attrition < 5.
Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience
Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.gametext: Permanent weapon is •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: 'The Force will be with you... always.'
front.title: •Obi-Wan With Lightsaber

front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on any site if opponent is generating at least 3 Force more than you. At that site, adjacent sites and same sites as Obi-Wan, players activate Force only if they have presence.
front.lore: 'Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter.' The inner consciousness of a Jedi can transcend even death.
front.title: •Obi-Wan's Apparition

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Rebel or alien. Character is immune to attrition < 5. Also, When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost.
front.lore: A symbol of the noble Jedi and his mysterious powers.
front.title: •Obi-Wan's Cape

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on Luke or Obi-Wan. Your characters present armed with a unique (•) lightsaber Weapon card may not be Disarmed, once per battle may cancel a weapon destiny just drawn, and that lightsaber's Force drain modifiers may not be canceled. Lost if about to be stolen.
front.lore: Written by Obi-Wan Kenobi. Used by Luke to construct his lightsaber. Contained instructions on building required tools as well. Keyed to self-destruct if not opened by Luke.
front.title: •Obi-Wan's Journal

rulings: The 'lost if about to be stolen' text on this device will trigger any time the device is about to be stolen, even if the Journal is not in an active state.

front.gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: 'An elegant weapon for a more civilized time.' Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
front.title: •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

front.gametext: Deploy on [Episode I] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain if present at a Naboo battleground. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Add 1 if targeting a Dark Jedi. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Constructed by Obi-Wan himself, this Padawan's lightsaber was responsible for tearing an ancient Sith weapon in half.
front.title: •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

front.gametext: During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one exterior site to 'transport' (relocate) to another exterior site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Odin's family mysteriously disappeared during a hyperspace jump. He scours the galaxy for information on them, and his best lead has brought him to Tatooine.
front.title: •Odin Nesloor

rulings: The destiny draw and cost are paid during initiation, and then responses (e.g. Sense) may take place.
If retargeted by Surprise, it must EITHER select new characters to be transported OR select a new destination site.
If using Surprise to choose new characters, the new characters may be at the same origin site or a different origin site, but it cannot include any of the original characters.

front.gametext: If your character is about to be hit, use 1 Force (free if by a [Permanent Weapon] weapon); for remainder of turn, its forfeit may not be reduced, it may not be used to satisfy attrition, and it is immune to Dr. Evazan. OR Cancel Disarmed. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel a 'react.' OR During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to an exterior or battleground site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.title: •Odin Nesloor & •First Aid

rulings: The destiny draw and cost are paid during initiation, and then responses (e.g. Sense) may take place.
If retargeted by Surprise, it must EITHER select new characters to be transported OR select a new destination site.
If using Surprise to choose new characters, the new characters may be at the same origin site or a different origin site, but it cannot include any of the original characters.

combo: Off The Edge + Cloud City: Incinerator + EG-4 (Eegee-Four)

front.gametext: Target one of your characters at a Cloud City site. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's destiny number, retrieve Force equal to the distance. If destiny < character's destiny number, lose difference. If destiny = character's destiny number, character is lost.
front.lore: Despite the brutal attacks of the Dark Lord, dying on Cloud City was not Luke's destiny.
front.title: •Off The Edge

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard Bravo 2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and opponent's battle destiny draws are -2 at same system.
front.lore: Growing up in a small town outside of Theed, Porro became adept at speeder control and thrust. His decision to volunteer for Bravo Flight made Ric Olie a very happy man.
front.title: •Officer Dolphe

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anythings she pilots. While piloting Bravo 5 and at same system as a droid starfighter, adds one destiny to attrition only.
front.lore: Computer systems troubleshooter whose sour past is not discussed by her squad mates. Years of experience enabled her to predict and adjust to droid starfighter tactics.
front.title: •Officer Ellberger

front.gametext: Once during your deploy phase, may use 1 Force to relocate Perosei to an adjacent Naboo site. While with a Republic character during battle, may place Perosei out of play to add 5 to your total power this battle.
front.lore: Royal Naboo security guard who can disassemble and reassemble a Naboo blaster in less than sixty seconds. During the occupation, was a prisoner at Camp Four.
front.title: •Officer Perosei

back.errataNotes: E1 version allowed subtracting 2 from a destiny 'once per battle' instead of 'once per turn during battle'. The Jakku location pull used to be in the While section of both sides (no gameplay difference).
back.gametext: Old Allies: Deploy Jakku system and Niima Outpost Shipyard (with [Episode VII] Falcon there). May deploy Graveyard Of Giants. For remainder of game, you may not deploy Combined Fleet Action, Harc Seff, Luke, or Jedi. Your Destiny is suspended. Opponent's [Reflections 2] objective targets Rey instead of Luke. While Rey at a battleground site, Visage Of The Emperor is suspended. Once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if you control Jakku system and occupy two Jakku battleground sites (or vice versa). We Need Your Help: While this side up, once during opponent's control phase, if you control two Jakku battlegrounds and are about to lose Force (except to a Force drain at a Jakku location), may reduce that Force loss to 1 (may not be further reduced). Once per turn, during battle involving your Resistance character, may subtract 2 from a just drawn destiny. While with Han, your [Episode VII] characters and [Episode VII] starships are defense value +2. Flip this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.
back.title: Old Allies / We Need Your Help

front.errataNotes: E1 version allowed Combined Fleet Action. The Jakku location pull used to be in the While section of both sides (no gameplay difference).
front.gametext: Old Allies: Deploy Jakku system and Niima Outpost Shipyard (with [Episode VII] Falcon there). May deploy Graveyard Of Giants. For remainder of game, you may not deploy Combined Fleet Action, Harc Seff, Luke, or Jedi. Your Destiny is suspended. Opponent's [Reflections 2] objective targets Rey instead of Luke. While Rey at a battleground site, Visage Of The Emperor is suspended. Once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if you control Jakku system and occupy two Jakku battleground sites (or vice versa). We Need Your Help: While this side up, once during opponent's control phase, if you control two Jakku battlegrounds and are about to lose Force (except to a Force drain at a Jakku location), may reduce that Force loss to 1 (may not be further reduced). Once per turn, during battle involving your Resistance character, may subtract 2 from a just drawn destiny. While with Han, your [Episode VII] characters and [Episode VII] starships are defense value +2. Flip this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.
front.title: Old Allies / We Need Your Help

front.gametext: Use 1 Force if any of your characters (except Obi-Wan) was just forfeited from a Tatooine site. Mysterious 'crazy wizard' steps in and revives (returns from Lost Pile) that character back to same site.
front.lore: 'That old man's just a crazy wizard.' Obi-Wan lived in Tatooine's deserts for years...ready for the right moment to act.
front.title: Old Ben

rulings: It is not possible to revive a character and forfeit them again in the same battle.
A character who has been made 'forfeit = 0' can still be forfeited, and therefore, can still be revived.
The revived character is a 'fresh copy' unaffected by any previously applied status effects such as 'forfeit = 0' or 'game text canceled for remainder of turn'.
The revived character could even battle again this turn (e.g. by moving to another site with Nabrun Leids and battling there).
Can only revive the exact card that was forfeited, not another copy of that card or persona.

combo: Old Pirates + Han + Lando + Chewie + Luke + Rug Hug + Millennium Falcon Four destiny draws and immunity to attrition < 5.

front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated involving Han and any Lando, the eventual loser of the battle may not lose cards from Life Force to satisfy battle damage while that player has any cards in hand. OR Cancel Double-Crossing, No-Good Swindler.
front.lore: 'How you doing, you old pirate? So good to see you.'
front.title: •Old Pirates

front.gametext: If Luke and Biggs are defending a battle together (or are in any battle together at Tatooine), add one battle destiny. OR If Luke and Biggs are making an Attack Run, add one battle destiny to your Attack Run total.
front.lore: 'I'll be right up there with you! And, have I got stories to tell you...'
front.title: •Old Times

cards.counterpart: They've Shut Down The Main Reactor

front.gametext: If you have a piloted capital starship armed with a starship weapon, use 2 Force to target an opponent's starship present. Until the end of your next turn, target cannot move and its pilots may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
front.lore: Some Imperial starfighters are equipped with sensors, informing the pilot when an enemy craft has targeted him. The pilot's evasive maneuvers cost him time, but save his life.
front.title: •On Target

front.gametext: Use 1 Force and target one Rebel (on table) of ability > 2. Choose a number from 1 to 6. You may retrieve that amount from your Lost Pile if you now draw destiny > chosen number. If you fail, Rebel is lost.
front.lore: Luke and Leia nearly fell over the retracted bridge across the Death Star's central core while trying to elude stormtroopers. They were soon trapped on the precipice.
front.title: On The Edge

front.gametext: If you are about to draw power harpoon weapon destiny, add ability of one pilot aboard same vehicle.
front.lore: 'Cable out. Let 'er go!'
front.title: •One More Pass

cards.counterpart: Weapon Of A Sith - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to steal a weapon from target character using a non-[Episode I] card, must first draw destiny. If destiny +1 > target's ability, weapon stolen. Otherwise, attempt fails and stealing card is placed out of play.
front.lore: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.
front.title: •Only Jedi Carry That Weapon

combo: Oola + It Can Wait

front.gametext: During your control phase, may cause opponent to reveal entire hand by using X Force, where X = number of cards in opponent's hand. All unique (•) male Imperials or unique (•) male aliens there are placed in opponent's Used Pile.
front.lore: Female Twi'lek musician. Became a dancer to live a life of luxury. Has worked for Jabba for only two days. Desperate to escape.
front.title: •Oola

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Sando Aqua Monster. While no card here, may place an opponent's just-drawn battle destiny face-up here. If opponent just drew battle destiny with the same card title as card here, place both cards in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The opee sea killer catches its prey with a long, flexible tongue. It uses camouflage to assist in hunting prey, as well as avoiding larger predators like the sando aqua monster.
front.title: •Opee Sea Killer

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy at the same system as a bomber. 'Explodes' if an opponent's starship deploys or moves here. Draw destiny. Add 2 when targeting a capital starship. Starship lost if total destiny > defense value. Orbital mine is also lost.
front.lore: Often stolen from the Empire. Used by the Rebellion to protect key spaceports. Can be released to cover the retreat of a fleeing strike force.
front.title: <>Orbital Mine

combo: Ord Mantell + Theron Nett Theron Nett adds 1 to each of your Force drains here.

front.gametext: Light:  If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.  Dark:  Each of your bounty hunter pilots add an additional 1 to power of starships they pilot here.
front.title: •Ord Mantell

combo: Order To Engage + All My Urchins The Dark Side player can decide between losing three Force for not battling or losing two Force for attacking.

front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. At the end of each of opponent's battle phases, if a battle did not take place at every location where both players have presence at the end of that phase, opponent loses 3 Force.
front.lore: Political pressure forced the Empire to join battle with the Alliance in otherwise tactically poor situations. Failure to engage the enemy was considered tantamount to treason.
front.title: •Order To Engage

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, each of your X-wings and Y-wings present is power +1 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.  LOST: Lose 1 Force to take up to three non-unique X-wings and/or non-unique Y-wings into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'Hold up here and wait for my signal to start your run.'
front.title: Organized Attack

front.gametext: When Orrimaarko is in a battle you just won against an Imperial, opponent must lose 2 Force. Immune to attrition < 3 (or < 4 when present at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site).
front.lore: Dresselian Scout and resistance leader. Worked tirelessly to combat the subjugation of his homeworld before Bothans brought him into contact with the Alliance.
front.title: •Orrimaarko

combo: Ortolan + CZ-3 + Arcona

front.gametext: Power and forfeit +2 on Hoth or at Dining Room. While at a marker site, cumulatively adds 1 to number of Hoth sites required for opponent to gain a Force drain bonus from Walker Garrison.
front.lore: Squat, floppy-eared food lovers. Ortolans come from the frigid planet Orto. Communicate above the auditory range of most species.
front.title: •••Ortolan

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

canceledBy: Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here (V) - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: Deploy on table. You may immediately take top card of Lost Pile into hand. None Shall Pass is unique (•) and a Lost Interrupt. At each opponent's <> site, your characters and vehicles are each deploy -3 and your Force generation is +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
front.title: •Ounee Ta

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
pulls: Top card of Lost Pile into hand
rulings: If deployed by a Starting Interrupt (e.g. Heading For The Medical Frigate), that Interrupt is not yet in the Lost Pile and cannot be taken into hand.
If deployed during the start of game, may take top card of Lost Pile (if any) into hand. In this case Light's starting hand will have 1 more card than usual.

canceledBy: Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here (V) - Defensive Shield

front.gametext: Plays on table. At each opponent's <> site, your Rebels are each deploy -2 and your Force generation is +1.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
front.title: •Ounee Ta

front.gametext: Deploy on Alderaan. Target one Rebel at Tatooine. When Target reaches Utinni Effect, retrieve one lost Force for each Force-Attuned character you have on table, two for each Force-Sensitive or Jedi. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: Following her father Bail Organa's instructions, Leia placed the Death Star plans into R2-D2, hoping that they could be delivered safely to Alderaan by Obi-Wan Kenobi.
front.title: •Our Most Desperate Hour

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Must be deployed upon the Alderaan system location, not a site or sector.
underlyingCardFor: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan / A Weakness Can Be Found

front.gametext: USED: If your Rebel of ability > 2 just won a battle or duel, randomly take into hand one card stacked on Insignificant Rebellion. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: If Luke is in battle (except with Vader), subtract 2 from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
front.lore: 'The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him.'
front.title: •Our Only Hope

rulings: The Lost function is played during weapons segment, scheduling the -2 modifier(s) for later.

front.gametext: During your control phase, use 2 Force to release a starship held by any Tractor Beam. (Not effective on Death Star Tractor Beam if Central Core in play.) OR Randomly select one card from opponent's Lost Pile or Blaster Rack and place out of play.
front.lore: 'I hope that old man got the tractor beam out of commission or this is gonna be a real short trip.'
front.title: Out Of Commission

front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to randomly place one card in opponent's Lost Pile out of play.  LOST: Cancel one hologram. OR Use 4 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 to destiny for each asteroid sector on table. If total destiny> 3, Imperial Holotable site is 'blown away' (opponent loses 4 Force).
front.title: Out Of Commission & Transmission Terminated

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at a system or sector where you have a starship with maneuver > 3, use 1 Force to add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Black market sensor-stealth arrays can be used to hide starships from enemy sensor scans. Stellar interference can naturally shield a starship for surprise attacks.
front.title: Out Of Nowhere

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle with more than double your total power, search your Reserve Deck. Any one character you find there may deploy as a 'react' (at normal use of the Force). Reshuffle.
front.lore: When the ghost-like image of Obi-Wan failed to appear, another came out of the light to rescue Luke.
front.title: •Out Of Somewhere

combo: Outrider + Dash Rendar + Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 1 passenger. Utinni Effects which retrieve Force are immune to Alter, but are placed out of play when completed. While Dash or Leebo piloting, immune to attrition< 4.
front.lore: Highly modified Corellian Engineering Corporation YT-2400. KonGar KGDefender military grade ion engines. Griffyn/Y2TG hyperdrive. Never boarded by Imperial customs.
front.title: •Outrider

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Angelo Consoli - World Champion 2002)

front.gametext: May add Harc as a pilot. During battle, adds one destiny to total power. If a Dark Jedi or Sith was just deployed to a related site, may deploy a related location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 at Bespin).
front.lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.
front.title: •Overseer

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
rulings: Overseer may deploy a location even if it is landed or unpiloted.

front.gametext: Deploys free at Lars' Moisture Farm. Power +2 if at same site as Beru Lars or a Vaporator. If lost from table during opponent's turn, Luke is power +3 until the end of your next turn.
front.lore: Guardian of Luke Skywalker. Husband of Beru Lars. Brother of Obi- Wan Kenobi. Farmer of moisture. Disapprover of Luke's desire to leave Tatooine.
front.title: •Owen Lars

combo: Owen Lars & Beru Lars + Harvest + Luke
Owen Lars & Beru Lars + Harvest + Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm

front.gametext: Deploy free to Lars' Moisture Farm. Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. If opponent has a Stormtrooper at a Tatooine site, you may not play Harvest. If lost during opponent's turn, Luke is power +6 until end of your next turn.
front.lore: Watchful guardians of Luke Skywalker. When the Lars' moisture farm was attacked by stormtroopers, Luke's life changed forever.
front.title: •Owen Lars & •Beru Lars

rulings: This card is both male and female.

combo: Padme Naberrie + Jerus Jannick

front.gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
front.title: •Padme Naberrie

front.gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
front.title: •Padme Naberrie (AI)

combo: Padme Naberrie + Jerus Jannick

front.gametext: Cancels Vader's game text here. If with a Skywalker, may add one destiny to attrition. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
front.title: •Padme Naberrie (V)

front.gametext: Cancels Vader's game text here. If with a Skywalker, may add one destiny to attrition. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
front.title: •Padme Naberrie (V) (AI)

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 3 to power of anything he drives). When driving a transport vehicle, it moves for free and he adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.
front.title: Palace Raider

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
rulings: This card is <u>not</u> an Ishi Tib.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. This character (and other Palace Raiders) are deploy -3 if You're A Slave? on table. While driving a vehicle, it is power +3, defense value +1, and moves for free.
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.
front.title: Palace Raider (V)

rulings: This card is <u>not</u> an Ishi Tib.
This card deploys -3 if You're A Slave? on table. Then, while active on table, it causes other Palace Raiders to deploy -3.
The deploy -3 text is not cumulative (not even if one is on table and one is in hand - the result will be deploy -3, not deploy -6).

combo: Palejo Reshad + Corellia

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at Audience Chamber, all your Corellians are power and forfeit +1 (+2 if non-unique) and your Force generation at the Corellia system is +2.
front.lore: Corellian spice trader. Makes a large profit by selling spice in Jabba's court. Secretly uses part of the profit to help fund the Rebellion.
front.title: •Palejo Reshad

combo: Panaka, Protector Of The Queen + Queen Amidala + We Don't Have Time For This If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

front.gametext: Deploys for free to a Naboo site. While with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. While on Naboo, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader of the Royal Naboo security Forces. Fought alongside Amidala in order to capture Viceroy Nute Gunray.
front.title: •Panaka, Protector Of The Queen

front.gametext: Deploys for free to a Naboo site. While with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. While on Naboo, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader of the Royal Naboo security Forces. Fought alongside Amidala in order to capture Viceroy Nute Gunray.
front.title: •Panaka, Protector Of The Queen (AI)

combo: Panaka's Blaster + Captain Panaka + Crack Shot + Rebel Artillery If Panaka hits a character, the Dark Side will have to lose three Force and the character.

front.gametext: Deploy on Panaka. May target a character, creature, or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value. When this blaster hits a character or vehicle in battle, your total power here is +3 for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Naboo blaster personally modified by Captain Panaka. Boosted by extra power packs that allow it to maintain sustained fire in tense situations.
front.title: •Panaka's Blaster

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons. Any others are lost.
front.lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.
front.title: Panic

rulings: The revealed cards may be deployed in any order.
Does not circumvent any deployment rules such as requiring presence or Force icons, Dagobah rules, etc.
All cards revealed but not deployed are lost.
If the player somehow shuffles the Reserve Deck, any remaining revealed cards are un-revealed and shuffled in, ending the action.
If the player somehow activates or loses Force from Reserve Deck while the top card is revealed, it is un-revealed and then activated/lost normally.

front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each light side icon at same Endor site. May pilot only speeder bikes. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Free Ride into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous thief. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. 'Not bad for a little furball.'
front.title: •Paploo

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: While on Endor, Perimeter Patrol is suspended. Once per game, if in battle with a speeder bike (or two scouts), may relocate Paploo and one opponent's character of ability < 4 present with him (unless either are 'hit') to an adjacent site.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous thief. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. 'Not bad for a little furball.'
front.title: •Paploo (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on your non-alien, non-Jedi character. When deployed, choose a species of an alien here. Character gains that species. Aliens of that species may deploy (for -1 Force if non-unique) or move here as a 'react'. While on Endor, adds one [Light Side Force] icon.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.
front.title: •Part Of The Tribe

front.gametext: Cancel Rite of Passage. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.
front.lore: Yoda didn't say anything bad about taking the 'quick and easy corridor.'
front.title: •Path Of Least Resistance

front.gametext: Place one opponent's Undercover spy in opponent's Used Pile. OR If opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.
front.title: •Path Of Least Resistance & •Revealed

front.gametext: Power +1 or Coruscant of Bespin. May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. May deploy or move as a 'react.' At cloud sectors, may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.
front.lore: Small, lightly armed, enclosed vehicle widely used throughout the galaxy. Sometimes used as a pleasure craft by wealthy eccentrics.
front.title: Patrol Craft

combo: Perimeter Scan + Wyron Serper Add 2 to the destiny of this card.

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to glance at any one card which is face-down at a location. OR Use 1 Force to glance at opponent's hand. You may move each droid spy and Infantry Mine you find there to opponent's Used Pile. OR Cancel Probe Telemetry.
front.lore: 'It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here.'
front.title: Perimeter Scan

cards.counterpart: Turn It Off! Turn It Off! (V)

front.gametext: USED: Play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect. OR Target opponent's just-deployed [Maintenance] card. Target may not battle (or allow opponent to deploy cards from Reserve Deck) for remainder of turn. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: Cancel Trample (unless targeting an Undercover spy).
front.lore: 'It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here.'
front.title: Perimeter Scan (V)

front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. May deploy (with a pilot) or move as a 'react' to same system as a Rebel starship. When with Ghost, adds one destiny to total power.
front.lore: Phoenix Squadron.
front.title: •Phantom

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
rulings: Ghost and Phantom must both be piloted to add a destiny to power.

front.gametext: Deploys for free at a docking bay. Adds 2 to the power of anything she pilots. While at opponent's docking bay, adds 2 to your Force drains there, and your other characters there are defense value +1 and immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Good-natured former pilot whose family owns a galactic transportation company. Years of travel has her to learn many loopholes in spaceport protocol.
front.title: •Phylo Gandish

combo: Artillery Remote
Evacuation Control
Portable Fusion Generator
Toryn Farr
Weapons Display

front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior Rebel Base site. During a battle at related system, may target a capital starship there using 2 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > armor, all starship weapons aboard target are lost, power = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
front.lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.
front.title: •Planet Defender Ion Cannon

rulings: Whether fired during battle or at another time, the target starship is power and hyperspeed = 0 until it leaves play (or until something makes it 'restored to normal').
Weapons aboard the starship are only lost as a one-time response to the Cannon firing. Weapons can subsequently be deployed on the starship without becoming lost.

front.gametext: Plays on any interior site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.
front.title: •Planetary Defenses

front.gametext: Plays on any site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs. Cancels Program Trap here. Unless Death Star: Docking Bay 327 on table, Commence Primary Ignition is canceled.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.
front.title: •Planetary Defenses (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on a Death Star site where a stormtrooper was just lost. Target one of your characters not on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, relocate to target. Target is now 'disguised:' gains spy skill, power and forfeit +2, and armor = 5.
front.lore: Luke and Han took the armor suits from fallen stormtroopers and used them as both protection and disguise to penetrate the detention cell block aboard the Death Star.
front.title: •Plastoid Armor

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

underlyingCardFor.title: Generation One Armor Always Holds Up

cancels: A just drawn weapon destiny to cause a redraw

front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to cancel an opponent's Force drain. If a justice agenda here, during a battle where opponent has a weapon and you do not, may cancel a just drawn weapon destiny to cause a re-draw.
front.lore: Amidala did not hold much hope in the options she had. Regardless of how limited the choices, she had to choose one path to try and avert disaster befalling Naboo.
front.title: •Plea To The Court

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

back.gametext: Plead My Case To The Senate:Deploy Galactic Senate and any other [Episode I] location.{For} remainder of game, Rebel and Imperial leaders of ability < 4 are politics +2. Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. You may deploy cards on your Political Effects to table. At Galactic Senate, weapon destiny draws are -6, creatures are lost and game text of non-Republic characters is canceled.{Flip} this card if you have 3 senators (or 2 senators, at least one with a peace agenda) at Galactic Senate.Sanity And Compassion:{While} this side up, once during your control phase may use 3 Force to place up to two random cards from opponent's hand into their Used Pile. Once per turn may take a Political Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your senators are destiny +2 (or +3 for any character with an order agenda) when drawn for battle or weapon destiny. May use 2 Force at end of a turn to place all cards on your Political Effects into Used Pile.{Flip} this card if you have less than two senators at Galactic Senate.
back.title: Plead My Case To The Senate / Sanity And Compassion

Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. You may deploy cards on your Political Effects to table.
