front.gametext: Deploy on Tatooine system or Dagobah system. Target another system. At locations related to target system, opponent's Force drain modifiers are canceled. Effect canceled of opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Rebellion operates freely in many Outer Rim territories, allowing them to ignore Imperial activities in the core systems.
front.title: •The Planet That It's Farthest From

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Only cancels Force drain modifiers that come from DS cards affecting DS Force drains.
For example, if DS Force drains at the LS system Tibrin, the +1 modifier in Tibrin's game text is not canceled because it is a LS card.
For example, if LS Force drains at the DS site Cloud City: Interrogation Room, the +1 modifier in the site's game text is not canceled because it is a LS Force drain.

canceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your side of the table (free if C-3PO on table). If you have a protocol droid aboard a starship or vehicle in a battle, you may use X Force to reduce the battle damage against you by X (by X + 1 if a Nav Computer character is also aboard).
front.lore: Protocol droids are programmed to interface with a variety of computer technologies. Quick and precise interpretation can dramatically increase operational efficiency.
front.title: •The Professor

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Plays on table. While you have 12 or fewer cards in hand, opponent may not remove cards from your hand (except with Monnok). Once per turn (even at start of turn), may target a [Coruscant] Political Effect; it is suspended for the remainder of the turn.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •The Republic No Longer Functions

front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Rebel Strike Team on table, your Force generation is +1 at Endor sites and you may deploy Back Door from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When Bunker 'blown away,' retrieve 8 Force and opponent must place their hand in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Lando's confidence in the Rebel strike team on the forest moon was rewarded, and proved to be a decisive factor at the Battle of Endor.
front.title: •The Shield Is Down!

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your scouts move for free to and from Back Door when using their landspeed. Once per turn, may deploy an Endor battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While an Explosive Charge at Bunker, flip Rebel Strike Team and Garrison Destroyed may not flip. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Lando's confidence in the Rebel strike team on the forest moon was rewarded, and proved to be a decisive factor at the Battle of Endor.
front.title: •The Shield Is Down! (V)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: The Signal + Haven

front.gametext: USED: Use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take one Effect of any kind into hand; reshuffle.  STARTING: Deploy from your Reserve Deck one Effect which has no deploy cost; reshuffle. Place Interrupt in the Lost Pile.
front.lore: With a quick motion of his hand, Luke signaled Artoo and dramatically changed the situation.
front.title: •The Signal

front.gametext: If you just initiated a second battle this turn, deploy on table. When you lose a battle, you may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to cancel all battle damage against you, unless Draw Their Fire on table. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: 'With the Imperial Fleet spread throughout the galaxy in a vain effort to engage us, it is relatively unprotected.'
front.title: •The Time For Our Attack Has Come

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: May deploy on a Star Destroyer/vehicle that does not have any immunity to attrition.

cancels: Surprise Assault may not be played

front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Yoda is on Dagobah and Jedi Test #3 is present with target apprentice, it is completed. Also, you may not play Surprise Assault. Each apprentice on Dagobah is landspeed = 2 and may not be targeted by Set For Stun. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'When nine hundred years old you reach, look as good you will not. Hmmm?'
front.title: •The Way Of Things

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. When in a battle with at least two of your other Jawas, adds one battle destiny. When your total battle destiny at Thedit's site is greater than opponent's total battle destiny, Thedit reduces attrition against you by 3.
front.lore: Organizes perimeter patrols for Kalit's territory. Inspiring leader. Keeps a watchful eye for krayt dragons, Tusken Raiders, and Wittin's bandits.
front.title: •Thedit

pulledBy: Princess Organa to deploy to same location
rulings: This card is a Jawa.
May serve as a Jawa Rep for Agents In The Court.

front.errataNotes: Original had a Reflections III icon. Original Text: Plays on Your Destiny unless Leia or Luke has been deployed this game (even as a captive). [Death Star II] Luke and We're The Bait are lost. Opponent's Objective and [Death Star II] Effects target Leia instead of Luke. Force loss from Take Your Father's Place is -1.
front.gametext: Plays on Your Destiny unless Leia or Luke has been deployed this game (even as a captive). We're The Bait is lost. Opponent's Objective and [Death Star II] Effects target Leia instead of Luke. Attempts to cross Leia over are -2. Opponent loses no Force to their Objective.
front.lore: Princess Leia Organa. Alderaanian senator. Targeted by Vader for capture and interrogation. The Dark Lord of the Sith wanted her alive.
front.title: •There Is Another

rulings: If the card Luke Skywalker, The Emperor's Prize was successfully deployed at the start of the game, There Is Another may not be played that game.

back.gametext: There Is Good In Him:Deploy Chief Chirpa's Hut (with [Death Star II] Luke and Luke's Lightsaber there), Endor: Landing Platform and I Feel The Conflict.{For} remainder of game, you may not play Alter, Strangle, or Captive Fury.{While} this side up, your Force generation is +2 at Luke's site. While an Imperial is at Landing Platform, you may not Force drain or generate Force at Luke's location. When any Imperial is at Luke's site, Luke is captured (seized by an Imperial, if possible, even if not a warrior).{Flip} this card if Luke captured.I Can Save Him:{While} this side up, at end of each of opponent's turns, opponent loses 2 Force unless Vader is escorting Luke. At any time, an Imperial escorting Luke may transfer Luke to Vader, if present with Vader. Vader may not transfer Luke. Once during each of your turns, if Vader present with Luke (even as a non-frozen captive), may shuffle Reserve Deck and draw destiny. If destiny > 14, Vader crosses to Light Side, totally depleting opponent's Life Force.{Flip} if Luke neither present with Vader nor a captive.
back.title: There Is Good In Him / I Can Save Him

front.gametext: There Is Good In Him:Deploy Chief Chirpa's Hut (with [Death Star II] Luke and Luke's Lightsaber there), Endor: Landing Platform and I Feel The Conflict.{For} remainder of game, you may not play Alter, Strangle, or Captive Fury.{While} this side up, your Force generation is +2 at Luke's site. While an Imperial is at Landing Platform, you may not Force drain or generate Force at Luke's location. When any Imperial is at Luke's site, Luke is captured (seized by an Imperial, if possible, even if not a warrior).{Flip} this card if Luke captured.I Can Save Him:{While} this side up, at end of each of opponent's turns, opponent loses 2 Force unless Vader is escorting Luke. At any time, an Imperial escorting Luke may transfer Luke to Vader, if present with Vader. Vader may not transfer Luke. Once during each of your turns, if Vader present with Luke (even as a non-frozen captive), may shuffle Reserve Deck and draw destiny. If destiny > 14, Vader crosses to Light Side, totally depleting opponent's Life Force.{Flip} if Luke neither present with Vader nor a captive.
front.title: There Is Good In Him / I Can Save Him

rulings: In order for Luke to be transferred from an Imperial to Vader, all 3 characters (Luke, Imperial, Vader) must be able to move. For example if Vader is affected by Clash Of Sabers, Luke may not be transferred to Vader.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 10 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Ord Mantell system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Experienced smuggler from Ord Mantell. Piloted Red 10 at the Battle of Yavin. Long-time wingman of Garven Dreis.
front.title: •Theron Nett

front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. While at a battleground system, opponent's starships may not 'cloak.' May lose 1 Force (free if piloting Red 10) to cancel a just-drawn weapon destiny targeting a starship he is piloting.
front.lore: Experienced smuggler from Ord Mantell. Piloted Red 10 at the Battle of Yavin. Long-time wingman of Garven Dreis.
front.title: •Theron Nett (V)

back.gametext: They Have No Idea We're Coming: Deploy Scarif system, Data Vault (with Stardust there), and Massassi War Room. For remainder of game, Baze, Chirrut, and Rebel troopers are spies. You may not deploy Taking Them With Us or Jedi. While this side up, once per turn, may deploy Rogue One, a corvette, or a Scarif site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if you control two Scarif locations. Until We Win, Or The Chances Are Spent: While this side up, your spies are defense value +2 (and power +1 if with Stardust) and are immune to Undercover. While Stardust on your spy, opponent may not cancel your Force drains at battlegrounds. Once per turn, may place a Rebel in your Lost Pile out of play to make a regular move with your Rebel spy during your control phase or cancel an attempt to target your non-Undercover Rebel spy with a weapon. Flip this card if you do not occupy two Scarif locations (unless Rogue One at a Scarif site you occupy).
back.title: They Have No Idea We're Coming / Until We Win, Or The Chances Are Spent

front.errataNotes: E1 version allowed Taking Them With Us, and could pull any Rebel starship except Home One or Reflections III Falcon.
front.gametext: They Have No Idea We're Coming: Deploy Scarif system, Data Vault (with Stardust there), and Massassi War Room. For remainder of game, Baze, Chirrut, and Rebel troopers are spies. You may not deploy Taking Them With Us or Jedi. While this side up, once per turn, may deploy Rogue One, a corvette, or a Scarif site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if you control two Scarif locations. Until We Win, Or The Chances Are Spent: While this side up, your spies are defense value +2 (and power +1 if with Stardust) and are immune to Undercover. While Stardust on your spy, opponent may not cancel your Force drains at battlegrounds. Once per turn, may place a Rebel in your Lost Pile out of play to make a regular move with your Rebel spy during your control phase or cancel an attempt to target your non-Undercover Rebel spy with a weapon. Flip this card if you do not occupy two Scarif locations (unless Rogue One at a Scarif site you occupy).
front.title: They Have No Idea We're Coming / Until We Win, Or The Chances Are Spent

rulings: When deploying a starship from Reserve Deck, if the starship is unpiloted, may combine it with a pilot from hand, allowing deployment to a system or sector.

Once the player initiates the action to deploy a card from Reserve Deck, they must deploy something if possible. Player is <u>required</u> to combine an unpiloted starship with a pilot from hand if that is the only possible option.

If the attempt to deploy a card from Reserve Deck fails, opponent verifies Reserve Deck (not hand). A judge may be called to review hand and Reserve Deck to confirm that no starship + pilot deployment was possible.

front.gametext: If opponent just Force drained you at a location, deploy on that location. Opponent's Force drains here are +1. Your battle destiny draws here are +1 If you control this location, may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to retrieve 4 Force. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: The Queen realized that you must give up one battle in order to have an advantage in the next.
front.title: •They Win This Round

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to target a starship at an asteroid sector or a 'blown away' system. For remainder of turn, you may add 2 to destiny totals targeting the armor or maneuver of that starship.
front.lore: Flying into an asteroid field is considered to be certain death except by Han Solo, Rycar Ryjerd and the terminally insane.
front.title: •They'd Be Crazy To Follow Us

front.gametext: Once per game, use 2 Force to deploy on Dantooine system. Target Death Star. Opponent may not play Commence Primary Ignition until target reaches Dantooine, canceling Utinni Effect.
front.lore: 'You would prefer another target? A military target? Then name the system!'
front.title: They're On Dantooine

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

cancels: One opponent's 'react' unless opponent uses 2 additional Force

front.gametext: If opponent just deployed a planet site, deploy the related system from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel one opponent's 'react' unless opponent uses 2 additional Force.
front.lore: 'Not this ship, sister.'
front.title: •They're Tracking Us

pulls: Related system if opponent just deployed a planet site

cancels: They've Shut Down The Main Reactor
cards.counterpart: A Dark Time For The Rebellion (V)

front.gametext: USED: Add or subtract 1 from opponent's just drawn destiny. OR Activate 1 Force. LOST: Cancel Close Call, Gravity Shadow, Overwhelmed, or They've Shut Down The Main Reactor. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: 'Not this ship, sister.'
front.title: •They're Tracking Us (V)

rulings: The USED function is not immune to Sense.

combo: A brief list of some cards that work explicitly with Han and Liea: I Know, Count Me In, Wookiee Guide, Someone Who Loves You, This Is Even Better.

front.gametext: If Han and Leia are present together at a battleground site (and neither is Undercover), choose one of the following: Your Force drain is +1 at that site this turn. OR Opponent's Force drains at related locations are -1 next turn. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.
front.lore: 'He's my brother.'
front.title: •This Is Absolutely Right

front.gametext: Lose a droid to cancel all attrition against you at same site this turn. OR Re-target an opponent's weapon to one of your droids at same site as target. If droid is 'hit', use original target's forfeit number.
front.lore: 'We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life.'
front.title: This Is All Your Fault

front.gametext: If Han and Leia are together in a battle you just lost, forfeit one of them to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR If Han is a captive and a battle was just initiated where you have Leia (or vice versa), add one battle destiny. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.
front.lore: It took escape from Hoth, asteroids, slugs, capture, refreshments with Vader, torture and the inevitable carbon-freezing to get Leia to reveal her true feelings for Han.
front.title: •This Is Even Better

combo: This Is More Like It + Obi-Wan OR Son of Skywalker OR Princess Leia OR anyone else with a minor immunity to attrition: Reduce any excess attrition just enough to protect your heroes.  This Is More Like It + Any other valuable characters: If the attrition against you is minimal, you can eliminate it totally.  This Is More Like It + Courage of a Skywalker + Luke OR Leia: Give yourself a power boost, and if your opponent causes any attrition upon your now un-immune Skywalker, who cares? :)  This Is More Like It + Force Retrieval cards: Get the Force back that you lost from This Is More Like It via On/Off the Edges, Death Star Plans, Kessel/Rycars Runs, Reflection, etc.

front.gametext: During a battle, lose X Force to reduce attrition against you by X. OR Cancel This Is Just Wrong.
front.lore: 'You like me because I'm a scoundrel. There aren't enough scoundrels in your life.' 'I happen to like nice men.' 'I'm a nice man.' 'No you're not, you're ..'
front.title: This Is More Like It

front.errataNotes: Original card accidentally omitted the word 'reshuffle' although it was always intended to be there.
front.gametext: USED: Deploy Ghost and Hera simultaneously (for -1 Force each) from your hand and/or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: If Chopper, Ezra, Hera, Kanan, Sabine or Zeb in a battle, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny.
front.title: •This Is MY Ship!

rulings: If one or both cards cannot be found, opponent only verifies Reserve Deck. A judge may be required to verify combined contents of hand and Reserve Deck to check for the cards.
May search Reserve Deck, then decide to deploy both cards entirely from hand (this does not trigger verification).
May deploy both cards from hand only (without searching Reserve Deck).

front.gametext: Relocate one starfighter from a Big One to the related site (or vice versa) for free (opens Slug's mouth if closed). If smuggler aboard, starfighter is immune to attrition and subtracts 5 from asteroid destiny until end of your next turn. OR Cancel Corrosive Damage.
front.lore: The largest space slug on record was 900 meters long. Han suspected he had discovered one that was somewhat larger.
front.title: This Is No Cave

combo: Threepio + Here We Go Again Initiate a second battle this turn, and add two battle destiny!
Threepio + Don't Forget The Droids = send Threepio to the Used pile to cancel the last battle destiny drawn.
Threepio + Artoo = reduce all opponent's battle destiny by 1.
Threepio + Artoo + Artoo, I Have A Bad Feeling About This = NO battle destiny for your opponent.
Threepio + Chewie With Blaster Rifle Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3PO.

front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Endor. Adds 1 to attrition against opponent for each Ewok in battle at same site. If just lost from table during battle, may go to Used Pile. At same and related sites, Cloud city icon, Jabba's Palace icon, and Endor icon characters are immune to Bad Feeling Have I.
front.lore: Against his programming to impersonate a deity. Worshiped by the Ewoks. 'Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhhuuuuhhhhh.'
front.title: •Threepio

combo: Threepio With His Parts Showing + Chewie With Blaster Rifle Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3PO.
Threepio With His Parts Showing + Eventually You'll Lose

front.gametext: If in a battle with Shmi at a site, once per battle may place top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck. Once per turn may place a card from hand on Used Pile to draw top card from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Protocol droid designed by Anakin in order to help his mother. C-3PO was not to be sold when Anakin left with Qui-Gon Jinn for Coruscant.
front.title: •Threepio With His Parts Showing

front.gametext: If in a battle with Shmi at a site, once per battle may place top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck. Once per turn may place a card from hand on Used Pile to draw top card from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Protocol droid designed by Anakin in order to help his mother. C-3PO was not to be sold when Anakin left with Qui-Gon Jinn for Coruscant.
front.title: •Threepio With His Parts Showing (AI)

front.gametext: At the end of any player's draw phase, cause that player to place Used Pile face up on top of Reserve Deck. Shuffle, cut, and replace. When face up cards are removed from Reserve Deck, they are treated as normal (no longer face up).
front.lore: One training exercise for a Jedi's apprentice is to invert one's view to see things from a different perspective. 'The future, the past. Old friends long gone.'
front.title: Through The Force Things You Will See

rulings: Players may <u>not</u> look through the Reserve Deck to see where the cards are. A judge may be requested to count the Reserve Deck.
Player may activate Force 1 at a time, look at the top card of Reserve Deck, and stop activating based on what they see.

front.gametext: Take one automated weapon into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Add 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total. OR Cancel Trooper Charge, Blasted Droid, Trooper Assault or Dark Jedi Presence.
front.lore: Han knew that it was urgent that he quickly finished his assignment.
front.title: •Throw Me Another Charge

front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. During your move phase, if opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, you may use 4 Force to place all but 8 (random choice) in Used Pile. Once during any control phase, you may place up to three cards from hand in Used Pile.
front.lore: Being sent to dispose of two Jedi is the battle droid equivalent of a really bad day at the office.
front.title: •Thrown Back

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Tibanna Gas Miner + Bespin: Cloud City Adds one to the Force drain at Bespin: Cloud City.

front.gametext: When at a site, adds 1 to your Force drains at related cloud sectors. Also, during your activate phase, if at a Cloud City site and you control Bespin: Cloud City, may cumulatively activate 1 Force for every cloud sector on Bespin.
front.lore: Long-time Cloud City resident Willrow Hood. Employed by a mining company which is sympathetic to the Rebels and sells them Tibanna gas at a discount.
front.title: Tibanna Gas Miner

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

combo: Tibrin + On The Edge

front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy, during your control phase, may exchange three cards in hand for any one card in your Lost Pile.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.
front.title: •Tibrin

front.gametext: While at a Tibrin site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your Ishi Tib is on Tibrin) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Tibrin from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: To disrupt the enslavement of the Ishi Tib by the Empire, some Rodian hunters were sent to harass Imperial troop movements on Tibrin.
front.title: Tibrin Operative

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.gametext: If you have a lone vehicle or starfighter in a battle or Attack Run at Beggar's Canyon, Cloud City, Death Star: Trench or an asteroid sector, use 1 Force. At the end of that battle or Attack Run, opponent must forfeit two participating vehicles or starfighters.
front.lore: Rebel pilots often join the Rebellion from Outer Rim worlds. Bush pilots fly by the seat of their pants, giving them a huge advantage in close quarters.
front.title: •Tight Squeeze

front.gametext: Deploy only on Yavin 4 or Hoth, but may move elsewhere. Opponent's aliens and Imperials may not move from same site as Tigran to an Echo or an interior Yavin site.
front.lore: Senior logistics officer from Onderon. Left Dantooine to serve on Yavin 4 before coming to Hoth. All personnel entering Echo Base must report to him.
front.title: •Tigran Jamiro

front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.
front.lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Typically used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Also has many military applications.
front.title: Timer Mine

rulings: Timer Mines are not allowed to use docking bay transit.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and (when in Death Star: Trench) adds 1 to total of Attack Run.
front.lore: Piloted Gold 2 as defensive cover for Gold Leader during attack run in Death Star trench at the Battle of Yavin.
front.title: •Tiree

combo: TK-422 + Sabotage or Sabotage (V)
TK-422 + Double Agent

front.gametext: Deploys only as an Undercover spy at same site as an Imperial. While Undercover, Imperials are deploy +1 at related sites. May voluntarily 'break cover' only during your move phase by using 3 Force. Captured if 'cover broken' by opponent.
front.lore: Corellian smuggler. Spy. Han stole the armor and identity of an enemy soldier that boarded the Millennium Falcon. Bluffed his way into the detention area.
front.title: •TK-422

rulings: May persona replace Han only at same site as an Imperial (TK-422 still goes Undercover).
May be persona replaced (will no longer be Undercover).

combo: Too Close For Comfort + Put That Down: A bit excessive, but this will really frustrate your opponent when they use 2 Force and miss regardless.

front.gametext: USED: If your character was just targeted by a weapon, opponent must use 2 Force or the targeting is canceled.  LOST: Cancel Hit Racer or Podracer Collision.
front.lore: Anakin needed all the help he could get to evade Sebulba's tactics.
front.title: •Too Close For Comfort

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When at any war room, adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of your Planet Defender Ion Cannon on same planet.
front.lore: Chief Controller at Echo Command. Responsible for communicating orders to the troops. Personally gives firing orders to Ion Cannon Control.
front.title: •Toryn Farr

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. Your total battle destiny here is +1 (+2 if piloting a transport). Once per turn, if a battle just ended here, may 'rescue' (retrieve from Lost Pile) a Rebel of ability < 3 forfeited from same location this turn.
front.lore: Chief Controller at Echo Command. Responsible for communicating orders to the troops. Personally gives firing orders to Ion Cannon Control.
front.title: •Toryn Farr (V)

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your side of table. During your control phase, you may return any cards from your hand to the top of your Used Pile.
front.lore: Expert traffic controllers coordinate launches faster than automated launch systems. Rebel bases scramble fighters quickly during Imperial attacks.
front.title: Traffic Control

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Cancel one hologram. OR Use 3 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 to destiny for each asteroid sector on table. If total destiny > 3, Imperial Holotable site is 'blown away' (opponent loses 4 Force).
front.lore: After the mission, the Death Squadron HoloNet communications system reported fifteen system errors: ten computer malfunctions, four power failures and one asteroid.
front.title: Transmission Terminated

combo: Treva Home + Draw Their Fire If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)

front.gametext: During your control phase, may 'sell' one Interrupt card from hand. Opponent must use X Force, where X = destiny of that card or entire Force Pile (opponent's choice). Place sold card on opponent's Used Pile and activate X Force.
front.lore: Lutrillian. Primary saleswoman and executive planner for Planet Dreams, Inc. Monitors production schedules and accounting. Really enjoys making a sales pitch.
front.title: •Treva Horme

front.gametext: Requirements: A gambler or trooper at a site. Wild cards (2-7): Imperial and Rebel leaders. (Troopers may use weapons as wild cards.) Clone cards: Locations and droids. Stakes: One transport vehicle without armor or one character weapon.
front.lore: Troopers stationed at various outposts play this sabacc variant to pass the time between assignments.
front.title: •Trooper Sabacc

combo: Trooper Utris M'Toc + Any Lando, or Lobot. M'Toc deploys for free.
Trooper Utris M'Toc + Lobot + Cloud City Trooper. A powerful force with a cheap deploy cost.

front.gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Deploys free to same Cloud City site as Lando. Power +2 when defending a battle. Your other Cloud City troopers are forfeit +2 where present.
front.lore: Imzig Cloud City trooper and Wing Guard leader. Attempts to protect Cloud City citizens from less reputable members of local constabulary. Never accepts a bribe.
front.title: •Trooper Utris M'toc

rulings: The phrase 'on Cloud City' means at a Cloud City site, not the Bespin: Cloud City sector.

front.gametext: If with your other Resistance character and present at a site, adds 1 to your Force drains here and may place this character in Used Pile to cancel a just drawn weapon destiny here.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •••Tuanul Villager

front.gametext: Search your Force Pile and take one card into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: Han could always see the light at the end of the tunnel.
front.title: Tunnel Vision

front.gametext: Deploy on any Tatooine site where you have just won a battle. Target one of your characters not at Tatooine. Upon reaching, target takes mask. While on Tatooine, target's power and forfeit are +2 and has immunity to attrition of exactly 3.
front.lore: Sand People use a special mask to reclaim exhaled moisture in the hot, harsh environment of Tatooine. Protects by filtering blowing sand and dispersing excess heat.
front.title: •Tusken Breath Mask

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

cancels: You Are Beaten (unless canceling Uncontrollable Fury)

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, may take The Force Is Strong With This One or [Death Star II] Anakin Skywalker into hand from Reserve Deck: reshuffle. May use 2 Force to cancel Dark Jedi Presence or You Are Beaten (unless canceling Uncontrollable Fury). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: When a Jedi dies, the spirit spreads through the Force and touches the living.
front.title: •Twilight Is Upon Me

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
pulls: The Force Is Strong With This One

front.gametext: Deploys -2 aboard Green Squadron 3. Adds 3 to power of any starfighter he pilots. When piloting Green Squadron 3 or any X-wing, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Spy fighting for the memory of his homeworld of Alderaan. Rogue Squadron pilot. Volunteered to fly an A-wing at the Battle of Endor. Former TIE fighter pilot.
front.title: •Tycho Celchu

front.gametext: Adds 3 to the power of anything he pilots. May reveal from hand to steal an unpiloted TIE from opponent's Lost Pile and deploy both simultaneously. Any snub fighter he pilots is maneuver +1 and immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Spy fighting for the memory of his homeworld of Alderaan. Rogue Squadron pilot. Volunteered to fly an A-wing at the Battle of Endor. Former TIE fighter pilot.
front.title: •Tycho Celchu (V)

front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot is *Tycho, who provides ability of 2 and adds 3 to his [Death Star 2] Epic Event destiny draws. During battle, may target a starfighter; target's immunity to attrition is canceled.
front.lore: Flown by Tycho Celchu at the Battle of Endor. Modified canopy improves pilot vision in tight confines. Assigned to fly top cover for Millennium Falcon.
front.title: •Tycho In Green Squadron 3

combo: Tydirium+ Covert Landing + General Solo + Daughter Of Skywalker = This all deploys for only 8 Force, gets you power 5, 2 battle destinies and a whole lotta forfeit.

front.gametext: May deploy (and your characters may deploy aboard) even without presence of Force icons. May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. While Tydirium is at a system location, your scouts deploy -1 aboard.
front.lore: Stolen Imperial Lambda-class shuttle. Supposedly carried parts and technical crew. Delivered General Solo's crack team of Rebel scouts to the forest moon of Endor.
front.title: •Tydirium

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
rulings: This starship is always considered to be stolen (e.g. for Bodhi Rook).

front.gametext: May 'fly' (move) only during your deploy phase, up to two sites away, for 1 Force. Power +1 at Trash Compactor, any Dagobah site or same site as Dark Waters or Tarkin.
front.lore: This male Brizzit, from the planet Jandoon, is hiding from the Imperials on the remote world Tatooine. He hopes to procure passage to the Outer Rim before the Empire finds him.
front.title: •Tzizvvt

combo: Bo Shuda + Uh-oh! + Tatooine: Jabba's Palace (LS)

front.gametext: Deploy on Your side of table. While no Rebels at any Jabba's Palace sites, at all such sites: Imperials are deploy +2, Bo Shuda may not be canceled, Expand the Empire is canceled and your non-unique aliens are each forfeit +1 (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Imperial law had no place in the Hutt's domain.
front.title: •Uh-oh!

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Ultimatum in a Teamwork deck -- The ultimate fighting deck gets infinitely better with the addition of this equalizer. Not only can you drop a nasty surprise on your opponent in the form of multiple destiny adding interrupts, but you can weaken his strategy if he does not fall for you ruse. Either way, you have the advantage.  Ultimatum in an Asteroid Sanctuary deck -- Note that neither Resistance nor Ultimatum affect Asteroid Sanctuary in the slightest, giving the Asteroid Sanctuary deck a slight edge over its opponent, who is probably using either Force drain or inserts as a damage dealing strategy. Load up with Tentacles and Controls to stop Alter, and protect the Asteroids. Add Rycar's Run for some Force retrieval.

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you occupy at least three battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battle grounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Jabba! This is your last chance. Free us or die.'
front.title: •Ultimatum

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card.
front.lore: 'Jabba! This is your last chance. Free us or die.'
front.title: •Ultimatum

front.gametext: Deploy on Vader. He is power +2, but neither adds 1 to battle destiny nor allows Tarkin to cancel destiny. Opponent loses 2 Force at end of each of opponent's turns in which Vader did not battle and you had a character of ability > 3 on table. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The rage of the Dark Lord.
front.title: •Uncontrollable Fury

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Under Attack + Concussion Grenade

front.gametext: During your control phase, target a vehicle with armor present with your warrior. Draw destiny. If warrior has a Concussion Grenade or a lightsaber, add 3 to destiny draw (7 if both). Vehicle (and grenade) lost if total destiny > armor.
front.lore: With the Rebels' limited resources and small numbers, desperate strategies are often required.
front.title: Under Attack

front.gametext: Deploy on your spy at a site and cross spy to opponent's side.  Spy is now Undercover.  During your deploy phase, may voluntarily 'break cover' (lose Effect) if at a site. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Alliance Intelligence expends considerable resources to infiltrate the Imperial military bureaucracy, but the ISB's security sweeps make these shadowy operations dangerous.
front.title: Undercover

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: If the character is persona replaced by a non-spy version, Undercover is lost and the character ceases to be Undercover.

The Undercover character prevents the opponent from Force draining at same site, and allows the owner to deploy to same site even without presence or Force icons. These benefits are the same even if the Undercover character is a droid.
The Undercover character is inactive (for example it does not participate in battles) but outside of battle it may be targeted by Interrupts and anything that could make it dueled, hit, or lost.
The owner may voluntarily break cover during their deploy phase.
If the character's cover is broken (either voluntarily or by another card such as Lt. Pol Treidum), then Undercover is lost.

front.gametext: Deploy on a Tatooine site. Your Force generation here is +1. Opponent may not cancel or modify Force drains at each Tatooine battleground site where you have two aliens with different card titles. At any time, you may use 2 Force to raise your converted Tatooine site to top.
front.lore: Influence, like any commodity, has a price in the Outer Rim territories.
front.title: •Underworld Contacts

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: If an AT-AT, an AT-ST, Jabba's Sail Barge or Planet Defender Ion Cannon has just been lost at a site, draw destiny. All cards with that destiny number at that site are lost.
front.lore: 'Get the gun! Point it at the deck!'
front.title: Unfriendly Fire

cancels: Any Interrupt or Effect with 'Jawa' in the card name

front.gametext: If one of your Jawas is at the same location as any Utinni Effect, 'steal' that Utinni Effect into your hand, to use or lose as your own. OR Cancel any Interrupt or Effect with 'Jawa' in the card name.
front.lore: Jawa trade language word for 'Come here!' Jawas work communally and scavenge for equipment.
front.title: Utinni!

front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Once during each of your control phases, may lose 1 Force to steal into hand one transport vehicle, character weapon or device from opponent's Lost Pile.
front.lore: Experienced Jawa thief. Pilfers equipment and hijacks vehicles from unwary bystanders in Mos Eisley. Het Nkik's ugliest cousin.
front.title: •Uutkik

pulledBy: Aved Luun to deploy to same location
Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. May move as a 'react'. Matching vehicle for any Resistance pilot. Pilot's power = 0, and if targeted by Force Lightning, Trample, or a weapon, may use this card's defense value instead.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: V-4X-D Ski Speeder

front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any Tatooine site. Cannot be moved. Protects all characters at same site, or an adjacent site, from Gravel Storm.
front.lore: Essential for life on desert planets. Condenses water vapor from atmosphere. Has purification filters and coolant tanks. Protects against drought and harsh conditions.
front.title: Vaporator

front.gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if starfighter (use 5 as defense value) or non-creature vehicle deploys or moves to or across same site.  Draw destiny.  Target lost if destiny +2 > defense value.  Vehicle Mine also lost.
front.lore: Mine controlled by microcircuitry calibrated to ignore infantry and creatures. Explodes only when triggered by metallic vehicles.
front.title: Vehicle Mine

combo: Vibro-Ax + Clash Of Sabers Taking your opponent's characters out of battle can be a terrific ability, and this combo can not only take out Vader, but Tarkin as well! Give Chewie a Vibro-Ax, to swing at Tarkin, and have Luke or Obi-Wan Clash Vader.

front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien warrior. Adds 1 to power. May target a character using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target immediately excluded from battle if warrior's power + your destiny > target's power + opponent's destiny.
front.lore: Vibrating blade powered by an energy cell hidden within the shaft. Used by many moisture farmers to prod banthas and other animals.
front.title: Vibro-Ax

rulings: The destiny drawn by the owner of Vibro-Ax is a weapon destiny.
The destiny drawn by the owner of the targeted character is <u>not</u> a weapon destiny.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of any capital starship she pilots. During battle, if piloting a capital starship, may place it and Holdo out of play to add X to your total battle destiny, where X is that starship's armor + hyperspeed.
front.lore: Female leader.
front.title: •Vice Admiral Holdo

rulings: This character is an Admiral.
Holdo's action to place herself and a capital starship out of play occurs during the weapons segment, scheduling the +X modifier for later.
Any other cards aboard the capital starship are lost (not placed out of play).
After placing Holdo and the starship out of play, If Light has no other presence remaining in the battle, the battle ends immediately with no result.
If Light does not successfully complete any battle destiny draws, the +X modifier to total battle destiny is ignored.

front.gametext: Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth). Parasite: Non-droid Character. Each move phase, draw destiny; each time destiny > ability, add 1 to X (X starts at 0). Host is power -X (eaten if power = 0).
front.lore: Constricts hapless victims. Prey usually struggles at first, then weakens as strength diminishes. Difficult to spot. Common hazard on less-developed worlds.
front.title: Vine Snake

combo: That's One makes Visored Visions immune to Sense.

front.gametext: Name an Interrupt card. Opponent must reveal entire Used Pile, without shuffling. Then you choose:USED: Opponent must lose 1 Force for each copy of that Interrupt found there.  LOST: Each copy of that interrupt found there is lost.
front.lore: It's 15 parsecs to Kessel, we've replaced the negative power coupling, it's dark and we're wearing welding goggles. Hit it.
front.title: ••Visored Vision

underlyingCardFor: Old Allies / We Need Your Help

front.gametext: During your control phase, draw destiny. If destiny > 2, draw up to X cards (maximum 4) from Reserve Deck, where X = your total politics at Galactic Senate minus opponent's total politics at Galactic Senate.
front.lore: 'Vote now! Vote now! Vote now!'
front.title: •Vote Now!

cancels: Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost
combo: Vul Tazaenne + Red Leader in Red 1/Gold Leader in Gold 1 + 2 Landing Claws + Kiffex = The coolness of this is it's simplicity. This is not a 6 card combo, but a situation that you can prepare for. You will have the ability to drain for two at Kiffex while keeping a safe distance from your opponent. If they decide to battle you, hide. If you draw any of these cards for destiny, they are all a two's. Also, if you control Kiffex itself with the two starships, Vul will add 4 to all 4's. Not bad for a little 2 deploy character.
Vul Tazaene + Kiffex

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Twice during battle at same system, may use 2 Force to add 2 to any destiny of 2. If present with Tonnika Sisters, Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost.
front.lore: Security officer from Kiffex searching for the Tonnika sisters. In love with one of them, he's not sure which.
front.title: •Vul Tazaene

front.gametext: If opponent just moved or deployed an AT-AT to a planet site, search your Reserve Deck for up to three exterior sites of that planet and immediately deploy them.  Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'Echo station, 3TA. We have spotted Imperial walkers.' A Rebel tactic is to put as much ground as possible between walkers and Rebel troops, allowing time to prepare a defense.
front.title: •Walker Sighting

pulls: Three exterior sites to a planet site

front.gametext: Cancel Too Cold For Speeders. OR Unless opponent's AT-AT or AT-ST at a battleground site, retrieve 1 Force for each Rebel Base location you control (limit 3). OR Your Rebels and T-47s at sites where opponent has an AT-AT or AT-ST are power +2 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'Echo station, 3TA. We have spotted Imperial walkers.' A Rebel tactic is to put as much ground as possible between walkers and Rebel troops, allowing time to prepare a defense.
front.title: •Walker Sighting (V)

rulings: Second function: The initial retrieval amount created by this card will not be greater than 3.

Third function: Targets your Rebel and T-47s that are at sites where opponent has an AT-AT or AT-ST <u>at the time you initiate this Interrupt</u>. Those cards (<u>and only those cards</u>) are then power +2 for remainder of turn, even if no longer with an AT-AT or AT-ST later.

front.gametext: If any warrior is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny. OR If Leia is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny.
front.lore: Each Rebel soldier is driven by bravery and a belief in the Rebel Alliance's ideal of freedom. Courageous and quick-thinking Rebels often defeat Imperial legions.
front.title: •Warrior's Courage

front.gametext: Deploy on any location. For either player to initiate a battle or Force drain anywhere, that player must use +1 Force. Effect canceled if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: A Jedi seeks nonviolent solutions to problems, but may fight to preserve the existence of life. An apprentice must learn which battles to fight and which to avoid.
front.title: •Wars Not Make One Great

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

back.gametext: Watch Your Step:Deploy Cantina, Docking Bay 94 and Tatooine System.{For} remainder of game, opponent activates no Force at your Cantina. Your cards with ability are deploy +6 except Luke, smugglers, freighters, and [Independent] starships. Opponent's game text on Kessel is canceled.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may take Corellia or Kessel into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you occupy two battlegrounds with smugglers or have completed two Kessel Runs.This Place Can Be A Little Rough:{While} this side up, your Force generation is +1 at each system you control with a smuggler. Opponent's Force generation at non-battleground locations is limited to 1. When you have two or more smugglers in a battle, add one battle destiny. Each of your smugglers is forfeit +2. Once during each turn, may play one interrupt from Lost Pile as if from hand (then place that card out of play). Sense, Alter, and Keep Your Eyes Open may not be played.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds (unless you have completed two Kessel Runs).
back.title: Watch Your Step / This Place Can Be A Little Rough

front.gametext: Watch Your Step:Deploy Cantina, Docking Bay 94 and Tatooine System.{For} remainder of game, opponent activates no Force at your Cantina. Your cards with ability are deploy +6 except Luke, smugglers, freighters, and [Independent] starships. Opponent's game text on Kessel is canceled.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may take Corellia or Kessel into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you occupy two battlegrounds with smugglers or have completed two Kessel Runs.This Place Can Be A Little Rough:{While} this side up, your Force generation is +1 at each system you control with a smuggler. Opponent's Force generation at non-battleground locations is limited to 1. When you have two or more smugglers in a battle, add one battle destiny. Each of your smugglers is forfeit +2. Once during each turn, may play one interrupt from Lost Pile as if from hand (then place that card out of play). Sense, Alter, and Keep Your Eyes Open may not be played.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds (unless you have completed two Kessel Runs).
front.title: Watch Your Step / This Place Can Be A Little Rough

front.gametext: USED: Search your Reserve Deck. Take one Collision! or Egregious Pilot Error into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.  LOST: If opponent just initiated a battle with at least two capital starships at a system where you have a lone starfighter, add two battle destiny.
front.lore: They're as clumsy as they are stupid.
front.title: •We Can Still Outmaneuver Them

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at systems you control. Opponent's non-unique starfighters are deploy +1 (or +2 to a system you occupy). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: When severely outnumbered by opponents, any help is good help.
front.title: •We Didn't Hit It

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

combo: We Don't Have Time For This + Captain Panaka or Panaka, Protector Of the Queen + Queen Amidala

front.gametext: If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.  OR  Target an interior Naboo site where opponent has a battle droid. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of battle droids at that site, one of them is lost (opponent's choice).
front.lore: Amidala and Panaka have the weapons training to pin down and remove the greatest combat threat.
front.title: •We Don't Have Time For This

front.gametext: USED: Cancel Res Luk Ra'auf.  LOST: If two bounty hunters (or an Imperial and a bounty hunter) are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract total from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
front.lore: Bounty Hunters. Independent contractors. Highly competitive loners. Powerful. Deadly. Scum.
front.title: We Don't Need Their Scum

pulledBy: I Don't Need Their Scum, Either

back.gametext: We Have A Plan:Deploy Theed Palace Throne Room, Theed Palace Hallway, and Theed Palace Courtyard.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy cards with ability except [Episode I] Jedi, aliens, [Episode I] vehicles, Republic characters and [Republic] starships. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.{While} this side up, you may not deploy characters to interior Naboo sites. Once per turn, may activate 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you control Theed Palace Throne Room (with Amidala there).They Will Be Lost And Confused:{While} this side up, you lose no more than 2 Force to any Force drain. Your [Republic] starships are power +2 and immunity to attrition of [Trade Federation] starships is canceled. If opponent just drew a battle destiny greater than three, you may use 1 Force to cancel that battle destiny. During your control phase, opponent loses 2 Force for each battleground site you control with Amidala or Panaka.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Theed Palace Throne Room.
back.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused

During your control phase, opponent loses 2 Force for each battleground site you control with Amidala or Panaka.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Theed Palace Throne Room.
front.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused

front.gametext: Use 3 Force to take one Effect of any kind into hand from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Take Radiant VII, or one Interrupt with the word 'Podracer(s)' in its game text, into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ambassadors carry a certain amount of political power. Jedi ambassadors carry a lot more.
front.title: •We Wish To Board At Once

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
pulls: One Interrupt with Podracer(s) in game text
We Wish To Board At Once

combo: Weapon Levitation + Sabacc -- Using these two strategies together, you can completely deprive your opponent of weapons, but there are more subtle parts to this strategy. Sabacc is a great way to manipulate your own Used Pile, so that if you draw Anakin's Lightsaber with Sabacc, you can use Weapon Levitation to get it back out of your Used Pile.

front.gametext: USED: Search your Used Pile, take one weapon into hand and reshuffle.  LOST: Cancel You Are Beaten. OR If a battle was just initiated, one of your characters of ability > 3 present may steal one character weapon present.
front.lore: A Jedi is taught to use the anger of his opponents (and their weapons) against them.
front.title: •Weapon Levitation

front.gametext: If your non-[Permanent Weapon] lightsaber was just lost (or stolen) from a site, deploy on your character of ability > 4 at same site. Relocate that lightsaber to this character, who may use that lightsaber, and it may not be stolen. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Darth Maul's complacency in what seemed like imminent victory over the Padawan was his downfall. That, and the lightsaber of Obi-Wan's fallen teacher.
front.title: •Weapon Of A Fallen Mentor

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Each of your starships with two or more starship weapons aboard is power +2. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may use 2 Force to deploy from Lost Pile one starship weapon, vehicle weapon or artillery weapon (for free).
front.lore: The X-wing's display panel allows for different firing patterns for different weapons. This gives the pilot the ability to switch weapon types with minimum time and energy loss.
front.title: •Weapons Display

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
pulls: One starship weapon from Lost Pile
One vehicle weapon from Lost Pile
One artillery weapon from Lost Pile

front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Any character here may be captured or rescued by a player's starship or vehicle controlling Cloud City during that player's control phase.  Character here lost if new character arrives.  Effect lost if Cloud City lost. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The metal rods extending from the bottom of Cloud City are part of the city's flotation system. Sensors detect the velocity of wind and the content of local clouds.
front.title: •Weather Vane

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: While at an exterior planet site or docking bay, once per turn may lose 1 Force to place a 'hit' starship or vehicle at same site, adjacent site, related system or related cloud sector in Used Pile instead of Lost Pile.
front.lore: Cybot Galactica starship maintenance droid. Repairs over 5,000 different onboard systems. Used by Rebel Alliance salvage teams.
front.title: •WED-1016 'Techie' Droid

front.gametext: Adds immunity to attrition < 2 to all your vehicles and droids at same location. Also, if 'bantha' droid is at a docking bay, adds immunity to attrition < 3 to all your starfighters at the related system and related sectors and may cancel Lateral Damage.
front.lore: Unique treadwell droid cobbled together by Jawas. Now owned by the DeMaals, proprietors of Docking Bay 94. Nicknamed 'bantha' for its slow and stubborn personality.
front.title: •WED-9-M1 'Bantha' Droid

combo: Wedge Antilles + Red 2 (or Pulsar Skate) + Moving To Attack Position

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Corellian Slip into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.
front.title: •Wedge Antilles

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting an [Independent] starfighter, it is maneuver +1 (+2 if Pulsar Skate) and Wedge draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While with Booster or Mirax, your total battle destiny here is +1.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.
front.title: •Wedge Antilles (V)

Bren Quersey
Bodhi Rook
