front.gametext: While defending a battle, Interrupts may not be played unless they are [Immune to Sense]. Opponent may not target Grogu with weapons unless each of your Mandalorians and non-[Episode I] Jedi present are 'hit.' Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Grogu

rulings: If an Interrupt is partially immune to Sense, only the immune functions may be played.

front.gametext: May 'fly' (landspeed = 3). May move as a 'react.' Permanent weapon is Flamethrower (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •••Heavy Infantry Mandalorian

rulings: This card's text allows it to move to a battle as a react, not away from a battle as a react.

front.gametext: Deploy on your character of ability > 4. While present: adds 1 to training destiny draws and Force drains here; the first Force lost to a Force drain here is stacked here face down; opponent's ability required to draw battle destiny here is +1 for each card stacked here.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Jedi Holocron

rulings: If a player loses Force from hand to stack here, it is first revealed to both players, then stacked face down.
If a player loses Force from Life Force to stack here, it is not revealed to anyone. Stack it face down, unseen.
Increases the typical '4 ability' requirement for drawing battle destiny.
Also increases any special requirements such as on A Jedi's Strength.
A training destiny draw is 'at' the location of the apprentice.

front.gametext: Light:  Your Wookiees move from here for free when using landspeed.  Dark:  While opponent occupies with a Wookiee, your Force generation here is canceled.
front.title: •Kashyyyk: Sacred Falls (Forest)

rulings: Dark's text does not cancel the icon, so Light can still Force drain and Dark can still deploy.

front.gametext: Light:  While you occupy, your Wookiees at Kashyyyk sites are forfeit +1.  Dark:  While you control, opponent's Wookiees at Kashyyyk sites are power -1.
front.title: •Kashyyyk: Work Settlement #121

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your docking bay transit is free when moving to or from same site. If piloting a freighter or starfighter, may lose 1 Force to cancel an attempt by opponent to target that starship to be captured, 'hit,' or lost.
front.lore: Pacithhip scout. From an unknown system on the Outer Rim. Spends most of his time talking to pilots and travelers at local docking bays.
front.title: •Ketwol (V)

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.gametext: Adds one destiny to total power with Chewie or Jannah (or while piloting). During your turn, may reveal the top three cards of your Reserve Deck, take one starship with a deploy cost < 6 into hand (if possible), and shuffle your Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Leader. Resistance Agent.
front.title: •Lando, Hero Of The Rebellion

rulings: Cannot take B-wing Attack Squadron, X-wing Assault Squadron, or Y-wing Assault Squadron into hand (they do not have a numerical deploy cost).
If there are only 1 or 2 cards in Reserve Deck, Lando can still reveal them, but he cannot take a starship into hand.

front.gametext: While 'communing': You may not deploy Jedi (except Yoda) or [Permanent Weapon] cards; if a Rebel in battle, may use 1 Force to add 3 to your total power (5 if Luke); once per turn, may deploy a battleground that is related to a location on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter.' The inner consciousness of a Jedi can transcend even death.
front.title: •Master Kenobi

rulings: You may not persona replace a character if the new version would violate this card's deployment restrictions.
May use 1 Force to add power in multiple battles in the same turn.
Technically may use 1 Force to add power multiple times in a single battle, but this is fairly useless as only the first usage will be applied.

front.errataNotes: Original card allowed all Jedi to be deployed. Only Jedi Council Members got destiny +1.
front.gametext: While 'communing': You may not deploy Jedi (except Jedi Council members) or Rebels; Jedi are destiny +1; your total power in battles is +1 for each Jedi 'communing'; once per turn, may place a card from hand on Used Pile to draw top card of Force Pile.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon Jinn, An Old Friend

rulings: You may not persona replace a character if the new version would violate this card's deployment restrictions.

front.errataNotes: Original Text: While 'communing': You may not deploy Jedi Knights or [Maintenance] cards; [Dagobah] Luke is deploy -1 and power and defense value +1; once per turn, may deploy a battleground with two [Dark Side] from Reserve Deck; reshuffle; once per game, may retrieve 1 Force.
front.gametext: While 'communing': You may not deploy Jedi Knights, [Maintenance] cards, or [Permanent Weapon] cards; your immunity to attrition is limited to < 4; once per turn, may deploy a battleground with two [Dark Side] from Reserve Deck; reshuffle; once per game, may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Master Yoda

rulings: You may not persona replace a character if the new version would violate this card's deployment restrictions.
(7-side) When calculating immunity to attrition, start with the base immunity and apply any modifiers (such as Darth Tyranus). Finally, apply the limit (limit of < 4 from Master Yoda) last.
For example, Master Windu (normally immune < 6) would first be reduced to < 5 by Tyranus first. Then the limit of < 4 would be applied.
For example, Qui-Gon Jinn (fully immune to attrition) would not be affected by Tyranus at all. Then the limit of < 4 would be applied to Qui-Gon.

front.errataNotes: Original card did not require the Effects to deploy for free, which meant the original could start We're Leaving.
front.gametext: If your starting location had 'communing' in game text, deploy Communing and stack a Jedi with 'communing' in game text on it. Deploy up to three Effects that deploy on table, deploy for free, and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •I Am Part Of The Living Force

front.gametext: Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. If you just verified opponent's Reserve Deck, may use 1 Force to search that Reserve Deck and place one device, weapon, or unpiloted starship there in Lost Pile; reshuffle. If none there, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Jawa. Scavenger. Thief.
front.title: ••Offworld Jawas

rulings: This card is one Jawa, such as for Utinni! (V).

front.gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws and defense value of anything she is aboard as a passenger. While out of play, adds 1 to your total power where you have a Resistance character of ability = 2. If just lost, may place her out of play.
front.lore: Female gunner.
front.title: •Paige Tico

rulings: To place her out of play using her game text, she must be lost from an active or inactive state on table - not from hand or Life Force.

front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated at same site, may name an Interrupt; for remainder of battle, Interrupts with that title may not be played unless they are [Immune to Sense]. Once per game, if Yoda about to be lost, may place him in owner's hand instead.
front.lore: Wookiee leader.
front.title: •Tarfful

rulings: If the chosen Interrupt is partially immune to Sense, only the immune functions may be played.

front.gametext: Light:  While Obi-Wan 'communing,' no Force drains here and, once per turn, may subtract 2 from a just drawn [Permanent Weapon] weapon destiny.  Dark:  -
front.title: •Tatooine: Obi-Wan's Hut (V)

front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated, each of your [Republic] starfighters present is power +1 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn. OR If Anakin and Obi-Wan are in a battle together, cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn (except a battle destiny).
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •This Is Where The Fun Begins

rulings: The first function only affects piloted Republic starfighters (landed starfighters are not piloted).
To play the first function of this Interrupt, Light must be able to target at least one piloted Republic starfighter in the battle.

front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle at an Endor or Kashyyyk site (or any forest), move your non-unique Wookiee there as a 'react.' OR deploy a Wookiee to a Kashyyyk site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Activate 1 Force for each Kashyyyk location you occupy.
front.lore: Chewie felt right at home in the forests of Endor, which closely resemble the environment on his homeworld of Kashyyyk.
front.title: •Wookiee Guide (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on Kachirho. Your Wookiees deploy -1. If you have two Wookiees in battle, draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While your Wookiee alone here, [Dark Side] icons here are canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Wookiee Homestead

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.gametext: When drawn for destiny, once per turn, choose one of your Wookiees to be power +1 for remainder of turn. If a battle was just initiated involving your Wookiee, add one destiny to total power. OR Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your Wookiee to be lost or captured.
front.lore: 'GHRRRRAARRRRHG!'
front.title: •Wookiee Roar (V)

rulings: Plays against Hidden Weapons during the response step, preventing the Hidden Weapons destiny from being drawn.
Only cancels the attempt, so for example Hidden Weapons still goes to Used Pile.
Using the first sentence of this card's text when drawn for destiny is not considered to be 'playing' the Interrupt.

front.gametext: During battle at a site, may add one destiny to total power. Once during battle, unless 'hit,' may lose this character to restore your 'hit' character here to normal.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •••Wookiee Warrior

rulings: If K'lor'slug (V) is on table, attempting to use this card's text to lose itself will fail to restore the 'hit' character to normal, but will still cause Wookiee Warrior to be lost at end of battle per K'lor'slug (and if forfeited, forfeit for 0).

front.gametext: If drawn for destiny, each of your Wookiees is power +1 for remainder of turn. Agenda: taxation. At Kashyyyk sites where you have two Wookiees present and your total power > 10, your Force drains are +1.
front.lore: Kashyyyk's senior Wookiee senator. Believes that a thorough taxation plan will assist funding of other worthwhile Republic programs. Despises the corruption around him.
front.title: •Yarua (V)

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Unless with Boba Fett, your total power is +2 here. While piloting a capital starship, it is immune to attrition < 4 and, once per game, if it is about to be lost, may relocate your characters aboard to a related exterior site.
front.lore: Corellian leader.
front.title: •Admiral Kilian

rulings: Total power +2 works at sites and at systems, as long as there is no Boba Fett (from either player) at that location.
All characters must relocate to the same site.

front.gametext: Dark:  Light: Deploys only as a starting location. If you just chose You Have That Power, Too on your [Skywalker] Epic Event, deploy My Parents Were Strong from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Ajan Kloss: Training Course

rulings: Cannot be deployed by another card (such as an Objective or Starting Interrupt).

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your unique (•) Republic characters (and your unique (•) Gungans) of ability < 4 are forfeit +1. Nabrun Leids and Elis Helrot are limited to owner's move phase and exterior sites only. Once per turn, may deploy a docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during opponent's turn, if Jar Jar or your [Episode I] leader occupies an [Episode I] battleground, may activate 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.title: •Another Pathetic Lifeform & •Security Control

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Read this as owner's move phase and <u>any</u> exterior sites (not as owner's move phase and <u>owner's</u> exterior sites).
For Nabrun and Elis, the origin site and the destination site must <u>both</u> be exterior (interior/exterior sites such as Death Star: Docking Bay are allowed).

front.gametext: Deploy on an Ahch-To location. Opponent generates no Force here. A Thousand Generations Live In You Now: Rey is power and forfeit +1 for each Jedi out of play. Bring Back The Balance, Rey, As I Did: While [Set 14] Rey in battle, your battle destiny draws and Rey's weapon destiny draws are +1. Feel The Force Flowing Through You: [Set 14] Rey and characters with her may not add battle destiny draws. Rey, The Force Will Be With You, Always: [Set 14] Rey ignores your [Episode VII] objective deployment restrictions.
front.title: •Be With Me

rulings: Jedi stacked on Communing are counted as Jedi out of play.
(3rd section) A non-character card can add battle destinies (e.g. I'm Getting Pretty Good At This) but cannot cause a character to add battle destinies (e.g. Meditation).
(3rd section) Characters that draw multiple battle destiny 'if unable to otherwise' still do so while with Set 14 Rey.
(4th section) When using the Legend objective, Light can deploy Set 14 Rey even if they have a Jedi on table. But they cannot deploy a Jedi if they have Set 14 Rey on table.

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys free to opponent's Audience Chamber. While opponent has more characters here than you, adds one battle destiny. Opponent's characters of lesser ability are power -1 here. Immune to Hidden Weapons.
front.lore: Mandalorian.
front.title: •Boba

rulings: Cannot be used by Dark to meet the conditions for initiating Hidden Weapons.
Cannot be targeted by Dark to receive the consequences of Hidden Weapons.
Adds battle destiny automatically during the power segment if Boba is still participating in the battle and the condition is met at that time.
Any card that targets Boba Fett (e.g. Mandalorian Mishap) may target Boba.
This card is a Fett (e.g. Boba deploys -1 at Kamino: Clone Training Center, and Mace Windu (V) prevents Boba from adding a battle destiny).

front.gametext: Your Mandalorians here are immune to Imperial Barrier and Stunning Leader. Blasters deploy and fire for free on Bo-Katan. If another Mandalorian (or your weapon) here, opponent's characters here may not have their forfeit value increased.
front.lore: Female Mandalorian leader and scout.
front.title: •Bo-Katan

rulings: Protects herself from Imperial Barrier and Stunning Leader.
If deployed to a location where another character has already been affected by Imperial Barrier or Stunning Leader, does not restore that character to normal.
First sentence affects only your Mandalorians. Third sentence checks for either player's Mandalorian.
If firing a repeating blaster (e.g. BlasTech E-11B Blaster Rifle), only the first shot is free.

front.gametext: While present with Shmi, Vader may not fire weapons here. Once per game, may deploy Owen (or a device that deploys on a site) here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If with Shmi or a Vaporator, Force drain +1 here.
front.lore: Moisture farmer.
front.title: •Cliegg Lars

rulings: May deploy the Owen Lars & Beru Lars combo card.
May deploy devices that deploy at/on/to a site (e.g. Remote), as long as the device can deploy directly to the site (not onto another card such as a character).

front.gametext: Dark: No Force drains here.  Light: Once per turn, may take a Jedi Test or Dagobah site into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Dagobah (V)

pulls: It Is The Future You See
rulings: Light may take a Jedi Test or Dagobah site into hand on each player's turn.

front.errataNotes: Original text (all on Light side): Deploys only as a starting location. There Is Another does not cause [Reflections 2] Luke to be lost. If you just chose I Have It on your [Skywalker] Epic Event, deploy Like My Father Before Me from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.gametext: Dark:  Light: If you just chose I Have It on your [Skywalker] Epic Event, deploy Like My Father Before Me from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If Anakin 'communing,' you may initiate battles for free.
front.title: •Endor: Anakin's Funeral Pyre

front.gametext: If My Parents Were Strong on table, choose: take Saddle or a Kef Bir site into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR During battle, add X to your total power, where X = number of your cards out of play.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Everything We Need

rulings: Jedi stacked on Communing are counted as cards out of play.
Count the cards in your out of play area (not the opponent's) regardless of whether the cards are stolen.
Both functions of this card require My Parents Were Strong on table.

front.gametext: Once per turn, may deploy a bowcaster on your Wookiee at same or adjacent site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During your control phase, if present at a Kashyyyk battleground site and armed with a bowcaster, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Wookiee leader.
front.title: •Grakchawwaa

rulings: May deploy Chewbacca's Bowcaster (but not 'Chewie With Bowcaster').
May deploy the bowcaster on himself.

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, may deploy an R-unit droid from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During a battle where your droid present with a Scomp link, your total power is +1 (+3 if your other droid present with a Scomp link at a related location). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Left to his own devices, Artoo used his spunk and creativity to save his companions' lives time and time again.
front.title: Hero Of A Thousand Devices (V)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: An R-unit droid is defined as any droid character card that says it is either an astromech or vehicle droid.
R-3PO is not an R-unit droid.
Combo cards may be deployed - Artoo & Threepio is an R-unit droid, as is R2-D2 & C-3PO.
The power +3 bonus requires that the droids be at two different (but related) locations. A system and related site are acceptable.
For a droid to be present with the Scomp link of a starship or enclosed vehicle, the droid must be in driver/pilot/passenger/astromech capacity of that starship or vehicle.

front.gametext: Whenever you deploy Chopper, Ezra, Hera, Kanan, Sabine, or Zeb, may draw top card of your Used Pile. Once during your draw phase, if Kanan at a battleground and he did not move this turn, may peek at cards in your Used Pile. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Kanan Jarrus, Jedi Knight

rulings: Relocating (e.g. Nabrun Leids) and unlimited moves (e.g. embarking a vehicle) count as Kanan moving.
Do not reorder or reshuffle the cards in the Used Pile.

front.gametext: Dark: Unless you occupy, Kylo and Sidious deploy -1 here.  Light: Unless Ben Solo, Han, or Rey here, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Kef Bir: Oceanic Wreckage

rulings: Dark's text affects all characters of the Sidious persona, including Emperor Palpatine and the Light card Senator Palpatine, etc.

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. While Luke or Talon Karrde on table, power +1 and she moves for free. Anakin's Lightsaber may deploy on your Mara. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Female smuggler.
front.title: •Mara Jade

rulings: May be deployed even if opponent's Mara is also on table, and vice versa.
May use a stolen Mara Jade's Lightsaber.

Moving For Free: When using Nabrun Leids or docking bay transit, the cost is free <u>only</u> if Mara is moving alone or if the cards moving with her also move for free (Light still draws destiny for Nabrun Leids).

front.gametext: Deploy on Training Course. When deployed, stack [Set 4] Falcon face up here from outside your deck. Falcon may deploy from here as if from hand. Rey is a Skywalker. Once per battle involving Rey, may take your just drawn destiny into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •My Parents Were Strong

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Even if this card is deployed in the middle of a game, it still stacks a Set 4 Falcon from outside of the deck.
The Falcon initially stacks here 0-side up, and only deploys from here 0-side up.
The Falcon stacked here <u>can</u> be deployed by Best Starpilot In The Galaxy.
The Falcon stacked here <u>cannot</u> be revealed via Squadron Assignments.
The Falcon stacked here from outside the deck does not count towards the 60-card deck limit.

front.gametext: During battle, add 1 to opponent's just drawn destiny (or to your just drawn weapon destiny). OR If Your Thoughts Dwell On Your Mother on table, take Night Club or Skywalker Hut into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Anakin needed all the help he could get to evade Sebulba's tactics.
front.title: •Now, This Is Podracing!

rulings: Whoooo!

front.gametext: Plays on table. At each opponent's <> site, your Rebels are each deploy -2 and your Force generation is +1. May lose 3 Force to cancel an attempt by [Theed Palace] Sidious to place your Jedi out of play.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
front.title: •Ounee Ta (V)

front.gametext: Plays on table. At each opponent's <> site, your Rebels are each deploy -2 and your Force generation is +1. May lose 3 Force to cancel an attempt by [Theed Palace] Sidious to place your Jedi out of play.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
front.title: •Ounee Ta (Jabba's Palace Sealed Deck) (V)

front.gametext: Dark: Your docking bay transit to or from here requires +5 Force. While Vader present, gains one [Dark Side] icon.  Light: Your docking bay transit from here is free.
front.title: •Profundity: Docking Bay

rulings: If the other docking bay says that Dark's transit is free, Dark would not pay 5 Force for transit.
A starfighter (belonging to <u>either player</u>!) at same system or sector as Profundity may land here.
A starfighter (belonging to <u>either player</u>!) here may take off to same system or sector as Profundity.
If Profundity is lost from table, this site remains on table.

front.gametext: Your starships here with an astromech character aboard are power +1 (or +2 if also at Hoth), immune to Lateral Damage, and may move to systems or sectors as a 'react.'
front.lore: Special-purpose astromech capable of coordinating piloting coordinates and approach angles during combat.
front.title: •R3-A2 (Arthree-Aytoo) (V)

rulings: If at a site, your landed starships there with an astromech character aboard may take off to the system as a react.
R3-A2 himself qualifies as such an astromech aboard a starship at his own location.

front.gametext: Unless a Jedi Master 'communing,' choose: USED: Take Obi-Wan's Hut, Obi-Wan's Journal, or a card with 'mentor' in title into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: During battle, if non-[Episode I] Obi-Wan with a Dark Jedi (or 'communing'), add one battle destiny.
front.lore: 'Where did you dig up that old fossil?' 'I don't think he exists anymore.' 'Surely he must be dead by now.' 'I can't believe he's gone.' 'Oh, he's not dead, not yet.' Obi's back!
front.title: Return Of A Jedi (V)

rulings: This Interrupt may be played when Master Kenobi (a Jedi Knight, not a Jedi Master) is communing.

front.gametext: Dark: May not be separated from Slave Quarters. Light: Once per turn, may deploy Shmi or [Tatooine] C-3PO here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Tatooine: Skywalker Hut

rulings: May deploy if Slave Quarters not on table.
Must be deployed adjacent to Slave Quarters if it is on table.
Sites may not be deployed between Slave Quarters and Skywalker Hut if they are both on table.
Expand The Empire completely ignores 'may not be separated' text - it does NOT get expanded.

front.gametext: Dark:  Light: Deploys only as a starting location. If you just chose My Father Has It on your [Skywalker] Epic Event, deploy Your Thoughts Dwell On Your Mother from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Tatooine: Slave Quarters (V)

pulls: Your Thoughts Dwell On Your Mother
rulings: Cannot be deployed by another card (such as an Objective or Starting Interrupt).

front.gametext: USED: Move your [Episode VII] Jedi as a 'react.' STARTING: If The Galaxy May Need A Legend on table, deploy Be With Me and up to two Effects that deploy on table, deploy for free, and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: The Destiny Of A Jedi

rulings: The Used function moves an Ep7 Jedi to a battle (or Force drain) just initiated by the opponent.
The reacting Jedi moves using landspeed (not shuttling or docking bay transit) at normal cost.
The reacting Jedi may disembark a vehicle (or landed starship) before using landspeed, and may embark a vehicle (or landed starship) after using landspeed.

front.errataNotes: E1 version did not have 'Your lightsabers may not be stolen.'
front.gametext: Deploy on table (only at start of game) and choose: My Father Has It: Anakin (and [Episode I] Obi-Wan) I Have It: Luke (and [Set 1] Obi-Wan) You Have That Power, Too: Rey (and [Episode VII] Luke) [Set 16] Anakin is deploy -1. Your total Force generation is +1. You may not deploy Boss Nass' Chambers or Jedi (except Yoda and the chosen characters). If you just initiated battle involving a Skywalker (or if opponent's Sidious just lost from table), may retrieve 1 Force.
front.title: The Force Is Strong In My Family

rulings: My Father Has It: To deploy a Jedi, it must be Yoda, Anakin, or Episode I Obi-Wan. May deploy non-Jedi versions of all characters.
I Have It: To deploy a Jedi, it must be Yoda, Luke, or Set 1 Obi-Wan. May deploy non-Jedi versions of all characters.
You Have That Power, Too: To deploy a Jedi, it must be Yoda, Rey, or Episode VII Luke. May deploy non-Jedi versions of all characters.

combo:
Use one of these starting locations:
  • Ajan Kloss: Training Course
  • Endor: Anakin's Funeral Pyre
  • Tatooine: Slave Quarters (V)

front.gametext: LOST: Peek at the cards in your Force Pile. STARTING: If your starting location was a [Skywalker] site, deploy The Force Is Strong In My Family and two Effects that deploy for free and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •The Rise Of Skywalker

pulls: The Force Is Strong In My Family
rulings: If you used an Objective, you do not have a starting location and cannot play the Starting function of this card.

front.gametext: Deploy on Slave Quarters. Once per turn, may deploy Anakin's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle (or lose 1 Force to deploy it from Lost Pile). If Anakin just drawn for destiny, may take him into hand to cancel and cause a re-draw. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •Your Thoughts Dwell On Your Mother

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Can only deploy Anakin's Lightsaber from your own Lost Pile, not the opponent's Lost Pile.

combo: Master Qui-Gon With Lightsaber + Are You Brain Dead?!
Master Qui-Gon With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience

front.gametext: Permanent weapon is •Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: The lightsaber is an extremely versatile weapon, making a Jedi a rather difficult opponent to slow down. 'This is impossible!'
front.title: •Master Qui-Gon With Lightsaber

combo: Master Windu + Are You Brain Dead?!

front.gametext: During battle, Mace may 'swing' one lightsaber twice. Power +1 for each opponent's character of ability < 2 here. Your clones are forfeit +1 here. Immune to attrition < 6.
front.lore: Jedi Council member.
front.title: •Master Windu

rulings: Each lightsaber swing is a separate top-level action in the weapons segment (meaning the opponent gets an action between swings, you may take other actions between swings, etc).
The second swing may be at the same target or a different target from the first swing.
When using Sorry About The Mess to swing during the control phase, Mace only swings once. If Mace then battles later that turn, he may still swing twice in that battle.

front.gametext: Take an admiral or general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If your admiral is in battle at a system (or your general is in battle at a site), prevent opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny (and if Ackbar or Leia in battle, your total battle destiny is +1). OR Raise your converted location to the top.
front.title: •Rebel Leadership & •Critical Error Revealed

rulings: Admiral Ackbar or General Leia single-handedly enables the second function and grants the bonus +1 as well.
The second function cannot be played with only a non-General Leia. Having an admiral or general is required.
An opponent's card that 'draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise' will circumvent the limit on the second function.

front.gametext: USED: Reveal a random card from your hand to deploy Jedi Council Chamber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: During your move phase, relocate Anakin to Jedi Council Chamber.
front.lore: A Jedi seeks nonviolent solutions to problems, but may fight to preserve the existence of life. An apprentice must learn which battles to fight and which to avoid.
front.title: ••Take A Seat, Young Skywalker

rulings: The first function reveals another card from hand, it may not reveal itself (although it could reveal a 2nd copy of Take A Seat from hand).
If this is the only card in hand, the first function cannot be played.
The first function may only be played during your deploy phase, and only if the Jedi Council Chamber is not already on table.

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Non-lightsaber weapons carried by your non-Jedi characters may not be stolen. During your control phase, if you control a battleground site with a non-unique, non-[Permanent Weapon] blaster present, opponent loses 1 Force. Rebel Artillery is a Lost Interrupt. During your deploy phase, may deploy a blaster from Reserve Deck; reshuffle (or use 2 Force to deploy a non-unique blaster from Lost Pile) on your character at a Death Star site. May not be canceled. [Immune to Alter.]
front.title: •A Good Blaster At Your Side & •Restricted Deployment

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Only causes 1 damage per turn even if Light controls multiple battleground sites with blasters.

front.gametext: If your [Skywalker] Epic Event on table, deploy on table. May deploy Polis Massa from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per game, may simultaneously deploy an unpiloted Azure Angel, Falcon, or Red 5 and matching non-[Maintenance] pilot from hand and/or Reserve Deck; reshuffle. [Immune to Alter].
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Best Starpilot In The Galaxy

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: If no matching pair can be found, opponent only verifies Reserve Deck. A judge may be required to verify combined contents of hand and Reserve Deck to check for a matching pair.
May search Reserve Deck, then decide to deploy a matching pair entirely from hand (this does not trigger verification).
May deploy the matching pair from hand only (without searching Reserve Deck), although that seems rather pointless.
The pilot must deploy aboard the starfighter.

The starfighter may deploy directly to a system or sector, or may deploy aboard a capital starship with capacity (e.g. Home One), or may deploy landed at a site (if normally permitted, e.g. at a docking bay).

front.gametext: LOST: Retrieve Lobot or a droid. OR Draw top card of Used Pile. STARTING: Deploy a mobile site that has a Scomp link, has exactly one [Light Side], and is related to a site on table. Deploy two Effects that deploy for free and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Lobot's direct link with the Cloud City central computer allowed him to efficiently manipulate the floating city's resources.
front.title: Computer Interface (V)

pulls: Death Star: Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor (V)
rulings: First function: Search entire Lost Pile, choose one Lobot or droid card and retrieve it; do not shuffle.
Starting function: May even choose a site that is related to an opponent's site on table.

front.gametext: Light:  If you have more than one character here, you must target one to be lost (cannot be prevented).  Dark:  If you have more than two characters here, you must target one to be lost (cannot be prevented).
front.title: •Death Star II: Turbolift Walkway

rulings: 'Cannot be prevented' refers to cards such as K'lor'slug (V).

front.gametext: Light:  Your stormtroopers here may move to an adjacent site as a 'react.'  Dark:  If you occupy, opponent's Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor game text is canceled.
front.title: •Death Star: Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor (V)

rulings: Light's text allows them to move <u>to</u> a battle or Force drain, not away from a battle.

front.gametext: If opponent just lost a Dark Jedi or leader, take a card into hand from Used Pile; reshuffle. OR If opponent just retrieved Force, opponent loses 1 Force. OR If lightsaber combat or a duel was just initiated, lose 2 Force (3 if during your move phase) to cancel it.
front.lore: Luke had a falling out with his estranged father.
front.title: •Fall Of The Legend (V)

rulings: 2nd function: If opponent is retrieving multiple Force, this may be played after any individual unit of Force retrieval (e.g. opponent is retrieving 2 with Scum And Villainy, may play this after the first Force is retrieved).
3rd function: As the text does not specify otherwise, this may even cancel an epic duel.

cancels: A battle initiated by a First Order starship

front.gametext: Your starships here are power +1. If opponent just initiated battle here with a [First Order] starship, may place Ackbar out of play to cancel that battle. Cancels Lateral Damage (or Overwhelmed) targeting a starship at same system.
front.lore: Mon Calamari leader.
front.title: •Fleet Admiral Gial Ackbar

rulings: Adds 1 to power of the starship he is aboard as a pilot or passenger, in addition to all of your other starships at the same location.
Does not add power to starships while at a starship site (e.g. Home One: War Room).
This card is the same persona as Admiral Ackbar (e.g. for Home One and for Rebel Leadership combo); Admiral Ackbar and Fleet Admiral Gial Ackbar cannot be on table at the same time.

front.gametext: If Watch Your Step on table, deploy on table. Corran is a smuggler. Once per character, when you deploy Corran, Mara, Mirax, or Talon Karrde to a Tatooine location, may take any one card into hand from Used Pile; reshuffle. Once per game, may deploy a [Reflections 2] location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent may not cancel or modify Force drains at battlegrounds where you have two smugglers. [Immune to Alter.]
front.title: •I Must Be Allowed To Speak & •Smuggler's Blues

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Corran is a smuggler in all card states (e.g. loses 1 Force if seized by Dengar (V), deploys +4 to SSA-306's location).

front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy with a Jedi, you lose no more than 1 Force to That Thing's Operational.  Dark:  When deployed, may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect as if from hand.
front.title: •Kef Bir: Oceanic Ruins

pulledBy: The Galaxy May Need A Legend
rulings: The Defensive Shield played via this site does not count towards the number of shields that Dark may play using their Starting Effect's game text.

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. While Wookiee Homestead on table: deploy -1, power +2, immune to attrition < 5 and, if Liswarr at Kashyyyk, your total power is +2 at Kashyyyk sites.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Liswarr

pulledBy: Seeking An Audience (V) (only from Lost Pile)
Yoxgit (V) (only if Liswarr drawn for destiny)
rulings: For Liswarr to provide power +2 at Kashyyyk sites, it must be piloted (not landed). It may be piloted at Kashyyyk system or a Kashyyyk cloud sector.

front.gametext: Take an [Independent] starship into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If your starship (or non-Jedi character) is about to be captured or lost during the weapons segment of a battle, it is hit instead and may not be captured or lost until the damage segment. OR If opponent just played an Interrupt during battle, activate 2 Force.
front.title: •Local Defense & •Put That Down

rulings: Second function: Note the difference between 'captured' and 'seized'. If IG-88 With Riot Gun draws destiny successfully, the character is about to be captured. Light would then play this Interrupt before Dark chooses between the Seize/Escape/Imprison options for capturing.
Third function: Plays during the response step of the opponent's Interrupt action (similar to Sense), after costs have been paid but before the opponent's Interrupt has had its result.

front.errataNotes: Original card started with 'While at a site' (there was no 'alone' requirement). Also, the second-to-last sentence used to say 'Opponent's aliens deploy +1 to same and related Tatooine sites.'
front.gametext: While alone at a site, unless opponent's character of ability > 3 here, reset opponent's total battle destiny here to 0. Once per game, may deploy a lightsaber on Luke from Lost Pile. Opponent's aliens deploy +1 to same site. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Until being reunited with Yoda, Luke suspected that he had completed his training. Has a strong influence on the weak minded.
front.title: •Master Luke (V)

pulls: Pulls the following from Lost Pile only:
rulings: A character excluded from battle such as (Darth Vader affected by Imperial Barrier) is inactive and does not count as a character of ability > 3 for Master Luke (V).
If opponent completes a battle destiny draw and Luke resets the total to 0, opponent may increase attrition (e.g. +1 with Bossk or add a destiny to attrition with Ponda Baba (V)).
If opponent did not complete any battle destiny draws, there is no total for Luke to reset to 0, and opponent cannot increase attrition.
Can only deploy a lightsaber from Lost Pile that is normally allowed to deploy on him (e.g. not Obi-Wan's Lightsaber).

front.gametext: Deploy on a battleground site. When deployed, may take top card of Lost Pile into hand. Opponent may not modify the deploy cost of your characters deploying here. Once per game, may place an Interrupt (except Ghhhk) from opponent's Lost Pile out of play. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
front.title: •Ounee Ta (V)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: If the site is no longer a battleground (e.g. because Presence Of The Force is canceled), this Effect remains and still functions normally.
Third sentence means to ignore any such modifiers on opponent's cards (those cards may be played normally).
May not place the combo card Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us out of play.
May not be deployed if the Ounee Ta Defensive Shield is on table. Likewise, Ounee Ta Defensive Shield may not be played if this Effect is on table.
If deployed by a Starting Interrupt (e.g. The Signal), that Interrupt is not yet in the Lost Pile and cannot be taken into hand.
If deployed during the start of game, may take top card of Lost Pile (if any) into hand. In this case Light's starting hand will have 1 more card than usual.

front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 1 passenger. Power, maneuver, and immunity to attrition +1 for each card stacked on A Useless Gesture (limit +3). While Dash or Leebo piloting, immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Highly modified Corellian Engineering Corporation YT-2400. KonGar KGDefender military grade ion engines. Griffyn/Y2TG hyperdrive. Never boarded by Imperial customs.
front.title: •Outrider (V)

pulledBy: Seeking An Audience (V) (only from Lost Pile)
Yoxgit (V) (only if Outrider (V) drawn for destiny)
rulings: More than 3 cards may still be stacked on A Useless Gesture, they just don't grant any further bonus to Outrider (V).
Even if the +3 bonus has been reached, Outrider (V) may still receive bonuses from other cards (e.g. Special Modifications still adds 2 to maneuver).

front.gametext: Light:  If your Skywalker here, opponent may not draw more than two battle destiny here.  Dark:  If a [Skywalker] Epic Event on table, Force drain -1 here. To move or deploy your starship to here requires +1 Force.
front.title: •Polis Massa

rulings: If Dark is deploying or moving a starship for free, they do not pay +1 Force.
If Dark substitutes a battle destiny draw (e.g. using Watch Your Back!), it does not count towards the limit of two battle destiny draws.

front.gametext: If drawn for destiny, each of your Wookiees is forfeit +1 for remainder of turn. While Wookiee Homestead here, opponent's spies may not deploy here and, once per turn, when your Wookiee wins a battle, may retrieve a Wookiee.
front.lore: Wookiee slave.
front.title: •Sagwa

rulings: When drawn for destiny, increases the forfeit of all of your Wookiees globally (even ones in hand or Life Force).
The phrase 'when your Wookiee wins a battle' refers to a battle anywhere, not just at Sagwa's location.

front.gametext: Light:  During your move phase, your characters may move between here and Cantina for free.  Dark:  If opponent controls Cantina with a smuggler, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Tatooine: Mos Eisley (V)

pulledBy: I Must Be Allowed To Speak & •Smuggler's Blues
rulings: Using the location text to go to/from Cantina is a regular move.

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 3 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Once per game, may retrieve Fly Casual. While alone and piloted by [Endor] Han, immune to attrition and adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Stolen Imperial Lambda-class shuttle. Supposedly carried parts and technical crew. Delivered General Solo's crack team of Rebel scouts to the forest moon of Endor.
front.title: •Tydirium (V)

rulings: This starship is always considered to be stolen (e.g. for Bodhi Rook).
To retrieve Fly Casual, search entire Lost Pile for the card and retrieve it; do not shuffle.
Any Han is a matching pilot, not just [Endor] Han.
This starship is alone at a system or sector as long as you have no other active starships or vehicles there.

front.gametext: Once per game, may use 1 Force to shuffle opponent's Reserve Deck or place opponent's just-played Interrupt out of play. If in battle with Anakin or Luke, may draw one destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's attrition.
front.lore: Counterpart to C-3PO. Spy. Obstinate, headstrong and always full of surprises. R2-D2 was an integral part of Luke Skywalker's rescue plans.
front.title: •Artoo (V)

rulings: Artoo's action to draw destiny and subtract from attrition can only be initiated if attrition exists (opponent successfully completed a battle destiny draw, even if it was a 0).
Artoo's action to draw destiny and subtract from attrition is initiated in the power segment after battle destinies (and any attrition destinies) are drawn.
Artoo's action subtracts from attrition against his owner (Light, assuming he hasn't been stolen).

front.gametext: When deployed, may search your Lost Pile and move one card there to the top of that pile (if that card is a droid, may retrieve it into hand). Once per game, may use 2 Force to target a droid here; for remainder of turn, target's game text is canceled.
front.lore: Anzellan droidsmith. Spice runner.
front.title: •Babu Frik

combo: Blaster Proficiency
Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency

front.gametext: If Alderaan has been 'blown away,' Force drain +1 here. Permanent weapon is Cara's Heavy Blaster Rifle (twice per battle, may target a character or vehicle; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit is cumulatively -3, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Female Alderaanian. Gambler. Trooper.
front.title: •Cara Dune With Heavy Blaster Rifle

rulings: Blaster Proficiency works, but note that it only adds 3 to a single shot, not both shots.

front.gametext: Light: During your move phase, [Episode I] Jedi may move between here and a battleground site. While a Jedi here, opponent's characters deploy +2 here and cancels Force drains at Jedi Council Chamber. Dark:
front.title: •Coruscant: Jedi Temple

rulings: No special location arrangement, it's just an ordinary exterior site. It does not need to be adjacent to the Jedi Council Chamber.
The 'teleport' movement text is a regular move costing 1 Force.
Multiple Episode I Jedi can use the 'teleport' movement text in the same turn.  Each Jedi moving is a separate action, costing 1 Force each.

front.gametext: Deploys -1 to (and power +1 at) a cantina, diner, or night club. When deployed, may take a Jedi here into hand (if a bounty hunter on table, may instead take Obi-Wan into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle). Your aliens here are immune to Stunning Leader.
front.lore: Besalisk information broker.
front.title: •Dexter Jettster

front.gametext: Other Phoenix Squadron characters here are forfeit and defense value +2. Once per game, may retrieve a Phoenix Squadron character into hand. [Set 13] Maul may not modify destiny draws. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Commander, leader, and Padawan.
front.title: •Ezra, Hero Of Phoenix Squadron

rulings: This card is always a member of Phoenix Squadron, even without the objective, thus he could retrieve another copy of himself without playing Zero Hour.
As this Ezra is not a spy, he would require presence or Force icons in order to deploy to Dathomir: Maul's Chambers.

front.gametext: Deploy on Ezra. Once per turn, may return to hand to cancel and redraw a destiny targeting a Rebel here. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > defense value, target hit, its forfeit = 0 and, if target's ability > 4, user is power +2 until end of turn.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Ezra's Blaster Lightsaber

front.gametext: [Pilot] 3. During battle, if another Mandalorian here, opponent's total power is -3. At the end of a battle here, may return Fenn Rau to hand to activate 2 Force (if Fenn Rau won a battle this turn, may also retrieve 1 Force).
front.lore: Mandalorian scout.
front.title: •Fenn Rau

rulings: If Fenn Rau was excluded from the battle, he cannot return to hand.

front.errataNotes: Original Text: Light: Ghost deploys -2 here. While Ghost piloted here, opponent's battle destiny draws are -1 here. Dark: Unless Chimaera or Thrawn here, Force drain -1 here.
front.gametext: Light: Hera deploys -1 here. Once per game, may take This is MY Ship! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Dark: Unless Thrawn here, Force drain -1 here and This Is MY Ship! is [Immune to Sense]. While Lothal converted, gains one [Dark Side] icon.
front.title: •Lothal

rulings: Only follow the 'While Lothal converted' text of the topmost (active) Lothal system card.  It is applicable if there exists one (or more) converted copies of Lothal underneath.
Disregard the text of the copies of Lothal underneath.

front.gametext: Light: If a player controls, their total power is +2 at related locations. Dark: May deploy Thrawn here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.title: •Lothal: Capital City

front.gametext: Light: Ezra deploys -1 (and is immune to attrition) here. Dark:
front.title: •Lothal: Comm Tower E-272 (Ezra's Roost)

front.gametext: Light: Ezra and Kanan deploy -1 here. Unless you occupy, Vader may not deploy here and opponent's characters, vehicles, and starships deploy and move to here for +2 Force. Dark:
front.title: •Lothal: Jedi Temple

rulings: For Dark to transport a group of characters here with Elis Helrot, Dark must use +2 Force (not +2 per character).
EPP Mara could move here for free (Free + 2 = Free).
This site is always placed at a far end. If a Lothal interior site (Imperial Complex) is on table, Jedi Temple goes at the other end.

front.gametext: Light: During battle here, Sabine or Zeb may draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Dark: Unless Tarkin here, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Lothal: Tarkintown

front.gametext: Light: While you control with a Phoenix Squadron character, Vader is power -2 and his weapon destiny draws are -1. Dark: While you control, Ezra is power -2 and may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
front.title: •Malachor

rulings: Can pull Wedge In Red Squadron 1.
Can pull Green Leader In Green Squadron 1 or Tycho In Green Squadron 3.

front.gametext: Light: If your Mandalorian here, Force drain +1 here (+2 if armed with Darksaber). Dark: If your character armed with Darksaber on table, opponent may not deploy (or Force drain) here.
front.title: •Mandalore

front.gametext: If Lothal on table, deploy on table. Chopper, Sabine, and Zeb are deploy -1. Once per turn, may deploy Malachor, Mandalore, or Seelos (or Chopper, Wedge, Zeb, or an A-wing to a Lothal location) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: The heroes of the Rebellion know that where there is life, there is hope.
front.title: •Phoenix Squadron Operations

rulings: When deploying an unpiloted A-wing (e.g. Green Squadron 1 or 3) from Reserve Deck, it may be deployed simultaneously with a pilot from hand.
When deploying a pilot (e.g. Wedge) from Reserve Deck, it may <u>not</u> be deployed simultaneously with a starship from hand.

front.gametext: Deploy on table. At your battlegrounds, you initiate battles for free. At sites where you have two aliens of the same species, all immunity to attrition is canceled. Once per turn, if you have more battlegrounds on table than opponent, subtracts 1 from deploy cost of your alien being deployed. Opponent may use 3 Force to cancel Gungan Energy Shield. [Immune to Alter.]
front.title: •Steady, Steady & •Bargaining Table

rulings: Subtracting 1 from deploy cost happens automatically if the conditions are met.

front.gametext: Peek at up to X cards from the top of your Reserve Deck, where X = number of your Lothal sites on table; take one into hand and shuffle your Reserve Deck. OR Cancel an attempt to target your starship with a weapon or tractor beam.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •This Is Our Rebellion

front.gametext: Deploy or move a Jawa as a 'react' (for -1 Force). OR If a battle was just initiated where you have three Jawas, choose: Use a magnetic suction tube. OR Each of your Jawas and sandcrawlers there are power and forfeit +1 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Jawa trade language word for 'Come here!' Jawas work communally and scavenge for equipment.
front.title: Utinni! (V)

rulings: If deploying a Jawa that normally costs Force from both players, both players pay -1.
When counting Jawas at a location, remember that Offworld Jawas counts as 1 Jawa, not 3.
To use a magnetic suction tube during battle, the magnetic suction tube must be participating in the battle.
The target of the magnetic suction tube has already participated in the battle, and thus cannot be battled again in the same turn after being slurped to a sandcrawler site.

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Unless this card upright, characters here are lost. If you just Force drained or initiated battle, rotate this card 90° clockwise; if now upright, retrieve any one card. If opponent just initiated battle, unless this card upright, rotate it 90° counterclockwise.
front.lore: The metal rods extending from the bottom of Cloud City are part of the city's flotation system. Sensors detect the velocity of wind and the content of local clouds.
front.title: •Weather Vane (V)

rulings: This Effect only retrieves a card when rotated clockwise into an upright position, not when rotated counterclockwise.
Can rotate multiple times in a single turn or single phase.

back.gametext: Zero Hour: Deploy Lothal system and a Lothal site. For remainder of game, Menace Fades and Projection Of A Skywalker are canceled. Jedi (except Ahsoka and Kanan), Resistance characters, and [Resistance] starships are deploy +1. Chopper, Ezra, Hera, Kanan, Sabine, and Zeb gain Phoenix Squadron. Once per turn, may deploy a Lothal site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if Rebels control three Lothal locations (or you occupy three Lothal locations with Phoenix Squadron characters) and opponent controls no Lothal locations. Liberation Of Lothal: While this side up, if you Force drained at a battleground this turn, your other Force drains at battlegrounds are +1. Once per turn during battle, may add or subtract X from a just drawn battle destiny (or opponent's weapon destiny), where X = number of battlegrounds you occupy with Phoenix Squadron characters. At Lothal system, the number of battle destiny draws may not be limited for either player. Flip this card if opponent controls more Lothal locations than you.
back.title: Zero Hour / Liberation Of Lothal

front.gametext: Zero Hour: Deploy Lothal system and a Lothal site. For remainder of game, Menace Fades and Projection Of A Skywalker are canceled. Jedi (except Ahsoka and Kanan), Resistance characters, and [Resistance] starships are deploy +1. Chopper, Ezra, Hera, Kanan, Sabine, and Zeb gain Phoenix Squadron. Once per turn, may deploy a Lothal site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Flip this card if Rebels control three Lothal locations (or you occupy three Lothal locations with Phoenix Squadron characters) and opponent controls no Lothal locations. Liberation Of Lothal: While this side up, if you Force drained at a battleground this turn, your other Force drains at battlegrounds are +1. Once per turn during battle, may add or subtract X from a just drawn battle destiny (or opponent's weapon destiny), where X = number of battlegrounds you occupy with Phoenix Squadron characters. At Lothal system, the number of battle destiny draws may not be limited for either player. Flip this card if opponent controls more Lothal locations than you.
front.title: Zero Hour / Liberation Of Lothal

rulings: For both sides of this objective, if Light occupies a location and Light has Chopper there, then they 'occupy with a Phoenix Squadron character'.

For both sides of this objective, a character piloting a Phoenix Squadron starship (like Ghost or Phantom) is a Phoenix Squadron pilot and therefore is a 'Phoenix Squadron character'. (A passenger is not, unless they happen to be a gunner such as Finn.)
(7-side) First sentence needs a completed force drain, a canceled force drain will not grant the +1 Force drain bonus.

(7-side) During battle at Lothal system, players may initiate an action that would limit battle destiny draws, such as taking a card off I Don't Like Sand or playing the limiting function on Imperial Command & In Range.  The limit is simply ignored.

front.gametext: USED: Target your Mandalorian that was just 'hit' by a character weapon. Opponent chooses: Restore target to normal or the character that fired the weapon is also 'hit.' LOST: Once per game, if your Mandalorian is in battle, add 2 to a just drawn destiny.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: Beskar Deflection

rulings: Initiating the Used function is an attempt to hit a character and can be canceled by Oh, Switch Off.
The Used function cannot be initiated against a card that is already protected by an earlier usage of Oh, Switch Off.

front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Once per game, if your [Reflections II] or [Skywalker] site on table, may deploy Han or Chewie aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While Han or Chewie piloting, immune to attrition < 5 (< 7 if both).
front.lore: Modified YT-1300 freighter. Owned by Lando Calrissian until won by Han in a sabacc game. 26.7 meters long. 'She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts.'
front.title: •Millennium Falcon (V)

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.gametext: Light: While Qui-Gon 'communing,' opponent's [Reflections II] objective targets Anakin instead of Luke. Dark: Dark Jedi are power +1 here. Jedi are power +2 here. Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Generator (V)

front.gametext: While on Death Star (even if imprisoned): Force drain +1 where you have a Rebel stormtrooper, Leia may not be transferred, moves using landspeed for free, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and her game text may not be canceled.
front.lore: Princess Leia Organa. Alderaanian senator. Targeted by Vader for capture and interrogation. The Dark Lord Of The Sith wanted her alive.
front.title: •Prisoner 2187 (V)

rulings: Prisoner 2187 (V)'s text works while in prison, but does not work while she is an escorted captive.

front.gametext: Plays on table. At end of a turn, if opponent has 15 or more cards in hand, may use 2 Force to shuffle all but 9 (random selection) into Used Pile. If Monnok or Drop! just targeted your hand, may reveal 2 cards from hand; they cannot be removed or checked for duplicates.
front.lore: Being sent to dispose of two Jedi is the battle droid equivalent of a really bad day at the office.
front.title: •Thrown Back (V)

rulings: A player may view cards that are being removed from their own hand.
When 2 cards are revealed to prevent them from being placed in Used Pile, the hand will still be reduced to the size required by Drop! or Monnok.

If a player has 2 of the same card and reveals 1 to prevent it from being checked for duplicates, the other copy is not lost. If a player has 3 of the same card and reveals 2 of them, the other copy is not lost. If a player has 3 of the same card and reveals only 1 of them, the other 2 are duplicates of each other and are lost.

front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent astromech aboard is •BB-8. If Poe piloting, may lose 1 Force to cancel a just drawn weapon destiny targeting this starship. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Blank.
front.title: •BB-8 In Black Squadron 1 (AI)

front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Falcon. While 'hit,' draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is •Chewbacca's Bowcaster (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Wookiee smuggler.
front.title: •Chewie With Bowcaster (AI)

front.gametext: Light:  Your starfighters take off and land here for free.  Dark:  Your gangsters and scavengers deploy -1 here.
front.title: •Jakku: Niima Outpost Shipyard (AI)

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Deploy -1 to Jakku. When piloting, adds one battle destiny. Anything he pilots is immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader.
front.title: •Poe Dameron (AI)

front.gametext: Light:  While opponent occupies, Stardust (and any character it is on) may not move from here.  Dark:  All immunity to attrition (and Ephant Mon's game text) here is canceled.
front.title: •Scarif: Data Vault (AI)

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys -1 to Falcon. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Adds one battle destiny if with Chewie or Rey. Once per game, may play an Interrupt from Lost Pile as if from hand (then place that card out of play).
front.lore: Smuggler.
front.title: •Solo (AI)

front.gametext: May deploy without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Adds one [Light Side] icon here.
front.lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.
front.title: •Tantive IV (V) (AI)

back.gametext: May not be placed in Reserve Deck. If Falcon about to leave table, place it out of play. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While [Episode VII] Han or Rey piloting, maneuver +2 and immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if both). Once during your move phase, if at a site, may flip this card (even if unpiloted).May not be placed in Reserve Deck. If Falcon about to leave table, place it out of play. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to Trample and Unsalvageable, even if unpiloted. While Finn or Rey aboard, immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if both). Once during your move phase, if piloted, may flip this card.
back.lore: Han's 'special modifications' for Millennium Falcon included security mechanisms, deflector shields, hull plating, faster hyperdrive and enhanced weapons. Enclosed.
back.title: •The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage / •The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage (AI)

front.gametext: May not be placed in Reserve Deck. If Falcon about to leave table, place it out of play. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While [Episode VII] Han or Rey piloting, maneuver +2 and immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if both). Once during your move phase, if at a site, may flip this card (even if unpiloted).May not be placed in Reserve Deck. If Falcon about to leave table, place it out of play. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to Trample and Unsalvageable, even if unpiloted. While Finn or Rey aboard, immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if both). Once during your move phase, if piloted, may flip this card.
front.lore: The Millennium Falcon's well-known reputation is favorable not only for its captain and first mate, but for the Alliance as well.
front.title: •The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage / •The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage (AI)

pulledBy: Old Allies / We Need Your Help
rulings: If Falcon is about to be lost, it is not possible to send it to a docking bay with I'll Take The Leader. The Falcon would go out of play first.
When Falcon flips to the vehicle side, any starship weapons are lost (even Concussion Missiles, which deploys on a freighter).

When Falcon flips to the vehicle side, any Devices or Effects (of any kind) which use a clause of their deployment text to deploy on and/or target the Falcon as a starship, are lost unless that same deployment clause can also target vehicles. Do not recheck any other deployment conditions.

Similar logic to the above two rulings applies when flipping Falcon to the starship side (i.e. lose vehicle weapons, lose any Devices or Effects of any kind unless the deployment clause can also target a starship).
Flipping from starship to vehicle causes attached Mynocks to detach.

combo: Commander Cody + Captain Rex

front.gametext: Your clones deploy -1 here. While at an [Episode I] battleground site, adds one battle destiny. Permanent weapon is •Twin Blasters (may target a character for free; draw two destiny; target hit and forfeit -3 if total destiny -2 > defense value).
front.lore: Leader. Clone trooper.
front.title: •Captain Rex, 501st Legion (Holo AI)

rulings: This weapon is a blaster (e.g. for Blaster Proficiency).

front.gametext: If you just moved a droid to Audience Chamber, deploy on table. You may not cancel battles. Force loss from Or Be Destroyed may not be reduced and is limited to 3. While Han with your non-'hit' Chewie, Lando, or Luke, Han may not be targeted by weapons. [Immune to Control.]
front.lore: 'As a token of my good will, I present to you a gift: these two droids. Both are hardworking and will serve you well.'
front.title: •A Gift (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on Han or a Wookiee. Once per game, when deployed, may take any one card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle. If on Chewie, may place this device in Used Pile to cancel a just drawn destiny targeting the ability or defense value of a Wookiee here.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Han's Medal

front.errataNotes: Original card said 'just drawn destiny' so it worked on any destiny drawn during a battle.
front.gametext: If Obi-Wan 'communing,' deploy on table. Once per battle, may activate 1 Force or add 1 to a just drawn battle destiny. Once per game, if a battle at a Tatooine site just ended, may 'revive' (return to that site from Lost Pile) a Rebel forfeited from that site this turn. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Even though Luke felt the pain of losing his mentor, Obi-Wan continued to give him strength and guidance through the Force.
front.title: •I Can't Believe He's Gone (V)

rulings: It is not possible to revive a character and forfeit them again in the same battle.
A character who has been made 'forfeit = 0' can still be forfeited, and therefore, can still be revived.
The revived character is a 'fresh copy' unaffected by any previously applied status effects such as 'forfeit = 0' or 'game text canceled for remainder of turn'.
The revived character could even battle again this turn (e.g. by moving to another site with Nabrun Leids and battling there).
Can only revive the exact card that was forfeited, not another copy of that card or persona.

front.gametext: If an [A New Hope] objective on table, deploy on table. Twice per game, may take Mon Mothma or any general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During your first turn, while Stolen Data Tapes at Dune Sea, [Set 1] Obi-Wan deploys -6 there. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: 'General Solo, is your strike team assembled?'
front.title: •Strike Planning (V)

front.gametext: If His Destiny on table, choose: USED: If a character of ability > 4 was just 'hit' during battle, opponent loses 1 Force. OR Peek at the bottom card of your Force Pile; may move it to the top of that pile. LOST: Cancel game text of a Dark Jedi with Luke for remainder of turn.
front.lore: It had been decades since Vader had felt the sting of an enemy's blade.
front.title: •A Jedi's Fury

front.gametext: If Credits Will Do Fine on table, deploy on Mos Espa. Opponent's first Force lost to a Force drain here is stacked on Credits Will Do Fine. If you just deployed Amidala, Jar Jar, or a Jedi here, may take Either Way, You Win into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: In unfamiliar and potentially hostile territory, Qui-Gon knew that success would require patience and caution.
front.title: •A Remote Planet (V)

front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting a [Clone Army] capital starship, adds one battle destiny and its power may not be reduced by opponent. While with Anakin (or while piloting Resolute), opponent may not cancel or substitute battle destiny draws here.
front.lore: Leader.
front.title: •Admiral Yularen

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys only to Skywalker Hut or Watto's Junkyard. During battle, may cause a 'credit' to be lost to choose: if with Obi-Wan, add one destiny to total power; if with Qui-Gon, add one battle destiny; if with Shmi, add one destiny to attrition.
front.lore: Mechanic.
front.title: •Anakin Skywalker, Junkyard Slave

front.gametext: LOST: Cancel an attempt to 'choke' (or target with Force Lightning) your character of ability > 4. STARTING: If He Is The Chosen One on table, deploy His Destiny and two Effects that deploy for free and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'A vergence, you say?'
front.title: •Anakin's Destiny

front.gametext: Light: During your move phase, a pair of [Clone Army] characters may move between here and a site you occupy. Dark: Deploys only to same planet as Clone Command Center. Your droids are power +1 here.
front.title: <>Assembly Area

front.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah system. Your Force retrieval is canceled. Your [Dagobah] characters deploy -1 to Dagobah. Your training destiny draws are +1. Jedi Test #2 may not move. Jedi Test #4 searches your Reserve Deck for free. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: To recover from the strenuous Jedi training routine and revitalize the mind and body, an apprentice must rest to be calm and at peace.
front.title: •At Peace (V)

front.gametext: If a Christophsis location on table, deploy on table. Once per turn, if you just deployed a clone to Christophsis, may draw top card of Used Pile. Once per turn, if your clone in battle with a Jedi or Padawan, may lose 1 Force to add one destiny to total power. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Battle Of Christophsis

front.gametext: If a Geonosis location on table, deploy on table. Once per battle, may deploy or move a clone as a 'react' to same location as your Jedi or Padawan. While your clone in battle with a Jedi or Padawan, opponent's total battle destiny is -1 (-2 if Yoda in battle). [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Battle Of Geonosis

front.gametext: Light: If you occupy with a [Clone Army] starship, opponent must use +1 Force to move or deploy a starship to here. Dark: If you control with a [Separatist] starship, opponent must use +1 Force to move or deploy a starship to here.
front.title: •Christophsis

front.gametext: Light: Your total power here is +1 for each of your piloted starships at Christophsis system. Dark: Force drain -1 here. Ventress is power +2 here.
front.title: •Christophsis: Chaleydonia

front.gametext: Light: Deploys only if a [Clone Army] objective on table. Once per turn, may deploy a Kamino site or [Clone Army] battleground from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Dark:
front.title: <>Clone Command Center

front.gametext: Adds 2 to power and 1 to defense value of anything he pilots. While piloting a [Clone Army] starship or [Clone Army] vehicle, forfeit +1 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. If stacked face up on Cloning Cylinders, may turn him face down to cancel Lateral Damage.
front.lore: Clone trooper.
front.title: Clone Pilot

front.gametext: If your [Coruscant] objective on table, deploy on table. If you just initiated a Force drain (or won a battle) at Watto's Junkyard, opponent loses 1 Force (cannot be reduced) and stacks lost card here face down. Cards stacked here are `credits.' [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: 'No, they won't!'
front.title: •Credits Will Do Fine (V)

front.gametext: If [Tatooine] or [Coruscant] Qui-Gon in battle, he is power +1 for each `credit.' OR Once per game, if a battle just initiated at Watto's Junkyard involving Qui-Gon, target a character. Lightsabers may not be fired this battle. Unless target is Watto or a Dark Jedi, cancel target's game text.
front.lore: 'Deal!'
front.title: •Either Way, You Win (V)

front.gametext: May add 5 pilots, 5 passengers, 5 vehicles, and 5 starfighters. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Kilian, Mace, and clones deploy -1 aboard and shuttle from here for free. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Endurance

front.gametext: USED: If The Hyperdrive Generator's Gone on table, take Skywalker Hut or Jar Jar into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: If opponent's card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, for remainder of turn, your Force drains may not be reduced.
front.lore: In the end, Watto finally came to understand the agony of defeat.
front.title: •Eventually You'll Lose (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Unique (•) [Clone Army] capital starships are deploy -1 and immunity to attrition +1. Once per turn, may reveal a [Clone Army] starship from hand to take an [Episode I] pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Galactic Republic Navy

front.gametext: For remainder of turn, your clones are armor +2. OR Cancel You Are Beaten. OR If your clone in battle, cancel an attempt by opponent to target your character to be lost. [Immune to Sense.] OR If you just drew a clone for destiny, add 1 to that destiny.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: Generation One Armor Always Holds Up

front.gametext: Light: Your [Clone Army] starships are power +1 here. Your starships at the nearest related asteroid sector may move here as a `react.' Dark: Unless your Fett (or [Separatist] starship) here or at a related asteroid sector, Force drain -1 here.
front.title: •Geonosis

front.gametext: Light: Your [Clone Army] characters and [Clone Army] vehicles are power +1 here. Dark: Your [Separatist] characters and [Separatist] vehicles are power +1 here.
front.title: •Geonosis: Badlands Of N'g'zi

front.gametext: Deploy on table. Imperial Barrier is a Lost Interrupt. If no card stacked here, may stack one Interrupt just played here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here. Once per game, may shuffle any deck or pile. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Stormtrooper utility belts contain basic tools such as a grappling hook to grab onto protrusions. The hook can also be used to ensnare escaping targets.
front.title: Grappling Hook (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on a battleground. [Clone Army] Jedi deploy -1 here. If you just won a battle (or just Force drained here), relocate this card to your [Clone Army] objective. If opponent just won a battle, opponent may relocate this Effect to an [Episode I] battleground. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Grievous Will Run And Hide

front.gametext: If He Is The Chosen One on table, deploy on table. Opponent's total Force generation is -1 (and your total power everywhere is +1) for each [Endor] or [Death Star II] battleground you occupy (limit 2). Once per turn, if a card was just stacked on I Feel The Conflict, may peek at the top two cards of your Reserve Deck; take one into hand and shuffle your Reserve Deck. May lose 2 Force to cancel You Are Beaten or an attempt to steal Luke's Lightsaber. During your move phase, may turn a card stacked on I Feel The Conflict face up to relocate Luke between a battleground site and your Death Star II site.
front.title: •His Destiny

back.gametext: Hunt For The Droid General: Deploy a [Clone Army] battleground, Clone Command Center (to same planet), Cloning Cylinders, and Grievous Will Run And Hide. For remainder of game, you may not deploy non-[Episode I] cards with ability. [Reflections II] objectives target Anakin instead of Luke. Your Destiny is suspended. Jedi gain [Pilot] skill. Your [Episode I] sites are immune to No Escape. At end of opponent's turn, if you occupy more battlegrounds than opponent, opponent loses 1 Force. Flip this card if Grievous Will Run And Hide here unless Grievous alone at a battleground. He's A Coward: While this side up, your Force drains are +1 where you have a clone with a Jedi or Padawan. X = number of battlegrounds your [Clone Army] cards occupy. If you just initiated a battle: peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck or Used Pile (may take it into hand or place it on bottom of Reserve Deck), then if X > 1, retrieve a [Clone Army] card into hand, then if X > 2, your clone may make a regular move (using landspeed for free) to the battle location. Flip this card if Grievous Will Run And Hide at a battleground or Grievous alone at a battleground.
back.title: Hunt For The Droid General / He's A Coward

front.gametext: Hunt For The Droid General: Deploy a [Clone Army] battleground, Clone Command Center (to same planet), Cloning Cylinders, and Grievous Will Run And Hide. For remainder of game, you may not deploy non-[Episode I] cards with ability. [Reflections II] objectives target Anakin instead of Luke. Your Destiny is suspended. Jedi gain [Pilot] skill. Your [Episode I] sites are immune to No Escape. At end of opponent's turn, if you occupy more battlegrounds than opponent, opponent loses 1 Force. Flip this card if Grievous Will Run And Hide here unless Grievous alone at a battleground. He's A Coward: While this side up, your Force drains are +1 where you have a clone with a Jedi or Padawan. X = number of battlegrounds your [Clone Army] cards occupy. If you just initiated a battle: peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck or Used Pile (may take it into hand or place it on bottom of Reserve Deck), then if X > 1, retrieve a [Clone Army] card into hand, then if X > 2, your clone may make a regular move (using landspeed for free) to the battle location. Flip this card if Grievous Will Run And Hide at a battleground or Grievous alone at a battleground.
front.title: Hunt For The Droid General / He's A Coward

front.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to steal a weapon from target character using a non-[Episode I] card, must first draw destiny. Unless destiny +1 > target's ability, attempt fails and stealing card is placed out of play. [Episode I] blasters are immune to An Entire Legion Of My Best Troops.
front.lore: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.
front.title: •Only Jedi Carry That Weapon (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode I] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value. While at Watto's Junkyard, Undercover spies here are lost.
front.lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.
front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (V)

front.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode I] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value. While at Watto's Junkyard, Undercover spies here are lost.
front.lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.

front.gametext: May add 5 pilots, 5 passengers, 5 vehicles, and 5 starfighters. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. While Anakin or Yularen piloting, immune to attrition < 5 and your [Clone Army] cards at related sites are power +1.
front.lore: Blank
front.title: •Resolute

front.gametext: Deploy on a location. At same battleground, opponent may not cancel or reduce your Force drains here. You initiate battles here for free. If you just initiated battle here, may draw top card of Reserve Deck. Total battle destiny and forfeit values may not be increased here.
front.lore: Specialized scanner technicians examine scanner output to identify the presence of life forms. Experienced operators can even identify species and gender.
front.title: Scanner Techs (V)

front.gametext: If your [Episode I] objective on table, deploy on table. Your Republic characters of ability < 4 are forfeit +1. Game text of your clones may not be canceled. Once per turn, may deploy an [Episode I] weapon on your character present at a site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Actions borne of the love for one's planet can heavily outweigh those generated from simple battle orders.
front.title: •Security Control (V)

front.gametext: Light: Once during opponent's turn, if your clone here with a Jedi or Padawan, may activate 1 Force. Dark: Deploys only to same planet as Clone Command Center. Your vehicles are power +1 here.

front.gametext: Light: If you occupy, may deploy [Tatooine] A Remote Planet here. Dark: While Mos Espa converted, your Force generation is +2 here.
